38672783.review:
I read the reviews and watched the trailer. I was interested in this game and its unique approach to survival horror. You probably know about it yourselves by Now. Top down view with limited lines of sight. Brilliant concept. The game looks gorgeous, the atmosphere immersive, the attention to detail in sound design epic, from every floorboard creak to snap of a twig in the woods which makes you spin around to see if somethings following. I loved it.

After the first hour or so, I was sceptical. Combat felt clunky, and I was left frustrated by getting killed so easily. But I slowly learnt to appreciate this game. Those first nights, cowering in the corner of a dimly lit room with nothing but a plank of wood to defend myself with. While in the room next door, I can hear doors opening and the creaking of the house as something is moving ever closer. The door, slowly swings open, and rather than some horrendous monstrosity standing in the doorway, a dog pauses to stare at me. To myself, I think low level enemy that I will beat easy, before it tears me to shreds.

By day 12 now, I spend my daylight hours wisely. Progressing the storyline at a steady pace. Collecting materials to craft traps, weapons and other items with. I learn that the best approach is respecting the unknown but not fearing the unknown to the point where I am paralysed and run around in circles. The clock is ticking, and you better be ready for the night. Back at camp, I board up the windows, set bear traps, block doors with furniture, stock up on flares and petrol, and take a stand with my pitchfork. No longer do I worry about dogs. Instead I am assaulted by all sorts of horrors of the night as furniture randomly moves, and spectres of the night fly through walls, and wailing beasts spot me through windows to come smashing through. I hang on for dear life until the sun rises, and prepare to go at it again.

38643710.review:
I am a frail mortal, my heart is pounding.
I stand here, in the corner of this ramshackle house.
The windows are hastily borded with half-rotted wood and bent nails.
My every thought is a prayer for morrning. 
My heart is pounding.
A knock on the front door reverberates through the ruined house.
I'm too afraid to even walk into the other room, let alone opening the door.
It would be suicide.
The knocking stops.
My bedroom door is slowly nudged open.
My heart is pounding.
The makeshift club, nails protruding from it, trembles in my sweaty hands.
I take one step after another, every one slowly, and every one forced.
My weapon raised, I fly open the door, ready to swing.
Nothing is there. Nothing I can see.
A woman screams behind me, I spin around. She is translucent.
My heart is pounding.
She's on my bed, sobbing, begging to leave this nightmare.
A creak behind me, I swing my weapon with everything I have.
It finds only air. I turn, and the woman is gone.
I sprint back to my corner and wait and pray and wait and pray for morning.
Pray. Pray. Pray for the light to shine through the cracks in the boarded up windows.
The waiting is the worst part.
My heart is still pounding.
Morning finally comes. I heave a heavy sigh of relief.
I am alive for another day.
But there's no time to sleep, I need supplies.
More wood, gas, nails and bandages.
I will not die here.
By day I am hunted by the real, by night; the surreal.
That which dwells here is beyond comprehension.
And this is their playground.
I am in Hell. I am in Darkwood.

10/10
That's the genuine feeling this game gives you. This game is downright gold. And it's terrifying. It's a ton of fun too. It feels like a perfect mix of Silent Hill and Lovecraft. The top down view can actually be very scary, especially with the limited field of view. You're constantly searching around you, hoping nothing is there. What really makes this game shine is the audio, which is probably one of the scariest parts of the game. Immerse yourself as much as possible, I have a great surround sound headset, and I play with the lights off most times. I can't reccomend both enough. There's no voice acting, but that doesn't subtract anything one bit. It might actually make it even better, as your mind comes up with scarier voice acting in your head. The combat, like everyone else says, is a bit clunky, but it really feels like you're truly fighting for your life in almost a Dark Souls-esque fashion. I can't recommend this game enough. I love how messed up it is. It's the stuff of nightmares.

If you made it this far thank you for reading my awful writing! 
And you should totally buy this game.

38639947.review: If you're a fan of surival horror games and been looking for something to fill the void that stalker left. I'd suggest this game. So what's it like? It's like a better darker version of don't starve. There's a lot of macabre horror and eldrich abominations. This game is tense, it's very tense. When it's pitch black outside and you're holed up in your house and you hear a knock on the door after minutes of silence it can be freaky. What's even scarier is when the monster breaks through the door crawling around dragging several beartraps you laid. I've been playing it for five hours so far and I didn't expect to like it as much as I did. It does everything that don't starve does but with better atmosphere and more polish in my opinion. If you're a fan of horror games and like exploring dark desolate wastelands with a difficulty curve try this game it's worth it. Just don't go out at night.

38624754.review:
so, to start this off im gonna be honest.
i torrented the game at first. after seeing a video review i just had to try it
after starting the game i already got sucked in by the atmosphere set.

i personally dont like top down games or twinstick shooters. and when it comes to gameplay this is basicly both.
but, i love survival horror. and after having completed this gem i can safely say that this might be the single most tense survival horror game i ever had the pleasure to experience. the locations, the visuals, the music. they all work together to give you a certain feeling of uneasiness.

your character only has a limited vision cone so you will often find yourself looking around just to make sure you are safe.
one genious thing the devs did with this is that sometimes the things outside the vision cone will look differently then when you look at them. for example, theres this house that looks ok when your character doesnt look at it. but once you look at it you will see how decrepid the building is. this goes the other way around as well. the disturbing visuals are often hidden until your character looks at it.

so, i torrented it but had to buy it. if my friends ever say they are interrested in this game i will buy it for them as well.
if i can throw more money towards this game then i will.

also. as a true survival horror game, you can either complete it within a few hours. or get lost in the world and its inhabitants and play it for up to 40-50 hours

38578581.review:
Hard to write a review for a game like this, as I really have no "standard" to go by in determining whether this is a great game or not. I will use this game as a standard of its own, it is one of those must play games on Steam, due to how incredibly unique it is and the essence of the game. 

I really do not get scared easily, I enjoy horror games and films, but this game just kept me on the edge. This is due to being able to see behind you, but not being able to see behind you. I had a hard time not turning around multiple times within every couple steps or so.

You truly feel isolated as well, alone and without help.

All the characters have a very uneasy appearance to them as well. Even though they were some of the only things to not kill you on sight, I was still afraid of them. 

Art, music, and sound effects blend beautifully, this is what gives you that uneasy feeling the whole playthrough.

Game is tough to start off, you learn but may take some trial and error, atleast in my case.

Darkwood pulls off this freakish vibe really well too, I was creeped out by just about everything. Truly takes creativity to just come up with some of these things.

Not going to touch the story or typical aspects of games as I felt this game shined in many other aspects apart from the story, gameplay, and content.

Give the game a try, it really is unique and offers an experience I have not had before.

38400937.review:
A great horror story ruined by terrible combat. This game really does a great job at building tension, especially with the sound. Be prepared to get all shivering in the corner like a lamb perfectly aware that you are doomed and it's just a matter of time that the wolf will show up at the door with a grin. That's the good part, the 'they are coming' type of horror. 
The bad part is, you will get equally frustrated with the combat. It's so annoying that I can't swiftly switch between weapons. There are just so many restrictions: 
1. Press num button (scrolling is so slow, it's out of question) 
2. Mustn't be running 
3. Can't switch if you have just done a melee attack and haven't recovered to the normal stance 
These might sound simple. But trust me, it's gonna be completely chaos in real combat. Once enemies start lunging at you, you will have to spend most attention on moving to avoid them, and will never be sure if you have actually switched weapon or not. You press the num button and still find yourself holding an empty gun. So you are bound to get scratched unless you see the enemy first and move in after switching to the appropriate weapon. And by scratch, I mean half your life bar if you are lucky.

Люди абсорбированы деревьями, жуткие мутированные люди и сошедшие с ума сельские жители от этой заразы и это еще не все обитатели темнолесья. Ну а правдивая концовка дает понять что не все так просто как кажется, и это пугает.

38368312.review:
非常值得玩的一款黑暗风格的恐怖游戏，音乐渲染恐怖气氛非常到位，以至于在玩的时候只想快速通关，游戏没有过多的教程，剧情也全靠玩家一点点探索，如果有不知道怎么走剧情的可以看看接下来提到的剧情走向。

----------------------------汉化方面可以搜索 阴暗森林 贴吧，有比3DM更好的汉化-----------------------------

1.新手玩家推荐不要跳过序章，首先是有成就拿，而且也是最开始需要了解的基础操作！
2.之后扮演男主，进行森林探索，遇到狼人。
3.狼人给主线任务，叫你去 寂静森林 找他【大地图的图二】
4.找到寂静森林的狼人后会叫你去村庄找鸡夫人拿鸡夫人的钥匙
5.鸡夫人有两个分支，钥匙交给村庄的音乐家，或者交给狼人
6.钥匙交给狼人，狼人直接带你去以前的医生住处。
6.5钥匙交给音乐家音乐家会叫你去大地图图三找他的父母帮他找小提琴。
==============================================
7.之后就是找到医生，进入第二章
8.第二章分别找到象人一家，垃圾场里找到氧气机零件之后去村庄水池里烧大树进终章。
9.或者找到无线电塔，打通无线电塔可以直接进终章【需要一定的操作，机会只有一次，可以解锁仁慈这个成就】
这两个方法进终章结局会不同
==============================================
10.终章还有个结局，就是回家去地下室扭收音机，之后回楼上的家
【往前跑一段，不是第一个可以用钥匙开的，后面那个门有音乐声的】
11.去厨房找到撬棍，然后挖开地板，进入树心，烧毁一切的结局。

38356718.review:
Here's a review that I would have written if this game was realeased in 2000:

Graphics aren't bad, for such a limited top-view game.
Game mechanics are clunky at times and just plain aweful at other times.
It is supposed to be "challenging" but what makes it challenging is the poor mechanics and timing everything so your actions tend to occur a split second after you actually wanted them to.  Then there's the odd and mostly boring night sequence which gives you the choice of using valuable resources to maybe survive and get a tiny reward or simply die and get it over with until morning.
The game tries to be a mysterious journey of discovery but simply fails and the result is a disjointed mess.  I kept hoping the game would get better... and yeah, it did get better, but only slightly.


Here's my review written for today (2017):
Exactly the same as above.  

I couldn't wait to just finish the game and move on to something else.  (Yeah, I'm weird about having to finish something, no matter how bad it is).

38318426.review:
The graphics and controls need work. But everything else about the game is great, so I still recommend it.

Graphics are too blurry, muddy, and confused. Animations are messy, makes fighting hard to see whats going on. The point where the melee weapon animation triggers a hit is hard to make out, as well as weapon and enemy hit boxes. The artistic style is... vague.

As for controls, I tried keyboard and game pad/controller.

The keyboard I need to test more, but the game felt designed for a thumbstick.

The controller has been an awful experience. Turning on run mode with stick sensitivity was a bad choice for this type of game. At least make it an optional choice to instead have a run button. I cannot just turn around with the left stick, he wants to move in that direction as well, makes trying to do precise things like aim attacks awful. Should have a better sensitivity to allow turning without movement. Turning around in place with the left stick bleeds stamina if he enters run mode by stick sensitivity, even though you aren't even running. You can't look behind you when running (bad bad bad choice). Aiming with right stick in combat is jacked because of this.

You set up base within a hideout having to survive the night with whatever you can scavenge thruout the day. The game isnt forgiving and tells you so from the very start, it can be.. at times.. frustrating. I found the controls and movement to be a slight problem in combat, The story isnt the best and even at the end im not entirely sure what was happening, what exactly is this tree that absorbs ppl....... then again, I never was one to follow tales aswell the next. When alls said and done its a real gd game but imo dont buy it if youre looking for a scary game, it has its moments but the main selling point is the item aquiring and base defence. 38257009.review:
Darkwood- это рпг с невероятным(не побоюсь этого слова) сюжетом, удивительной атмосферой в обёртке сурвайвал хоррора. Я долго не решался купить это игру, друг её нахваливал, но я не верил, что она так хороша. Потому, что не любитель выживания и хорроров. В итоге друг не выдержал и подарил её мне. И знаете что? Хорошо, что он это сделал, потому как для меня часы, проведенный в ней, были настолько сильным приключением, что я даже делал перерыв на недельку, чтобы осмыслить и понять, что же происходит в этой вселенной. 
Сюжет и атмосфера, вот те 2 кита на которых держится игра и когда ты начинаешь играть, уже не обращаешь внимания на посредственную графику, вид сверху и собственно элемент выживания. 
Итак, начнём с плюсов:

-Атмосфера. Разруха, упадок, безысходность, лес. Вот те слова, которые сразу приходят на ум. «Полное погружение» достигается с помощью звукового сопровождения(звуки леса, шагов, лая собак) и детализацией окружения(леса, домов и прочего), а также прекрасными картинками-вставками при диалогах и при нахождение предметов лора и квестов. Отдельно стоит выделить ночи, которые нужно пережидать в домах-убежищах, это невероятное по напряжению времяпровождение. Уж поверьте мне! 
«Сны»- отдельные жуткие и пугающие приключения, которые наступают при определенных обстоятельствах(Не буду говорить каких, начнёте играть, поймёте). 

-Выбор. Он здесь присутствует, часто бывает, неочевиден, как и большинство вещей в этой игре. Выбор достаточно тяжелый морально, последствия трудно предсказуемы. Со 2 акта напрямую влияет на финал.

-Сюжет. Самое лучшее, что есть в этой игре. Тут, что- то писать будет спойлером, любой любитель сюжета будет доволен. Скажу только, если хотите понять его до конца, то вам нужна настоящая концовка. Поэтому дам небольшую подсказку, вам нужно . После него, мне реально ночью снился кошмар, настолько глубоко я прочувствовал весь сюжет и атмосферу игры. Без настоящего финала, вы будете пребывать в блаженном неведенье.

Итого: 10 тёмных чомперов из 10. Любителям сюжета и атмосферы рекомендую.

38241816.review:
Looking to satisfy that horror itch? Want to have the living crap scared out of you? Give this game a try.

  Don't think that the game isn't scary because it uses a top-down perspective; the game still manages to be terrifying in many ways despite it. It [i]will[/i] mess with your mind in more ways than one. Hearing sounds that aren't actually there, doors opening despite nothing being behind them, and much more will ensure that you are on trembling in terror, whether its day or night.

  The game's world is randomly generated each playthrough, with locations being different each time (similar to We Happy Few) and no two nights are the same; one night may be calm and uneventful, while the next will have you scrambling to avoid getting swarmed by giant beetles crawling out from beneath the floorboards. The enemies act and look strange and frightening and make you want to keep as far away from them as you possibly can. The enviroment itself is very atmospheric and unnerving, as anything could be hiding behind the trees as you trek through the thickened woodlands.

  And if you're looking for difficulty, this game has plenty. The game itself warns you at the beginning that it won't be holding your hand as you play, and you will die multiple times.

  If you want a good horror and cheap horror game that actually scares you without being dependent on cheap jumpscares, give this one a try. It'll be worth it.

38241257.review: I have not played a horror game like this in a long time. The game has a great story and is good heart racer.

38237569.review: Sem sombra de dúvida, esse é um dos melhores games de survivor horror que já joguei na vida.Uma história muito bem desenvolvida e um mundo totalmente perturbador e diferente de tudo que eu já tinha visto.Arte conceitual é bastante macabra, e causa muito desconforto, o mesmo desconforto que eu sentia quando joguava Amnésia The Dark Descent.Até mesmo cada um dos NPCs tem uma história e quests relacionadas a história e o que cada um é, e cada ação que você faz, desencadeia eventos e muda totalmente o rumo da história.Efeitos sonoros fantásticos, alguns bastante incomodos e que me deu uns "cagaços", uns não, várias e várias vezes.Unica critica que tenho seria não estar em Português.Compre ! Pois vale cada centavo pela experiência diferenciada de terror que ele oferece, sem ficar apelando pra "jumpscares", ele apenas te choca com um visual e efeitos sonoros incriveis.E mais uma coisa, cuidado, muito cuidado com a noite....

38237398.review:
It was hard for me to give this opinion, but to be asked if I recommend this game to my friends, it will be no.

tl:dr, this game has one of the best storyline and dialogue to discover, only to be overshadowed by poor excution of survival game mechanic. The game was neither the horror game or survival game, but is trying to be both at the sametime. Lack of explaination of the game can lead players to have long frustration before figuring out how to even save the game manually.


I am kind of a guy who gets attracted by good writing and story, and this game has one of top 10 favorite stories to tell. Sound effect is excellent, and classy-graphic looks also blends in so well.
Unfortunately the game continuously became frustrating by the survival game mechanics. Despite the game don't have any hunger or thirst, it requires  you to loot as much items before sun sets down, and barricade your home before nightmare strikes. 

First of all, your inventory is incredibly small, even if fully upgraded. Because your weapon could break easily you'll be forced to carry at least 2 different kind of weapons if you want to explore deep into the forrest. You may find some good loot, but then you have to come back to home to put those loot down. This wouldn't be an issue if the daytime is longer than 12-15minutes. You'll constantly be in need to find essential items, such as gasolines, and there aren't enough time to actually interact with major characters to do the sidequest, not to mention that you'll also need to make an extra space to get their key items to interact with.

The game focuses on survival game mechanic- looting, crafting, building. However the game isn't as deep as other survival game, the survival aspect itself won't be as strong enough to stand on its own. You simply need couple items to create tools you need, honestly I could play the game without the crafting mechanic. 

The game also fails to instruct the player how to play the game. I didn't understand how to save the manually until 7th night into the game. The game won't teach you that the traders will sell you the item that you cannot interact with until near the end of the game. The game will not teach you that turning light on will attract more enemies at night despite in the tutorial it state to keep the light on. Lack of instruction of the game does not make the game harder, but only given you more frustration. 

Most sidequest are easy to understand, but some, perhaps many sidequests are given to you without much of a clue, and likely you'll be encountering it without knowing you just triggered some sidequest event. This reminds of me a lot of Fallout3, where you've finished the sidequest location before initiating it, causing a glitch that won't let you progress further. Luckily, this game's sidequest do not interfere with mainquest, therefore you won't get stuck with the game progress. However this issue can be a bothersome for people who tries to complete achievement. You'll also get very small amount of clue to actually understand what you need to do. In short you sort of NEED wiki to actually complete them, otherwise you need to spend a lot of time to understand how these sidequest work. 

Much of like playing Silent Hill 2's hardest riddle level, but with no way of changing the difficulty. e.g. one of the character will give you a numbers for passlock, through the poem it sings, but given only 1 chance to read them, and won't even give you a clue for what passlock its for.

In the night phase, you MUST go back to hideout before 8pm, otherwise you'll die. At your hideout, you need to barricade, set a trap, and hide. If you are good at this, you'll be hiding and doing nothing for good 5 minutes. Otherwise you'll be fighting for your death for 5 minutes. It is either or nothing. At first, night phase may excite you with fear. Eventually, though, it gets incredibly boring. Approximately 5 hours out of 27 hours, I did nothing but to wait, waiting the night to be over. This phase get especially boring towards the end, as your inventory would be full of materials and no longer need help from traders, and your death won't even hurt you much. (perhaps this may change in the hardmode, as you'll have set numbers of lives) In addition, the nightphase, despite adding many random event, usually end up being 1-pattern-tactic. If you can figure out how to hide in good position for 1 night, that tactic will work for any night given. It does get very repititive.


Because I loved the story so much, I did finished the game, spending mostly trying to get as much sidequest as possible. Sadly the sidequest that I worked with triggered special event that prevent you from getting final sidequest, I could not get all details that I wanted. I'm likely not going to play Darkwood again for while, because other than the storyline there weren't much exciting aspect from this game. In fact, without the storyline, I could easily imagine myself getting bored within a hour and hit refund button. WIth that being said, I would buy this game if it was on sale. Worth a try, I just won't recommend them to my friends.

38197471.review: Darkwood is a masterfully crafted piece of horror and artwork as a general whole. The game plays quite well and is very smooth, even the firearm mechanics are incredibly smooth and well integrated as a whole. Acid Wizard Studio is a great studio who is quite capable of designing horror without jump scares, the audio quality is absolutely stunning, and everything feels impactful, swing your weapon and you feel like you just swung your weapon it's beautful and excellently put together. As someone who was able to sit down and actually talk with the studio who made this (who is now also my favorite studio) I highly recommend buying this game, and I hope they eventually make some kind of multiplayer for it because it is absolutely a piece of art.

38184491.review:
[h1]Как обычно, неоправданные ожидания портят всю картину. Увидел я отрывок из игры в одном видосе, в котором рассказывали про странных существ из разных игор. Собственно, туда и попала человек-улитка из игры darkwood. Описывали игру, как очень хороший хоррор с элементами выживания против всяких чудищ, при всем этом очень сложную. Хотя мне трудностей и в жизни хватает, я любитель таких игр, сразу стал воображать себе, что это эдакий killing floor разбавленный всякими элементами крафтинга, строительства и изучения внешнего мира, да и к тому же, соулслайк. 
[b]Однако, как выразиться более элегантно, я обосрался.[/b][/h1]

    [b]Начнем поэтапно.[/b] Польша, 19 век. В каком-то лесу начинается очень бурная метаморфозность с лесом. Деревья растут быстрее и кучнее, а жители деревни куда-то уходят по ночам и не возвращаются. Через некоторое время, на эту территорию отправляется группа ученых для выяснения происходящего. Опять же, через некий промежуток времени, лес дал реакцию на чужаков, тем самым закрыл единственный путь для эвакуации. Примерно в этот момент, протагонист игры пробуждается, при этом, он не помнит, кто он такой и что здесь делает. Сюжет очень прост. Тебе надо выбраться из леса, ты хочешь вернуться домой, но для этого, тебе нужен ключ, найди ключ и тогда ты сможешь покинуть темнолесье. Незамысловато. Однако в противовес можно поставить персонажей и их историю. Это действительно очень крутая вещь, каждый может похвастаться уникальной историей и своим характером. Человек-волк, про которого я так и не смог много разузнать. Доктор, тот самый, кто отбирает у нас ключ с биркой "21". Дама Куриц, Прекрасная Леди, Музыкант, Петрик, который попытается сбежать из леса посредством стройки ракеты, а так же еще много не менее крутых персонажей. Перейдем к хоррор составляющей. Скажу сразу, в игре нет скримерров. Всю работу делает атмосфера, а дополняет ее саунтрек. Это очень классно. Давно не видел такого. И пожалуй на этом все.

    [b]А теперь то, что меня огорчило.[/b] Начну с самого главного. Это та самая survival часть игры. Она бесполезна, она не нужна, она скучная и раздражающая. Хотя поначалу это кажется, очень даже прикольно, баррикадироваться, устанавливать всякие ловушки, перетаскивать мебель, в надежде укрепить свою крепость. Однако, это лишь мешает основному гемплею, исследование мира. Примерно, после 15 ночи, однообразность наскучила и обещанное выживание превратилось в афк гейминг. Я серьезно. Если на тебя нападут духи, а при тебе только факел да фонарик, считай ты умер, они выключают все лампы, кроме одной и если при тебе нету сигнального факела, ты труп. Конечно, тебе возможно хватит хп на один их заход, однако, кто сказал, что будет только один. За одну ночь, они навещали меня минимум три раза, без передышки, я даже похилиться не успевал. Но это ладно, самая большая проблема, это когда во время боя, протагонист отказывался менять оружие на панели быстрого доступа, то есть, вот у меня топор, я хочу поменять на пистолет, а он просто не меняется, ни колесиком мышки, ни кнопками клавиатуры. И я более чем уверен, что в этот момент меня не били, то есть, не было станлока. И вот это все, из раза в раз, повторяется. Разве что, от разного биома, разные "соседи". Опять же, они просто идут в добавок к предыдущим, а не меняются на абсолютно других. Сделав соответствующие выводы, я перестал оборонятся. Давал себя убить в самом начале ночи и после пробуждения продолжал исследование территории локации. Твои смерти не на что не влияют. Только ты при этом, ты не получаешь репутацию (местная валюта) у торговцев, которые доступны только после ночи, однако, что они продают, можно купить у другого продавца, либо найти, это не сложно. 

Карта. Просто ненужная вещь, воспользовался пару раз, только в ознакомительных целях, биомы очень хорошо запоминаются и не нуждаются в виде подсказок на клочке бумаги. Хотя, у меня один раз припекло от карты. Я проходил рут Человека-волка, и в какой момент он сказал: "Встретимся на юго-восточной части территории" (не уверен, что дословно, но это и не важно), и на карте не было помечено направления сторон света, ни места дальнейшего пребывания, пришлось наобум искать его по всему биому. Не круто. Обещали же сложности, получай.

    [b]Скиллы.[/b] Тоже не очень юзабельная вещь, вроде и полезно, а вроде и без них хорошо. Хотя скилл, которых позволяет поедать дерево в обмен на реген хп, круто, часто им пользовался, ну и еще пассивка, увеличивающая хп бар на 0.5 одного деления. Что третий глаз, что мотылек, хамелеон и так далее, довольно редки в использовании.

    Хочу отметить также пиксельную графику. Не то чтобы она мне не нравилась, но в этой игре, некоторый декор смешивается с цветовой палитрой остального и из-за этого иной раз не различаешь, куда ты наступаешь, не видно, ловушка там или просто такая земля.

    [h1]На самом деле, игра очень хороша со стороны атмосферы и персонажей, а также их дизайна, как прорисованы мельчайшие детали на морде человека-волка, дырки на его куртке и следы крови, дрожащая рука с сигаретой доктора, это очень круто. Однако, все портит survival составляющая. Ты не чувствуешь себя на все 100% защищённым и это классно, но из раза в раз одно и тоже приедается.[/h1]

    [b]Возьмите во внимание цену. [u]Две пачки[/u] сигарет за такое.[/b]

    [h1][b]7.5/10[/b][/h1]

38165747.review: Отличный хоррор! Система выживания тоже на высоте. Но изюминка это сюжет! Игра 10/10.

38165490.review:
Grab on sale. 60 % or more. Or just skip right away. This game has an atrocious save system. 

At it's core it's a rich experience, which will demand your focus. It has serious flaws, though. Unfortunately, I don't think that you can get the same feeling twice, as the game is actually scripted. That being said, enjoy this title as much as you can on your first play through(if you can at all). Play from midnight till the first sun ray with your expensive headphones on, don't put grease on the squeaky door, buy a handgun, get petrol for the generator, nab some poisonous mushrooms for your casserole and put iron fang traps around in your backyard. You may want to play this thing again, but it definitely won't produce the same effect; it will be for the achievements alone, I am sure.  

Darkwood uses its assets sparingly and manages to heighten the tension gradually. Nothing in this game is scary, but there is a definitive primal feeling to everything that surrounds you. It's strange for sure; this game wants to be unique, and succeeds in a lot of ways. It would have been even better if it didn't want to be Dark Soulesque. The save system actually ruins it. Instead, if every save required an item which you needed to loot from somewhere, craft, or get from a merchant and you met your final death every time your health bar runs out, I think it would have added tons to the atmosphere, as well as make it a lot more approachable. Because this game is not hard...its hard because you are a slug.

I generally get a desire to whack everything that comes close to my hideout, instead of hiding in a corner. The avatar you play as is stiff as fuck in the hand and has an annoying tendency to overarch his melee blows. He can craft semi-automatics, heavy axes, Molotov cocktails, work an industrial wood saw, extract chemicals from mushrooms, make antidotes, dress wounds on the fly, but running efficiently and swinging properly are not on his dossier, it seems. Sigh...Still, these bad skills add to the feeling of the game somehow, as most encounters(especially the night ones) become a struggle. That adds another layer of synthetic difficulty for you to adjust to in purely technical terms. The results is a rather unintuitive combat. I really wanted to get into it...but it kept pushing me away. It's really odd...Speaking of pushing, you WILL need to press forward, because the forest is waging a war of attrition on you. And even if you get creative, trouble comes in your face regardless of what you do. Sometimes that is good, and sometimes I question the devs' decisions, which means it can be bad. For instance, I tried blocking a hole in my hideout with multiple pieces of furniture and stand there pushing all night. I was rather curious to see what was going to happen. My front door, which any baddie can open...whatever...was loaded with spring traps, and I was hearing muffled screams and whines of 'monsters' who dared come too close. To my utter annoyance, the weakest feral dog pushed through my little blockade, all the while I was pushing back. You see, this is significant, because you can't really get creative with survival. Monsters come regardless of what you do, they wreck stuff just cause, and they chase you specifically. If they don't find what they are looking for outright, they start bashing things you built...with the exception of the generator and the lamps...Maybe it's because, as Wolf said, Meat has got a distinct smell(this is a character you meet early on). But then again, if that were true, how are you able to sneak behind enemies and whack them without them knowing?! The gunplay...don't get me started. Anyways, there is a reason why I say you can get the most out of this title on first play through; you won't get the same feeling twice. And that's why you should nab it on sale. 

The script is strong with this one and if it wasn't for the atrocious save system it would get a recommend. But for now...I don't think I would suggest you ruin your time with this game. It's a shame, thus, if you want to try it, don't spend the full amount of money on it. It's not worth it's dime. 

Oh, and if you too are not happy with the save system, you can backup your save files. You need to copy not only the ones from the profile folder, but the ones in the main folder, where all the profiles sit.

38161832.review:
- Short -

While this game does a great job of putting Horror in the Horror genre, that's about all it does. If you come expecting a random generation survival crafting game, expect to walk away from this very dissapointed.

- Long - 

Darkwood does an excellent job adding dread and fear into a 2D game, which I thought would be impossible for someone like me who has become numb to just about every horror game and movie on the market. The problem is, is that you quickly get used to it, and the horror and dread for the characters is quickly changed to horror and dread of the poor animations and 1996 era graphics. There is chic classic graphics, and then there is dated graphics. This game tried to go for classic, and ended up going a bit too far. I literally played games in 1996 that had far superior graphics.

I'm not a graphics snob though, but when playing on perma-death mode, graphics should be clear enough to distinguish from a pile of logs/mushrooms and a corpse sitting in front of you without you having to mouse over to see what it is the devs were trying to make there. Text in game is blocky to the point of looking like DOS game, and the fuzzy background images when an item is picked up make it feel like a really old "click on points of the scenery and find the clue" type of game. I can not stress enough how -painful- this game is to look at in the year 2017, maybe that is part of the horror, but it's obvious the devs had the talent and chose to go with the most ugly route they could of.

But, that's not the big issue for me, in fact this is the first game -ever- I sat there dumbfounded, trying to crank up my graphics settings, because I couldn't believe they were that bad.

The big issue, is this game is sold as a survival horror. Calling this game a survival horror, is like calling Half-life 2 a construction game because you can stack boxes with the anti-grav gun, or calling Dark Souls a survival game because your suppose to not die to get to the next step. In no way do I consider this game "survival", while yes, you are suppose to survive, which is a given in almost any game you play, there really isn't much to it than "not dying". Do you have to harvest food? no. Do you need to build to survive? sort of, you build traps and weapons. Do you build shelter? no, that is chosen for you. Can you mine/grow resources? no. You are given what the game chooses to give you, and with those items you can craft a minimal selection of objects to assist.

The maps are not procedurally generated. You progress from map to map, following a strict story, collecting items to help in your journey and keep you alive. The only random thing I have seen in this game is that it randomly gives you supplies you have to find in each map. I didn't consider this fun, and calling it "survival" to me, implies a genre that you really need to shoehorn this game into in order to consider it "survival". It's a themepark crafting quest.

I wouldn't of felt so mislead if it wasnt for the comment on the store page "No hand holding or quest markers". Day 2 I had a guy show up -at my door- saying, hey buddy, here's a quest for you, it's what you need to do to get to the next map, and btw, pull up your map and you can find wherever I am, even though you never went to those areas before. To me.. that's hand holding, and quest markers.

I can forgive all that, but in the end, with the lack of crafting options, sitting in my house at night thumbing my ... with nothing to do but listen to creepy noises and wait for the morning, the tedious scavenger hunts for items, and the lack of challenge this game offers.. I just don't see why it has as many good reviews as it does.


Pros & Cons

Pros

- Game truly lives up to it's title of a Horror game without resorting to cheap B-grade movie tricks.

Cons

- Graphics are what I would expect in mid 90s and not done in a "chic classic" method.
- Not really a "survival crafting game", while it has the aspects, they are shallow.
- Theme Park, very minimal randomization, story driven
- Not very entertaining, simply not enough to craft, no structure building, and a straight path to the end.
- Very little challenge

38019492.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i8KLix_USY4

I missed out on this game hitting Greenlight, missed their Indigogo campaign, and all the Early Access drama. The first time I ever heard of Darkwood was when it popped up in the Steam sales, and I took a chance on it based off nothing but their overwhelmingly positive score; didn’t watch any gameplay, didn’t read any reviews. So, to say this game took me by surprise would be an understatement. Darkwood is one of the best and most novel games, let alone indie games, that I’ve played in a while.

The premise is fantastic -- An ambiguous plotline establishes that the world of the protagonist is overgrown by a forest that’s consumed everything, trapping him and others in a kind of purgatory zone, where evil lurks all around in the woods. By day the player must tread cautiously to neighbouring locations and scavenge what he can in preparation for the night, where he must barricade his cabin, lay traps and prepare to defend against the evils that will come looking for him.

The game is all top down 2D, and when I first launched the game I was a little disappointed at the aesthetic because it all looked kind of flat and washed out, but just a few minutes into the game was all it took to completely change my mind. The 2D is simple, but the detail in the artwork is phenomenal, and although the characters are top down, every now and again you’ll encounter an animation that comes across as 2.5D, which takes me by surprise every time. The top down camera and restricted field of view really enhances the fear factor and creates opportunities for a novel approach to horror that doesn’t rely on jump scares. Similarly, the audio in the game does an outstanding job at contributing to the fear factor, creating tension though sudden knocks in the dark, or the sound of something shuffling around outside the window. In this way the game approaches horror in the most primal way: the scariest things are what you think you see and hear.

The game can brutally difficult, with a heavy emphasis on death through carelessness. As the protagonist is quite fragile, running gleefully through the woods will inevitably result in being ambushed by a pack of wild dogs or ripped apart by the forest savages. But by being patient and methodical, the player can avoid or a least minimize sudden surprises, and playing cautiously encourages an almost roleplay-like style of play, helping place you the mindset of your character and further absorb you into the environment. As if the game wasn’t hard enough, permadeath is an option at the highest difficulty level, but at normal difficulty the player will just drop some of their items on death, though they can be reclaimed later much like in Minecraft.

Darkwood has a low price point at just $15, and for such an amazing game that price is fantastic. But even crazier, the devs are also offering the game for free for those who can’t afford it by hosting a safe, official torrent that can be downloaded by anyone without commitment to buy, so there is absolutely no reason not to try this one. The game was made by just three guys, so with such a great end result to show for their effort, I cannot wait to see what these guys do next.

38018276.review: worth your time and money if you like survival horror games

38015290.review:
Good indie game for the most part...

I would say that the combat controls are very clunky (either with pad or k+m).  This game has some excellent gameplay and is challenging, however some of the challenge comes from poor design choice rather than a genuinely well crafted challenge, examples:-

-As mentioned, combat controls are clunky and somewhat unresponsive at times (the worst times)
-When you craft an item like a gun, you have no idea how much ammo is in it the first time.
-Some areas it is difficult to have any idea what time of day it is without certain items.
-Loot and items can sometimes blend into the surroundings too much, harder to spot than they would be in reality.
-Character is a much worse shot than I am (and I am only an average level marksman), i.e. it takes too much time to "wind-up" or aim a pistol or shotgun so that it will fire with any degree of accuracy.
-If you click to attack near an interactive object (there are alot when defending, around you), you will interact with the object intsead of attacking, some of the time.  This will kill you!  I.e.  Ooops, I looked in a dresser that was a barricade, instead of swinging the weapon in my hand that I had ready, now, in the time it takes me to unlook and back away, they will kill me, is that realistic in any way?

While it is neat to have a game that does not hold your hand, you should have access to at least the same information your character does, i.e. "I just made this gun, pretty sure I know how many bullets I put in it" or "I don't have a watch but I know it is some time in the afternoon".  These problems add to the challenge, but in an imersion breaking way.

I can also see items lying on the ground in real life much more easily than the character can.  If you are going to make a game that has a zoomed out third person perspective only, items need to be clearer.  In first person perspective, I can see an object without an outline almost as easily as I could in real life.  In a zoomed out, third person perspective, everything is obviously much smaller, harder to see, so without outlines or highlights objects are actually harder to locate than in real life.  Again, this adds to the difficulty, but in an immersion breaking way.

Due to this game's level of difficulty being ratcheted up for some of the wrong reasons, as well as poorly implemented combat controls, gotta give it 6/10, wanna score it much higher, but there are still too many issues with this title after so long, imo.

A lot of potential here, with a little better implementation of the concepts and design of this game, could have one of the best indie games ever.

Honestly, on the fence about this one... I only recommend this if you want an extreme challenge that is sometimes immersion breaking or hard for the wrong reasons.  Should two completely naked "savages" with sticks pose any real challenge to a guy armed with multiple firearms hiding in a corner?  Well they do in this game.

While a little creepy in places, and downright scary in even fewer, most of the "suspense" or "fear" for me came from knowing that even though I'm loaded for bear, two shotguns, pistol and molotovs will probably miss most of the time and be almost useless against most enemies (even the ones they should work well against).

Gave a thumbs down because, while ok, this game does not deserve an "overwhelmingly positive" score on steam reviews, not by a long shot.  Aaahh, I agonised over this, if it were easier to control and just as hard as it is for other reasons, would recommend, maybe?

All that being said, like I say, amazing potential... the story and atmosphere are great when the imersion isn't broken by one of the more arbitrary design choices.  Some of the more intense sessions are especially impressive for a third person perspective game.  There are some really inovative ideas here and a use of the perspective to add to tension in ways I have not seen before.

One more kinda big thing, imo... the aim, wind up time and genral feel of the weapons is bad, for the two different shotguns and the pistols, the wind-up and aim time (almost three seconds!) feels the same for all four weapons?

37977358.review: This game is unbelievable. I've played all the survival horror games from Silent Hill, The Evil Within, and Resident Evil, to Fatal Frame, Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth, Amnesia, Soma, and everything in between. What I'm telling you is that no game has hit my horror nerve in a long, long time. It's got the brooding, creeping horror of Silent Hill and the unsettling weirdness of H.P. Lovecraft's best stories (think Color Out of Space, Dunwich Horror, Shadow Over Innsmouth). There's light survival aspects but this is not a rogue-like. The death system on Normal is like Dark Souls; you die and must get back to your corpse to retrieve your items. If you die again before reaching your body, you'll simply have to find both bodies. No items lost, which is nice. The best part is that everything is set up like classic games where there is no waypoint markers, no positioning on the map (simply a static drawing) and you'll be required to take notes in order to remember which quest givers want what and where to go for it. If you want to check on a quest, you'd better have written it down or you'll be trecking back to talk to the quest-giver. Pure old-school gaming that not only refuses to insult your intelligence, but requires a bit of it too. I'm in love with this game. After 12 hours of playing, I don't think I'm even half-way done, and I love that. I will end on this note: Darkwood is a AAA game made by three guys. This is not your run-of-the-mill indie quickie. It's polished, unnerving, and quiet in it's mysteries; brooding in it's horror. It stands proudly next to horror greats like Silent Hill, Resident Evil, and Fatal Frame. For $15 bucks, you're robbing the developer's blind.

37939716.review:
The Blair Witch Project meets S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

Just looking at screenshots and video, you get the impression a 2D orthographic top-down presentation wouldn't deliver too much in terms of an experience. That is until you take this game's sound design and difficulty into account.

This game is rich with tension and mystery.

I was a huge fan of how this game fills its maps with stories more than generated landmarks. Everything is just shuffled around, but it's still handmade. Though I did notice some new minor landmarks I didn't get in previous playthroughs. The choices you can make to determine how the adventures play out are meaningful; they affect both story and gameplay which encourages replayability.

The "overworld" does have a time-limit before you have to run back to your home, which can make you feel rushed exploring landmarks. But you do get a break from the timer when entering certain places. With all the stuff I was doing, I thought I was reaching the end of the game until I realize I was only on Chapter 1.

This game's difficulty, atmosphere, and mystery is an example of how those elements work together in order to make the survival horror genre work.

As a fan of the genre, I set it amongst my favorites to treasure for decades; a 2010's classic.

A very good top down survival horror. This game really does a great job in every aspect. 
While we are talking about a survival horror, we can draw some similarity with games like Don't Starve.
During daytime gather supplies, fortify your equipment, gather consumables, and conveniently you will never be hungry, so that's one thing out of the way. While hunker down for the night and pray for the morning light.

So besides the oebviously good art design and gameplay you see in trailers here are some highlights:
-Procedurally generated map
-Random encounters, random events during night, nice variety of dark locations, 
-crafting is simple, not over the top. There are loads of games witch much more advanced crafting mechanism, but this game focuses more on exploration instead of taking away your time with very deep crafting system
-Enemies are scary, sound effects are brilliant, visual effects are even scarier than the enemies themselves.

37915656.review:
Darkwood is a fantastic survival horror game. It has a great atmosphere, unique and creepy monster design, an intriguing story, and solid gameplay. The devs realy struck gold with this one, and I'm happy it's gotten out of early access without any of the bullshit that plagues other early access titles. 

Atmosphere: Darkwood has a heavy atmosphere of curruption and plague, and I don't just mean the typical plague. Nothing feels untainted. Everything in this game looks decayed and mutated. You never truly feel safe, it's like the forest itself has it in for you. 

Story: The story is ok. Nothing amazing, but not bad. It is well put together and you do have an impact on where it leads. Overall, not a major selling point, but a nice touch.

Gameplay (accept combat): OMG I LOVE IT SO MUCH! Somthing about it just speeks to me. The basic gameplay loop is this; you leave your hideout during the day to explore, loot, and progress the story, then get back before night. At night you are stuck in your hideout. Multiple events can happen during the night, I won't spoil but lets just say they can range from a mushroom growing on your floor to FUCKING DEATH INCARNATE COMMING TO FUCK YOUR SHIT. After you survive the night you get some downtime to repair damage, build new stuff, and trade with an NPC, who will give you a small reward fore making it through the night.

Combat: The combat is, like in most survival horor games, panicked, clunkey, and mostly avoidable. Melee weapons have a windup and deplete your limited stamina. Guns require you to aim which slows movement and it takes time for your character to steady their weapon. They also require ammo, which is uncommon, expensive, and annoying to carry in large amounts. 

Locations: The world layout is random but the locations are hand made. This means that loot able places are finite so you need to continue the story if you want to keep finding goodies. Each one is unique in its own way, and range from simple landmarks to massive structures with all sorts of creatures inside. These locations are split into 4 main areas, each one with its own hideout, that get progressivly harder as you unlock them. In order of difficulty and sequence incountered, The Dry Medow, The Silent Forest, The Old Wood, and The Swamp. Each one has it's own set of challenges but the swamp is by far the most uneque.

Conclusion: Darkwood mixes an open world survival game with a linier survival horror game. The two are maryed with great gameplay, an amazing atmosphere, and a interesting story. In my opinion this is a match made in heaven, though I understand if you disagree.

37912783.review:
Sometimes, it's hard to know quite what to expect when you buy a game.  Prices don't necessarily reflect the amount of work - or depth - in them, and videos of let's plays contain too much editing out of embarrassing deaths.

This game surprised me.  From the fantastically creepy sounds that play, to the beautifully done various characters you interact with, there is a depth to this game I wasn't really expecting.  I'm not one - generally - to get 'immersed' in any game.. but I was pretty bummed out when I realized  my choices had crap consequences for an NPC... and then I accidentally did it again to someone else.    

I'm still not finished with the main questline I choose, here, because I'm old and die a LOT.   But I've certainly played enough of this game to recommend it.  There are any number of storylines I haven't followed, which makes replaying it definitely possible.  The artwork is pretty, the world interesting, the nights terrifying in a way they just aren't in Minecraft or Don't Starve.   And so much of this game is still left for me to figure out...  I have questions, and the answers are slow in coming... like a well-written novel that keeps you reading to find MORE.

To answer the big question: the maps do seem to be randomly generated, with set locations that move each time you open a new game.  The world itself isn't particularly huge, but considering how dangerous it is when night falls, and how far you will have to travel to make it back to safety in the evenings.. you won't mind.  Trust me.  Unlike Don't Starve, you can't just plop down anywhere that seems relatively safe to wait it out.. no camping, kiddies, unless you want to add to your death count.

Atmosphere is the number one attribute of this game.. even the pause screen is a bit creepy.

Well done game, and well worth the listed purchase price.

37849813.review:
By day, you search for supplies. By night, you use them to survive. A typical survival mechanic, but pulled off really well.
Base defense is minimal, but pretty good. Foraging can get a little repetitive, like any survival game.

Melee combat is alright; ranged is good.
The environment is done really well.
The art is great, and the sounds wonderful.

But the player's line of sight limitation is what really drives home the feeling of unease. When you can hear footsteps outside the window, but dare not look for whatever it is may spot you, that's when the game really shines.

Overall: A brilliantly atmospheric, slightly lovecraft-esque experience.

Darkwood- subtlety done right
What can i say about this game that hasn´t allready been said.
Short review: it´s good, it´s one of those few times when survival horror is done right.
Drop everything and get it.
Warning though: It´s hard as balls and you will be nervous about 90% of the time but this is one of those times 
when you´ll have to drag yourself beaten, scared and alone to finish this game but in the end it will be worth it.
Just get it.
For this review i shall not spoil any story and you´ll thank me; because it´s subtle and holy fuck it´s good.

Gamefeel: The camera system is faced downwards which is way off the normal scary games, this in my opinion is a plus making the atmosfear more in focus and since you only have a limited viewfield it really makes you observe your surroundings, speaking of taking in surrounding is the cleaver system of hiding your location from the map making you have to memorize where your safehouse is.
Shadows,darkness and light is done well and the color schemes of black,white, grey,brown and red is great for the game. Another element is the day/night funtion: explore and figure out the story and gather resources by day, try to survive against the impending dark lovecraftian creatures by night.

Combat and movement: the movement in Darkwood is pretty basic, wasd for walking, shift for running yadidaya, you have a dodge button which you will never use since running backwards is faster and more effective and a stamina bar which will make every move a risk of dying or surviving.
Combat can be a bit clunky and sometimes the hit boxes are a bit sloppy and you never really feel like you´re in control but it fairly resembles the intensity and fast speed of when you are being attack for real. you know in your house like that man standing outside your window right now.

Music: holy fuck, the music and the sound is perfect for this game, it makes you sit on the edge of your seat and jump as the abomanations jump and clip it´s jaws agains you. simply this game is for hard core scare manics like myself that like to get their balls trapped in a wooden box and getting a hard attack by hp lovecraft.

37828331.review:
I almost only have good things to mention about Darkwood. There are too few horror games which reaches this level of memorability in my opinion, and as such is deserving of the time to write a review.

[u]The positive:[/u]

- I would claim this game boasts the most impressive horror atmosphere in a long time. It surpasses many recent AAA titles by far.

- The soundtrack is excellent. It's foreboding, disturbing and calming at the right times.

- The characters are intriguing. My biggest complaint in this area is simply that there isn't more characters and more involvement with the already existing ones, which is also a compliment in itself. I wanted to see more of the world Acid WIzard has created.

- Exploration and discovery is grueling and exciting.

- There are choices in the game which affect the outcome of certain stories, great for replay value points.

- Gameplay is tight for the most part, combat is alright but nothing extraordinary. The light mechanics however are stellar.

- The survival aspect is stress inducing and challenging (at least for a long while into the game) which makes it a lot of fun. If you get more resources than you have place to store it in however, a lot of the challenge is lost.

[u]The negative:[/u]

Disclaimer: I have not completed the game. If your experiences differ from what I write, it may be because we made different choices in the game, or that I haven't so far seen what you have.

- The payoff for some storylines and locations were disappointing. As was surely intended, the conclusions to some of the storylines I have experienced fit with the theme of decay and desperation, so I cannot entirely criticize this. [b] Minor spoilers/hints about story conclusions [/b] Although it felt a little too consistent on the downers. There were rarely any of the actions I took had any positive outcome. It is possible the story choices I made was bad ones, and got poor outcomes as a result.

-Little variation of enemies, you see a lot of the same after a while into the game. The AI ties into this, as the behavior of different enemies is too similar. It becomes easy to predict after some time in the game. If enemies become predictable and if you are smart with your resources, your biggest challenge will eventually become patience instead of the challenges the world presents you with.

[b]In conclusion[/b] because I can't think of other things to mention, it is well worth the full asking price both with the content in mind and the playtime you will get out of it. When there are so many games to try out, few are able to make such an impression as to make me excited to see what the developers come up with next. This is one of those games. If you're a horror and/or survival fan, you shouldn't miss this title.

37647092.review:
Их нечестью люди зовут...

Darkwood определённо хорошая игра, даже очень, главное помните - это инди, это выживание, это хоррор. В этом для меня кроятся некоторые проблемы игры. Будь у разрабов большая команда, бюджет, и если бы они доводили некоторые идеи до конца, то игра была бы 100% шедевром. Итак, начнём по порядку.

 - Графика.
 Со стилем. Мрачные цвета, проработка местности, локаций, врагов на высоте, а дополняется всё это эффектом крайне низкой чёткости изображения, вблизи игра становится пиксельной поделкой, а в далеке - шикарным, атмосферным театром безумия и сюрра.
 - Звук.
 Шикарен. Основной источник атмосферы и ваших кирпичей, но с некоторыми минусами. Во-первых, когда орёт враг, не всегда удаётся понять где он, звук будто изаётся всем окружением, что жутко дизориентирует. Во-вторых, он быстро приелается, эмбиенты повтаряются, а хруст веток, гром и хриплые стоны зарожённых раздражают и не более. Ты быстро понимаешь, чего боятся, а чего нет. Но музыка в меню и утром навсегда оставит в вашей душе отпечаток мандража и божественного облегчения, в захотите отправится в глушь, в разрушеную избы и включить "Утро" там. Просто что бы понять героя и мир.
 - Атмосфера.
 Без слов. Проподёт из-за простого привыкания к игре, но стоит вам её закрыть и вы начнёте представлять ужасы леса, живые деревья и думать, как многих оно загубило? Это зло? Лес меняет людей и даже кгда вы сбежите, знайте, в ваш мозг уже пролезли их корни.
 - Страх.
 Никчёмен. Вы будете так боятся игры первые дни, что не захотите её сново запускать. А потом, когда вы раскроете тайны леса, поймёте его обитателей, вы перестанете боятся, и страх станет раздражающей рутиной. И почти не будет возврощятся. (Правда я, зная из трейлеров, что будет на свадьбе, всё равно считаю её самым лучшим в плане ужаса моментом игры.)
 - Геймплей.
 Хорош. Но ожидаете рутину виживалок типа The Forest. Бой, это самая адреналиновая часть игры (Потому крайне советую на болотах не прятатся за шкафом, а выходить на улицу и становится машиной для убийства). Торговля покажется вам не честной, но утверждаю, стоит накопить эрепутации и обеспечить её стабильный прирост (не сдыхать по ночам), как вы сможете купить ВСЁ, абсолютно ВСЁ. И если не ссать, а хорошо управлять ресурсами и избовлятся от хлама, то вы забудите о проблемах (до начала 2-ой главы). И торговцам просто будет нечего вам предоставить. По развитию - полезны от силы 5-ть перков, остольное хлам, просто покупайте грибы и яйцо по утра и не сливайте ингродиенты в  плохие печки. Ах да, про активные перки вы вжизни не вспомните.
 - Персонажи.
 Очень неоднозначны. Они имеют прописаный, харизмотичный и критой образ, но их очень мало, да при том с ними мало взаимодействия. Торговцы (кроме основных) бесполезны, а ведь с этой механикой можно было намутить таких делов! Их история не раскрывается и они нужны лишь, как ориентиры. Могло быть и лучше...
 - Мир.
 Крут и жесток. Он прекрасен. Только многие его аспекты разрабы не дотянули. Свадьба не вписывается в этот самый мир, куча заделов на предистории персонажей и квесты дающие польше информации об истории. Но игра их не вводит и куча потенциально крутых моментов улетает в бездну.
 - История.
 Проста, но затягивает. Ты сопереживаешь герою, испытываешь на себе его муки, и обязательно мечтаешь, о том, как свалишь из этого ада.
 Подведём итоги:
+.
1) Класный визуал и стиль.
2) Шикарная атмосфера.
3) Интересная геймплейная основа.
4) Крутой звук.
5) Харизмотичные персонажи.
6) Адреналин и щепотка годного страха.
7) Крутая история, мир и локации.
8) Игра затягивает и не отпускает.
-.
1) Однообразие на поздних этапах.
2) Бесполезность NPC и торговли (Не с основными торгошами).
3) Отсутствие страха после первой недели.
4) Недоделаные сюжетные линии.
5) Общяя недосказанность истории.
 Вердикт:
Игру можно смело назвать одним из лучших инди-проектов этого года, она захватит и не отпустит вас до конца. Вы будете возврощятся в лес снова и снова, не в игре, так в своём вооброжении и недостатки уйдут на второй план. И пускай идёт чувство неполноценности от того, что разрабы не реализовали все свои идеи, вы получите прекрасный, сложный и пугающий атракцион, ещё раз подтверждающий, что инди не только пустые высасоловки денег, но и произведения искусства.
 
  8.5 грибных трипов из 10.
 ( Помните чем выше ожидания, тем сильее разочерования, даже от самого годного проекта).

37636732.review: Brilliant horror experience with exceptionally difficult gameplay. This game does not hold your hand. You are shown the very basics in the prologue, everything else you must learn on your own. No quest markers either. You actually need to read the dialogue of the characters to know what your next objective is. As for the horror, this game doesnt have many jump scares. Most of the horror aspect comes from the atmosphere, audio, and the classic fear of the unknown. For instance, you might hear footsteps in your hideout at night, or a knock on your door, or even text in another room saying things like "I want to go home." This game offers a truly chilling and unique experience that you would be stupid to pass up.

37519787.review:
Holy hell what a hidden gem of a game. TL:DR This is a steal for 15$ and even if you're the conservative type, if you see this on sale and are somewhat interested go right in man!

If you're a person who likes survival games you'll love the core mechanical gameplay Darkwood has to offer.  This game doesn't hold your hand, it's difficutly is dependant on one's inability to prepare for all circumstances but when you do, damn if it isn't rewarding.  You'll be managing inventory, time of day, hideout defences and your arsenal whenever you either hunker down or go out for an expedition.  (These are in no way the only 2 options)  There's so much to explore!

If you can appreciate horror like i can, but aren't too into getting anxious about it, Darkwood does it perfectly (at least for me).  The horror here is subtle, where the world is grim and has many threats from large to small.  But these threats rarely ever reveal themselves in a telegraphed fasion.  It's scary simply being in the game world and imagining even for an instant, that you would be there yourself.

If you like getting immersed in a game hot damn the sound design, visuals and the character's physical limitations not only make it convincing at times but very much hammer home the themes this game is trying to convey to you.  Both the overarching story and storylines of the npc's are all interesting and have curious interactions and results, this game has replay value in droves.

On the topic of sound design wowowow the soundtrack is gorgeous.  When i first started the game i found myself lingering on the main menu just because the theme was intruiging.

This isn't a perfect game however.
- Sometimes deaths can feel cheap due to enemies attack animations being inconsistent
- I felt like the day/night having the same time periods kinda sucked, day should be longer.
- There's alot of traversal involved, especially in chapter 1, the tedium comes with seeing the same things over and over

37481273.review: A creepy and unnerving survival horror game. Sparse resources make you cherish every bullet, wince when you have to use bandages because it was your last one, or dread repairing your melee weapon with the few remaing supplies you had in your backpack since you may have needed them to survive the upcoming night. The atmosphere and sound are incredible, it's been a long time since I've been frightened by a game that didn't involve jump scares.

37478766.review: Very good blend of horror survival and rpg. The topdown perspective does a great job of making you feel like something dangerous is always just outside of your vision,(and often something is) the horror is great because it doesnt rely on jump scares. Its the uncertainty of what is around the corner when you explore during the day that makes you just barely creep along through the ruined houses and strange caves, hoping a monster isnt there to force your use of precious ammunition. The scraps of lore and world building also gets pretty messed up and hits you with a degrading sense of uneasiness. But its more then the daylight exploration and fear of the unknown,and the creepy implications of the world. There is a mounting dread that builds as you get deeper into the night. I found myself in a panic at new random nightly events and situations I didnt know how to deal with. But when you get closer to that daybreak you FEEL it. As the last few hours of night tested me, I felt empowered by the music that builds and builds and builds up until the sweet wave of relief that comes with the break of day that despawns the nightly intruders. For a moment I desperately wanted to survive. No, I HAD to. And a great way I kept that feeling consistent was by playing on hard with a limited number of lives. I dont however recommend that difficulty for any new player. You will probably die more then four times unless you are extremely patient and careful. When I first played this game in early access I found that it still has some frusturations which may end up killing you as it did me. For me it was stuff like how long it took for my melee weapon to charge up and respond to enemies that were in my face stun locking me. I also had two seperate occasions in which I was careless near my beartraps and being rooted in them while taking damage cost me my survival. The game isnt perfect and is sometimes a pain, but it does SO much right im very willing to look past the few things I coinsidered unfair which could arguably be my fault to some degree as well.. It was a joy to watch this game evolve through early access into what it is now. I highly recommend it to horror fans and rpg fans alike. I recommend normal for a first playthough to satisfy one ending and if you want to come back for a real challenge or the paths you didnt choose, then go to hard or nightmare.

This game is what true horror is all about. Not first-person to put you in the person's eyes as the approach always is, but top-down and even then you don't know what is happening around you. The atmosphere was enough to make my stomach flip and jaw clench for the first time in a very long while when dealing with horror media. Nothing is for sure and you only see what your character sees in their line of sight- not what creature suddenly opened the door across the room or what is breathing right down your neck behind you.

 If you are willing to have a night of unease, unforgiving terror, and questioning the need of a nightlight, I recommend it.

Overall if you play this game, be prepared because once you start you are on your own because most of everything and everyone in this game is either out to kill you and/or prevent your escape.

37134671.review:
[h1]"Страх-самое древнее и сильное из человеческих чувств,а самый древний и самый сильный страх-страх неведомого"-Говард Филлипс Лавкрафт[/h1]

Именно с этой цитаты я хотел-бы начать свой обзор на игру Darkwood 
Саму игру можно разделить на 2 основных составляющие это survival и horror,при чём оба этих жанра в этой игре дополняют друг-друга и не перетягивают одеяла на себя например когда вы будете зачищать какую либо темную местность в поисках лута (который к стати надо ещё и продумать куда тратить)то звуки и окружения будут ну как минимум держать вас в напряжение.Но небось вы думаете если в игре есть вооружение кого нам в принципе бояться,ну включить легкий уровень сложности ну увидить противника один-два раза запомнить его и убить пару раз и понять что страшнее чем мы в этом мире никого нет,в чем проблема?А проблема или лучше сказать изюминка этого проекта это то что мы не будем знать с кем мы сталкнемся,сначала нас пугают мистификациией потом спустя 1-3 ночь наш противник обретает так скажеи плоть и мы уже не будем его в принципе бояться,НО если вы хотите понять ещё в первом убежище что вас будет ждать впереди во вторую ночь не побойтесь открыть входную дверь во время стука в неё и забрать приглашение,а после пойти на торжество и после выполнения этого мини квеста для себя понять,готовы ли вы к такому неизвестному?К таким секретом который скрывает лес?если нет то лучше проходите это игру со светом и без звука ибо дальше будет сложнее и страшнее.Ну я начал уходить в глубину так скажем,и мне кажеться что многим захочется прочувствовать это на себе по этому в кратц.
[h1]Графика[/h1]-если вы не приверженец широких взглядов на картинку ивы не понимаете что такое "Стиль художника" или "Минималистичное инди-графика" и вам подавай проэкты с ультра блёстками или мега-реалестичный графон и только так,то это игра не для вас
[h1]Гемплей[/h1]-если вы не готовы делать одни и те же действия раз за разом,просто меняя алгоритм этих действий(это значит сейчас пошёл туда залутался вернулся,теперь пойду в другую сторону и зделаю тоже самое) и вас не будет устраивать что игра будет изменяться почти без вашего участия,то это игра не для вас
[h1]Звук[/h1]-если вы не любити однотипные звуки природы,скрипов домов и в принципе музыку и звуки которые вызыввают только спокойствие или тривогу,то это игра не для вас
[h1]Сюжет[/h1]-если вы не любите мрачные и депресивные история где нет и капли радости,где вас не будут вести за руку игде надо включать мозг и немного додумывать самим,это игра не для вас


Всем остальным я желаю окунуться в этот мир безумия и неизвестности

37063594.review:
Three hours in might seem like not enough time to review an item, but by the Gods this game is terror. 
( Been playing strictly at late at Night with minimal lighting - I recommend it if horror is your thing )

+ The Art; A nice dark atompshere with great detail put into the artwork; every little step / cutscene / interaction, that has visuals paired along side it, perfectly sets the tone of the game.

+ The Sounds; Oh lordy the noises outside my safehouse; first night cowering in my house after running home as the sun set; I backed myself into a corner and kept my field of view surveying my only secured room. That's when the howling started, followed by a door in my house y'know just slowly creeking open itself. Nothing entered my home that night, but not every night is so lucky.

+ The Beginning; The tutorial throws you through a curve; I personally liked how they didn't sacrifice tone in the beginning and yet they were still able to explain most of the base gameplay mechanics fluidily through the start. 

+ The Gathering; I'll be frank, Resource gathering in survivial games is a given but they can make or break a game for me depending on how it is incorperated. Darkwoods does it right with the intense sense of urgency you get when you finally check out your starting base and realize you only have one window boarded up, your doors aren't secure, medical supplies are in short supply, " Dear God We Need Gasoline " repeating in the back of your mind as you attempt to explore the unforgiving terrain around you.

+ The Writing; be it a journal entry, talking to yourself, interacting with someone, or something just outside your view in the shadows taunting you - the writing in this game is great and reflects that the writers put alot of time into choosing their words as they constructed this world alongside the artists.

+ The Price; Let's talk price, for what you are recieving, this games modest price reflects that the people who worked on and produced this product aren't just after a cash grab.

+/- The Challenge; This is an unforgiving game, starting off you are gonna be confused and a little overwelmed at the surroundings. The game will not lead you along by the hand, this can be positive or negative to some players, but you will be challenged and you will most likely die a few times your first day. Don't let it discourage you.

+/- The Parched; You can't drink the moonshine, even if you feel your character needs a little more liquid courage than a torch.

+/- The Trip; You can eat the mushrooms.. well, some of them without dying. Consume the Fungi Responsibly.

+/- The Path; When I mentioned the tutorial covering most of the gameplay mechanics, the keyword is *most*, starting off can be like, really confusing. As you progress you'll learn a few more mechanics they didn't cover in the beginning; you can take that as a positive challenge or a negative learning curve.

+/- The Dark; This is a dark game, not just concept wise; overlooking stuff is pretty easy and with the field of view mechanic you can get pretty lost, pretty quick. You can take it positive as it sets a heavy tone in the game or you can see it negatively that perhaps there isn't an option to remove that mechanic so you can actually see all of the small details the folks put into this game.

- The Jump; The only negative I could say at this point is if you have like a heart condition or something this probably ain't the game for you, cause this will jumpscare the spirit out of you at times.

36972419.review: Darkwood est un jeu à peu près unique, qui mélange pas mal de genres différents : horreur, survie, craft ou encore RPG. On est parachuté dans un monde inconnu auquel on ne comprend pas grand-chose, à part qu’il est question d’une forêt sombre de laquelle il est impossible de sortir. Il y a un cycle jour/nuit, on explore, on loot des trucs, on se bat et on meurt souvent. Mais avant d’être un titre sur lequel on colle une étiquette de genre ou de gameplay, Darkwood c’est d’abord un jeu doté d’une ambiance horrifique bien particulière puisque La direction artistique est inspirée des hallucinations liées à la paralysie du sommeil des développeurs. Alfred Hitchcock a dit un jour : « Donnez-leur du plaisir. Le même plaisir qu’ils ressentent en se réveillant d’un cauchemar ». Une citation qui résume bien Darkwood, une sorte de cauchemar éclatant de réussite pour ses concepteurs et de plaisir pour son public.

Jugabilidad creible y fluida, personajes creíbles y conversaciones enganchantes.

36944727.review:
If you're searching for a game that will genuinely get your heart pumping, Darkwood is a good option. The top-down perspective may not be normal for survival-horror games, however, after about a half hour you may find yourself properly in the shoes of your avatar. Between the excellent ambient sound and that vague visuals, Darkwood is perhaps one of the only horror games that I've personally found to be truely horrifying. The night time in particular will have you sitting in a corner with a claw hammer, hoping that whatever is walking around in the next room won't open the door. So by all means, if you enjoy horror and want a decent scare that doesn't rely on jump-scare tactics then give Darkwood a try.
