34411085.review:
Do you like being scared? Do you LOVE not knowing whats waiting for you in the dark? How about a atmospheric enviroment that fills you with dread? If twisted and dark story lines are your thing, If you love games that don't hold your hand, then stop reading and buy this now. 

I've haven't been truly scared in a game in a long time. I'm talking about a Amnesia dark descent kinda scared. Where you can't see whats eating you and your imagination makes it worse because the game is designed to make you hide. You can fight back but you'll quickly learn that hiding is always the first option because the fight will come wether you like it or not. You are NEVER totally safe. Once you leave the first hideout anything can happen. You can be smart and lay elaborate traps Home Alone style using gas, bear traps, molotovs, melee weapons, guns, and the smarter you think about your setup the more effictive it can be. The game will throw new challenges at you constantly though so you will always have to adapt. The game is hard and should be played on hard imo. Its balenced so perfectly that you can stay in the first area as long as you like, and if you want to hoarde supplies for 30 days or more you can. Or you can rush the other areas right away. Play as fast or as slow as you'd like, but don't play on normal. You can die as much as you want on normal and that must destroy all the tension that comes with surviving the night. On hard you have 4 lives and the tension is insane. 

Play this game as blind as possible. I've said too much already, but don't worry b/c there is sooo much content waiting to be explored if you want to look. The game won't tell you where every little thing is, whats the next move, or who you should trust. They let you discover and guide you as little as possible. Its wonderful when a game respects the player this much. 

Play on hard, be patient, curious but cautous, but whatever you do, make sure to stay away from your windows at night. If you can see them coming they can see you hiding... 
"This is it, don't get scared now."

34410471.review:
Darkwood is an extremly atmospheric horror-survival game relying pretty heavily on audio cues, I'm writing this after only playing it for like an hour and half so my views may change as time goes on but for now I have to say that this game is incredible at giving you a sense of dread, a palpable feeling of unease. For some reference as to how I was playing, It was one in the morning I had all the lights on and my headphones turned all the way up like any true horror game is supposed to be played; and all the disperate creaks and groans and forboding foot steps in the distance really make you feel like you're in those acursed woods. The few npcs I've seen up to this point haven't had too much of fleshed out background or anything but that fits really in line with the entire game, you're thrust into a creepy hostile world full of things that might want to kill you or at the very least spook the shit outta you. Overall I really enjoy this game, if you're somebody that likes games like five nights; this game probably isn't for you. Here atmosphere is the name of the game so if you enjoyed silent hill, amnesia or to a certain extent outlast this is the game for you and for $15 I honestly think it's a steal. 

 One last thing though I'd reccomend not watching lets plays of this one if you have any interest in owning it, if it sounds good to you give it a shot; don't ruin the experince by looking up gameplay.

34409062.review:
The game has a fantastic setting and atmosphere, and is extremely enjoyable to explore. The survival and crafting elements are also very enjoyable, and fans of similar games like Don't Starve will no doubt find this a rewarding experience. Looting and scrounging are fun and interesting, and scratch that inventory managment itch for freaks like myself.

Combat, unfortunately, is the game's biggest drawback. While the game is very clearly not intended to be a slaughterfest superhero fantasy, the clunkiness and unintuitive control systems make combat not just stressul (as likely intended) but also incredibly frustrating. Coupled with the high lethality of the enemies, there will often be many situations where death occurs not because of poor player decision, but because of struggling with the 2+ step inputs required for basic attacks and loose placement/hitboxes on many items and attacks.

Another, albeit more minor issue is that lack of descriptions on many items. Some items, such as pills or bandages, have clear concise explanations of how they function (healing items). Others, like bread and potatos, offer mediocre, but lacking descriptors, simply stating "consumable" without going into the effects. But many, many others have no descriptions whatsoever. Items such as rocks and empty bottles, which I assumed were merely crafting materials/by-products (which they are) are also thrown weapons. There are many other far more egregious examples present (mostly crafting materials which have no indication what they are used for), and it does not give the impression of intentional obfuscation of information for "discovery" purposes, but rather that half the items were forgotten when they hit the description making phase of development.

Lastly, a more subjective gripe of mine that others may not agree with is how slow the game is. Not its pace of combat or movement, but rather its progression. Most of the player's time is spent wandering in search of the plot or scrounging for materials that may or may not aide in said search of plot. The quests are almost Dark Souls levels of obtuse in some cases, and can lead to a lot of time wasted doing nothing. Coupled with the inevitable daily speed bump of the defense periods, and aforementioned issues with combat, a lot of days result in a 2 steps forward one step back progression. Again, this is a subjective point, but I found it a bit too laborious for my tastes.

Now with all that said, I would still reccommend the game, especially if you are a fan of survival/crafting games. Your experience with the combat and progression issues may vary, but I can whole-heartedly reccommend the setting and theme.

34401779.review:
Вы должны быть, удивились, увидев неготивный отзыв на игру, которую так много и не однозначно нахваливают люди? Я Вам объясню, почему данный продукт по моему мнению - не зашел. 

Если не хотите читать "МнОгАбУкВ", то итоги и заключение в самом низу и комменты на эту тему.

Darkwood - действительно, один из редких хорроров где атмосфера такая, что в дрожь бросает, суровый, ужасающий лес который не выпускает тебя из своих объятий, по истене, нагоняет тревожную и пугающую атмосферу... Пролог повествует нам об одном из "обитателя", который находится в плену этого самого леса. Лес - не обычный, он пропитан не известным вирусом, который заставляет его расти и расти, затмевая всю округу и окутывая все пути выхода своими плотными корнями. Наш персонаж, потеряв память и драгоценный ключ знает о подземном туннеле, который, как он думает, выводит его на свободу. 

Первые впечатления от этой игры были действительно потрясающими. Днем я бродил по округе, в поисках вкусного лута и просто обследуя местность, а ночью, я сев в угол дома в позе эмбриона грыз палец от странных шорохов и шагов, а когда раздался стук в дверь, настойчивый но прервный, я и вовсе оцепенел, наблюдая за этой самой дверью и гадая, выдержит ли моя баррикада? Ни одна игра не могла ввести меня в такое состояние, я действительно был готов ожидать от игры в дальнейшем только еще более завораживающий геймплей с атмосферой настоящего хоррора. Но как я ошибался... 

Пережив еще 4 дня и 4 ночи, я не скажу, что они все прошли спокойно и однотипно, но одно я скажу Вам наверняка - атмосфера застыла на вторую ночь. Серьезно. Все время были те же шорохи, те же стуки в дверь, тот же гул и тот же дурманивающий шепот голосов. Они просто перестали меня держать в тех эмоциях, которые я встретил при первом часе игры. Я буд-то не ожиданно стал импотентом. "Но как же так"? - подумал я. "Разве могла игра так быстро позволить мне привыкнуть к ней?". Не смерившись с этим, я начал активно изучать каждый уголок леса, который мне только можно было изучить, но я встретил лишь муть в виде КОДОВОГО ЗАМКА! И казалось бы "А что в этом такого? Ну найди код да введи его..." А нет, мой дорогой друг, код ты вовсе не найдешь т.к даже намёка нет, где бы он мог находиться. Ты можешь изрыть всю близжайшую местность от двери, где требуеться код но так и не найти его. И такая фигня будет тебе попадаться не один раз, а два и три как было у меня. Найдя путь в другой биом, который кешит еще более пугающими созданиями я лишь подкрепил свою веру в то, что игра еще сможет вселить страх в мое сердце потребителя данного продукта...

...и я был огорчен. Началось знакомство с персонажами, которые ничего к себе не вызывали, кроме чувства безразличия. Это просто были сошедшие с ума люди, которые даже на людей-то не шибко похожи. Они начинают трясти нас из стороны в сторону дабы позже помочь нам в поисках нашего ключика в жизнь со свежем воздухом, а мы, попутно выживать в новом, чуть более большом убежище, вновь остраивая его и укрепляя. Но смысл? Казалось бы, закидал ты дверь всем, чем только мог, но дикари так или иначе приспокойно отпихивают дверь и пролизают через весь хлам, наплевав на твои труды. Ну ок, ты ломаешь им лица и уже залечиваешь раны.... Но вдруг! Начинают приходить сразу другие виды тварей, наплевав на такую ключевую особенность как "Распыляющий газ" который по идее, должен отгонять эту самую заразу. А монстры пользуются тактикой: "Раш Б пацаны!" и просто толпой ломатся к тебе в комнату, попутно отпихивая твои баррикады из мебели и ломая доски на дверях доберая до не много ошарашенного тебя.. Ты отключаешься. Просыпаешься. Возвращаешь вещи которые не далеко лежат и продолжаешь выживать днем. Ночь. И вновь происходит старая процедура. 

Позже игра просто перестает вывозить своей великолептной атмосферой и становиться похожей на рутину, где ты как муровей выползаешь за припасами из муровейника, и ночью какой нибудь урод пинает по нему и тебе вновь приходиться вставать на ноги. 

Итоги: 

Достоинства: 
1 - Великолептная атмосфера, которую я давно не ощущал. 
2 - Интересная идея игры и хорошее ознокомление. 
3 - Потрясающее звуковое оформление, которая лишь подчеркивает атмосферу.

Недостатки: 
1 - Малые размеры игрового мира.
2 - Скудные варианты лута. 
3 - Скучный крафт необходимый для выживания. 

Убожества:
1 - Абсолютно бесполезные баррикады из мебели.
2 -  Другие биомы изменяют убежище на арену, где ты защищаешься от абсурда. 
3 - Сюжет начинается тем, что ты ищешь потерянный ключ и заканчивается тогда, когда ты его находишь, между этим ничего примечательного ты не заметишь.
4 -  Кодовые двери... Даже игроки, успевшие перепройти игру так и не нашли эти коды. 
5 - Баги - их тут не мало, начиная от дикорей застривающих в  текстурах, заканчивая тем, что "Ужас ночи" появляеться у тебя в убежище (хотя по механике игры, его и близко не должо быть рядом пока включена печь) и сидит на месте.
6 - Боевка - Игра начинает напоминать Resident Evil 7, по началу, ты огребаешь и боишься большинство вещей в этой игре, а затем, ты крафтишь пистолет и игра уже превращаеться в тир с монстрами. Да и вообще ближнебойный бой походит на Дарк Соулс: "Удар, перекат, удар, перекат, бинт, удар, перекат, удар, перекат... О, 8 утра! Наконец-то..." и враги просто испоряятся, включая их трупы, которые ты мог не успеть залутать.

Вывод: В игре как я говорил ранее - достойная атмосфера для хоррора, но очень скоро ты осознаешь, что атмосфера - это все, что есть в данной игре. Ничего, за что её можно было бы похвалить, не присутствует.

34393553.review:
Игра довольно своеобразна и может понравиться не каждому, но нервы она щекочет однозначно.. Давайте перейдем к полному обсуждению игры.
1. Звук, Графика, Управление.
1.1. Звук.
Играя в наушниках, можно построить кирпичный завод, производящий кирпичи для постройки кирпичных гаражей и домов.. Конкретно слышно малейшие звуки в высочайшем качестве и точно слышно, насколько они далеко и с какой стороны раздаются.. Звук сделан просто идеально! Оценка звуку: 10 из 10.
1.2. Графика.
Графика в игре своеобразная и может понравиться не каждому. Полный вид сверху без наклона вводит иногда в заблуждение. Конкретно иногда можно не разглядеть друга или противника поблизости, если он не двигается, так же немного размытые пиксели, из-за чего иногда не понимаешь, что вокруг за предметы! Оценка графике: 6 из 10
1.3. Управление.
Иногда требуется слишком много действий, что бы к примеру залить бензин в генератор (открыть инвентарь, взять в руки канистру, закрыть инвентарь, держа канистру зажать правую клавишу мыши на генераторе и левой нажать действие).. Действительно много действий. Движение по карте идёт исключительно клавиатурой, мышью идёт только обзор вокруг, что не даёт возможности ходить плавно, затрудняя движение и часто может привести к смерти с учётом линейного движения и натыкания на предметы, которых изначально можно не заметить, как я говорил выше. Оценка управлению: 5 из 10.
2. Обзор. Физика. Анимация.  Сложность игры.
2.1. Обзор.
Сильно добавляет хоррору эффект то, что вид хоть и сверху, но видеть ты будешь только то, что впереди тебя и находится в радиусе твоего обзора. С одной стороны это не приятно, с другой даёт сильный эффект. Даже когда вокруг тебя много света, тебе со страхом прийдется оборачиваться назад, нет ли там никого. Оценка обзору: 10 из 10.
2.2. Физика.
Сверху вообще трудно понять, есть ли физика вообще, но если бросать предметы, колотить врагов, то можно понять, что физика всё же какая-то, но есть. Приятно так же, что шкафом или стулом можно перекрыть дырку в доме, либо загородить дверь (при моей первой игре в первую же ночь была слегка приоткрыта входная дверь загороженная стулом, которую я закрыл перед ночью.. Это действительно пугает и переживать вторую ночь в десятки раз страшнее).. Оценка физике: 9 из 10 (с учётом вида сверху). Предметы не опрокидываются к сожалению..
2.3. Анимация.
Однозначно хорошая анимация. Про движение этого не скажу, слишком роботизированное движение, но эффект горения факела, анимация в боёвке, анимация при расколачивании баррикад очень мне понравились. Оценка анимации: 9 из 10.
2.4. Сложность игры.
Сложность игры подбирается не опасностью соперников или скорым наступленим ночи с малым колличеством лута, а просто тем, закончишь ты игру полностью при смерти, либо возродишься с неполным инвентарем. Вам уже в самом начале будет не хватать лута. В самом начале вы уже будете случайно наступать на ядовитые грибы. И в самый первый же поход вы заблудитесь, это точно.. Но данная игра даёт опыт для вас, чтобы в следующий раз не совершить ошибок начав игру заново.. По сути игра довольно сложная для новичков, пока не прийдет понятие, что выживать нужно так, словно действительно ты в игре находишься сам и сохранений нет!. Оценка сложности : 10 из 10.
3. Боёвка.
Довольно интересная боёвка с несколькими видами ударов, так же имеющая задержку перед ударом (замах) и требование вычислять момент для удара.. исход боя так же может зависеть от длины оружия в руках. Однозначно хорошая, но не идеальная боёвка для данной игры. Следовало бы доработать её новыми идеями. Оценка боёвке: 8 из 10.
Общая оценка игре: 9 из 10.
Данную игру однозначно стоит купить любителям хоррор-игр. Данная игра может быть внешне похожа на некоторые хоррор-игры видом сверху, но это не так! Обязательно попробуйте, не пожалеете.

34386287.review:
I abstained from writing this review until Darkwood was publicly released. That being said, I've owned this game well over two years, so I've got quite a bit to say. To compare this game to others would be a crime, but if I had to, I'd say that Darkwood feels like playing Hotline Miami, if HM were inside of the Blair Witch Project. 

The top-down perspective may seem like an odd choice for a survival horror, but it ends up working very well in Darkwood, since your cone of vision is small, and the added challenge of having to mouse over areas to see underneath tree cover adds to a perfectly executed sense of claustrophobia.

The primary gameplay loop of Darkwood is fairly simple: Explore, scavenge, and arm yourself during the day, then gas up your generator and wait out the night. If you fail to make it back to your safehouse and power on the lights before dark, Bad Things® will happen. What makes nighttime truly terrifying in Darkwood is the lack of a sleep mechanic: You are awake at all times and constantly afraid that your pitiful house defenses will be breached and you'll suffer Even More Bad Things®. 

The sound design also adds so much to that tension of waiting out the night. You'll hear footsteps outside your door. You'r door will be beaten upon. Things will go bump in the night, and you'll be cowering in the corner waiting, praying, for that music to start and your screen to go red, signifying the successful survival of another night.

Setting and plot wise, Darkwood has the most compelling location and premise of any horror game I've ever played. I won't spoil much, just remember to respect the trees.

Controls and game feel are 100% spot-on. Graphics look very good, especially if you like little details (Just look at how the grass moves!) 

Buy the game. Door code couldn't be simpler. Mind the Violinist.

34384529.review:
At first I was a little spooked, but this game teaches a valuable lesson about not judging a book by it's cover. The rabid dogs, and pincer faced slugs that roam the forbidding areas look like scary enemies that you should fight in a typical game. However, I grew to look for them as friends given that no matter how many times they attacked me, when I would fall over, they would lovingly bundle me up and take me back home. They would even put me to bed with milk and cookies, and I would wake up perfectly fine the next day. 

I played the game on the normal difficulty settings, and after getting killed about 5 times by dogs and the starting monsters, I figured out that I was immortal. I would even start looking for baddies to kill me as a form of fast travel when I didn't want to hoof it back home. The fact that there are NO consequences for getting killed takes all the suspense out of the game.

Darkwood is like if somebody took all the things that made the STALKER series terrifying (uncertainty, no hand-holding, resource management, etc.) and then placed it in a world that's extremely bizzare, like SIlent Hill level of bizzare, and I fucking love it.

34379367.review:
Wow, what a journey. A top down actual survival horror game that actually has an intriguing storyline. Categories typically get a base score, followed by pros and cons. 


Graphics: 9/10
==========
Many will question why I give this game a 9. I don't believe graphics have to have 1000000000 polygons to be good. This game chose a more pixel style of graphics with what I believe to be some hand drawn environments. Whatever it is, the composition comes together so damn well. The Depth of field on trees that are high up in the air way above your character, to the animations of enemies and your character, to the fire and flames and 3D buildings. It all looks great and has fantastic polish. Well done. +9


Story: 8/10
========
This is a game where I can't really give a synopsis to what is going on. You will just have to play the game. +8

Some major/minor character questlines have unexplained and unforetold consequences to the story and your surrounding environment. This isn't necessarily a bad thing but it has a chance of frustrating you since you probably won't be able to go back and change it (unless you reset very quickly). As someone who always tries to achieve the best ending possible, this affected my "try not to die" playthrough. +/- 0


Sound/Music: 10/10
==============
10 out of freaking 10. This is a game where you will constantly be saying to yourself "wtf was that noise." From the subtle footsteps you'll occasionally hear of someone walking around in your hideout that isn't you, to the creepy eerie music that confronts you upon approaching a critical point in the storyline. It's all brilliant. +9

No jumpscares. +1


Gameplay: 9/10
===========
Gameplay revolves around scouraging for supplies and progressing the storyline in the daytime, to surviving the nighttime in your house against the perils of the forest. +2

Crafting system is easy to understand, works great, and is implemented without frustration (besides missing a needed supply). +1

Fair difficulty settings ranging from Normal (infinite lives), to Hard (limited lives), to Nightmare (one life). +1

Enemies are varied in difficulty as the game progresses and all have unique abilities that might just end your 1 life playthrough. They are however readable, learnable, and aren't frustrating to deal with. You get the hard mode without the headache. +2

Again, no jumpscares. +1

Events that take place directly at the hideout at nighttime are brilliant and creepy. One night you may not encounter a single enemy, but instead will find someone knocking on your door to leave you supplies. Another night you'll face against 10 Huge Dogs. Good luck. +2


Unique category, Lighting and Vision: 10/10
================================
Darkwood gets its own category of how it handles the lighting and the vision in this game. It takes into account not only the visual perspective of your character's eyes, but also of electricity, and fire, and whatever the hell those things are later in the game that emit light. Sometimes an enemy will temporarily destroy all electrical sources of light. Lets hope you have some torches or a flare! Even things such as getting poisoned, or drunk on alcohol will affect your given vision, typically narrowing it for a period. And there are abilities that give you greater vision. Some enemies simply require that you don't look directly at them, no matter how close you may be to them, and they can't do a damn thing to you.

It's these things that I feel needed to be accounted for, for how brilliantly they're used. Well done. +10

Overall: 9.2/10 (46/50 = 0.92)
=====================
It's not often I buy a game that I am just so utterly excited to play again the next day. I'm sure I'm not the only one. For what Darkwood is, it nails just about every aspect of its intended presentation. Well done developers!

34377561.review:
Darkwood is a fantastic horror game.  One of the best.  Sadly I have to thumbs down for me personally over a few issues. 

- The game is unfortunatly somewhat linear.  It  tells you where to go next, and to reach these points you must discover door codes.
- Combat is pretty awful.  I get it that a wood board shouldn't last more than a dozen swings...but your character gets winded after two swings.  
- Bad stamina meter.  Again, your character gets exhausted after jogging for about 10 seconds.  Most out of shape protaganist i've played in awhile.  
- Game gets progressively more difficult as you move to each zone.  This is fantastic however, dying does almost nothing.  You lose a few items and wake up fresh and new back at your home.  So all the tenseness of the game is gone after you find out you can just keep regenerating. 
- Did I mention the combat is bad? Hit detection and the weight of your movement is off.   Like I said above, the protaganist gets exhausted after two swings.  

Other than these issues...the game is fantastic.  I actually recommend any horror fans pick it up. It just wasn't for me.  I even rebought the game and tried it again and still can't stand playing it for more than 20 minutes.  Not a fun game to play after the first hour.

34376446.review:
Darkwood is a top-down survival/horror/semi-sandbox that has a lot of game design choices borrowed from Stalker, Dark Souls, Sunless Sea and even the fundamentals of the "survival" niche. While you might find that recipe on the Steam page every ten games, what none of its peers have on Darkwood is atmosphere. This game bombards you with a mournful, dreadful air that never lets off the gas. Respecting both your intelligence, visual taste, and ability to pick up subtleties is what makes it such an engaging experience to people who like grit in their horror games, and nothing that is too colorful or playful or even shocking. You won't encounter a single jumpscare here.

Rating: 5/5, my personal favorite game of 2017 so far. Worth it for the asking price, and any self respecting horror fan that appreciates atmosphere and substance over shock and gore should pick it up.

Pros:

*The combat is satisfying, the breadth of the maps is just enough to promote exploration and intrigue, the story beats are cryptic and sinister (they remind me of sunless sea's writing and style) and the day/night cycle is the best I've seen in a game besides Shadows of Chernobyl.
*Atmosphere is somewhere between The Zone and Lothric. Occultism, monstrous mutants and supernatural phenomena all blend together.
*In the AMA the lead developer Gustaw said he had to learn sound design from scratch. This /has/ to be a lie, because everything from the crunchy melee hits to the horrific monsters are pro jobs.
*Once you get to the second and third biomes, you start to realize how insanely scary night time can be. 

Cons:

*Early game drags, and can be a poor introduction to confused or hasty players. 
*Could absolutely use context, control and mechanic tutorials for the unitiated in the subgenre.
*Pacing between chapters story-wise is radically different, showcasing how it took five years of inconsistent writing to finish them alpha by alpha.
*Unquestionably needs some more quality of life and breadth of content. Would like to be able to build/repair furniture, have a static TV or radio of my own at night to listen to, some things to do that keep me located in the hideout even if its a farm of wormy potatos to do once a day.

---

In Darkwood you take control of a nameless protagonist and have to scavenge an (initially randomized) map of three biomes in order to survive. There is no hunger or thirst, just what you can build and take with you to maintain your nightly supply of generator gas to keep the monsters away, and nails/boards/weapons and ammo to survive the nights. Because while you can roam the map and encounter random hostiles with a meaty and difficult combat engine in daylight, at night time, you have to barricade your windows, slide furniture in front of gaps and just wish to survive. Rather than focusing on jumpscares, Darkwood will assail you with a dozen varieties of enemies and meta-events at night that will creep you out and also probably kill you.

In day, the game feels a lot like Stalker. Named NPC's can be interacted with and have side quests and agendas of their own. Inbetween these milestone places are horrifying mutants, loose dogs and wolves, and some more supernatural enemies. Progressively each biome is pushed over to the next, much like the navigation from cordon -> garbage -> the bar etc in STALKER. While not entirely linear, it is less sandbox and more a survival/horror experience with guideposts on the story.

The sound design is terrific and the minimal use of intense music and horrific noises from the dark really help to unsettle you, especially since you can only view in a 90 degree cone (whats not seen is greyed out, and you can't see enemies perfectly in a radius so they often sneak up on you.) 

The story is an unusual one of minimalism and style over substance, but some unnerving choices help to present the moral ambiguity of the world. I did a few things because I was told to by the only character I knew at the time, and only later found they were optional and another, "cleaner" path was possible. But it was too late. Much like my playthrough with Darkwood I was too brutalized, unfocused, and defeated. What happened happened. 

In summary if you like your survival horror games to be complete with an unnerving atmosphere of occultism and corrupted mutation, like the idea of being in "The Zone" again but this time with trees, always wanted a game in this niche to truly have terrifying night cycles, and have patience to respect both the slow pace and drip feed of upgrades and weapons, than this game is for you. Any self respecting horror fan who appreciates the slow burn will find in Darkwood my personal favorite game of 2017.

34368888.review:
A fantasic top-down, atmospheric survival horror game that is a treat for the ears and the eyes.

Fantastic music and sound design creates a continual feeling of tension.

The unique aiming and line of sight + lighting mechanics make the game constanly engaging throughout, making outdoor well lit areas just as tense as the pitch dark, ruined buildings because in the former you'll be constanly exposed and never able to watch every direction that something could jump out to attack you, while in the latter you'll be needing to carefully creep around corners with your torch, always ready to swap to a weapon or dart back out of the room as soon as you spot an enemy.

That game also looks astonishing. At it's simplest it looks nice and atmospheric, but in some of it's most interesting environments it looks like a moving H.R Gieger painting.

All this and more combines to create one of the best survival horror games ever made, in my oppinion.

34368395.review:
За долгие годы жанр хоррора успел изжить себя настолько, что превратился в конвеер однотипных высeров от первого лица, до отказа набитых второсортными скримерами. И вот, выходит наконец-таки игра, которая прекрасно напоминает о том, что такое по-настоящему хороший хоррор.

Darkwood хоррор-выживалка, сделанная в лучших традициях творений Говарда Филлипса Лавкрафта. В результате неизвестного инцидента целые гектары отдалённой сельской территории превращаются в ловушку для местных жителей, которые, под действием этой самой ловушки, теряют рассудок и изменяются, превращаясь, в лучшем случае, в одичалых дикарей или же во что-то невообразимо жуткое и неестественное, заставляющее держать оружие на готове и прислушиваться к малейшему шороху.
Раз уж я заикнулся об атмосфере - перейдём сразу к ней. Игра поделенна на день и ночь, потому вам уже изначально нужно будет следить за сменой окружающих оттенков, дабы вовремя заприметить закат и успеть вернуться в убежище, а до тех пор, вы обследуете местность, разорённую лесом и его новыми обитателями. Каждый миг в игре приходится прислушиваться, чтобы случайно не стать жертвой новых обитателей, чей рёв уже может заставить игрока вырубить с перепугу игру. Однако слух здесь нередко обманывается то отдалёнными звуками, чей источник не всегда ясен, то внезапным шорохом или треском неподалёку. Может, это лишь воображение нашего протагониста? А что же до ночи? Если днём видимость довольно стрёмная, из-за заслоняющих солнце зарослей, то ночью она отсутствует вообще. В это время вам лучше бы находиться в убежище, если только вы не идиот без инстинкта самосохранения. И вот тут вы почувствуете, что такое страх, так как сидеть в доме, наполненном непроглядной тьмой, гулом и эхом, доносящимся из леса, а так же жуткими скрипучими звуками и дверьми, открывающимися по неизвестной причине - дело не из приятных. Однако, вам придётся окунуться в эту жуть с головой, так как ваше убежище в любой миг может заинтресовать местную живность, которая охотно сдерёт с вас шкуру и, чёрт возьми, разработчики знали, каких тварей стоит пихать в это непроглядное время. А всё ваше времяпрепровождение сопроваждается жутким эмбиентом, который не дурно так подливает масла в огонь.
Darkwood является игрой с видом сверху, но окружающее пространство вам известно лишь в незначительных деталях, остальные окружающие объекты, среди которых фурнитура, препятствия, ловушки и НПС, видны лишь тогда, когда протагонист смотрит в их сторону. Вроде бы фишка слишком непримечательная, а фиг там, недоглядеть что-нибудь тут временами легче, чем во всяких играх от первого лица, где давно уже стало принято подсвечивать или выделять объекты для взаимодействия, но тут буквально на каждую вещь нужно наводиться, чтобы понять, можно ли её использовать. Бои же тут и вовсе напряжные, особенно с неколькими противниками, благо далеко не всегда получается всех удержать в поле видимости, а чем дальше в лес - тем опаснее твари. И да, атаки в этой игре не так казуальны, как во многих других играх, тут нужно привыкать и рассчитывать, а не тупо бить по кнопкам.
Что же по поводу обследования территории, вы этим будете заниматься не только ради того, чтобы в будущем на ней ориентироваться (о да, карта здесь - зарисовки местности, которые не дают вам чёткого представления о вашем местонахождении), но и для поиска и сбора жизненно важных вещей, среди которых - лекарства, тряпки, напитки, хлам и инструменты, и всё это нужно, как для продления своей жизни, так и для создания и ремонта оружия и укреплений в убежище.
Что же до персонажей, их тут не очень много, но вполне достаточно, чтобы разбавить жуткую прогулку по лесу не менее жутким разговором с очередным психом, которого ты бы лучше убил, но чёрт возьми, с кем ещё можно поговорить, когда ты находишься в огромной, заросшей психушке?

Итого, я охотно готов заявить, что Darkwood - лучший хоррор за последние годы. Тяжёлая, тёмная атмосфера, заставляющая игрока бояться даже собственного воображения и приглядываться к каждой мелочи, в надежде на недостающий лут. Монстры, не дающие покоя ни днём, ни, тем более, ночью, и нпс, давно сбрендившие настолько, что хочется унести ноги из этого леса как можно быстрее, дабы невольно не присоединиться к ним.

34367193.review:
After playing for a few days  I have to sadly give this one the thumbs down.

The game is clearly unpolished after spending years in early access/development hell.

The concept is great, but the game is failed by horrible quality of life issues, clunky controls and bad mechanics which all contribute to artificial difficulty.

For instance the only way to dodge is backwards while most enemies have a charge attack which will just continue to slam into you. Sidestepping would have been a better dodge. 

Combat often involves madly running around in circles trying to avoid attacks while your enemies are unseen due to being outside of your cone of vision.

Other problems include:

 -Mushrooms spawning directly under your feet even while you are in combat in your own hideout's kitchen.

-Tech restrictions being clunky, nonsensical and a burden. You can build a pistol before you can build an axe, despite having an axe-head and wooden shaft from early in the game.

-Barricading being poorly explained and implemented. Dogs can chew their way through a barricaded door and two wardrobes while you can do nothing to repair and/or reinforce them. If you go all out with barricading (which seems to be the only sane thing to do) you will also miss out on special events at night which can lead to items.

-Monsters making a beeline towards you inside your hideout despite you not making any movement, them not having line of sight and sometimes you being in complete darkness. Why have atmospheric line of sight and stealth mechanics like being quiet and hiding to avoid attention if monsters just ignore these mechanics.

-Monsters spawning DIRECTLY ON YOU while you are outside in the day time. I'm not talking a screen away, I'm talking you turn around and turn back and a huge dog is bearing down on you.

-Many minor annoyances which all add to player frustration. For instance you have to relight ovens when returning to old hideouts, something you are only warned about immediately before monsters start spawning due to nightfall. RIP if like me you'd already barricaded yourself inside your generator room.


I get that this is the developers first real game, but I don't think this is worth US$15.

My advice is to get this for half price on a sale and blast through the main story on normal mode to minimise frustration, and only that if top down atmospheric horror games are your cup of tea.

34366973.review:
Fantastic horror game, can be difficult but is very fair. Personally happy that perma-death is optional now lol, god knows I'd still be stuck in dry medow grinding the trader otherwise most likely.

I got this when it was released in Alpha for Early Access, and I stopped playing because at the time I felt the development was taking quite a while and honestly was regretting my purchase, mainly due to it being an early access title at the time. However, I remember seeing it in beta this year and got curious although the dev had said to wait until release if you were someone who stopped playing, which actually caught me off guard, telling the consumer to be patient for the full release, but I listened and I gotta say, it's extremely different from its start.

If you enjoy horror I strongly recommend this game, and I mean games like Silent Hill, Lone Surviver, and other atmospheric horror games. If you're looking for something that's primarly about jump scares, this isn't it. The game world is very rich and the characters are all interesting. One of the early traders you find I personally thought was a pretty cool guy, not trust worthy, and he eventually gave me a choice (which I won't spoil) and I thought at the time, out of everyone I had met in the game, I could trust him to a point, although now I'm thinking I may have made a mistake. Not a game breaking mistake, but just a different path.

Overall, I strongly recommend this if you're looking for a solid, atmopsheric, psychological, challenging horror game. My only wish is for a different game mode, like a survival or co-op mode with a procedually generated map with respawning items. The game does have multiple endings and a lot replayability because of this, however, a lot of people are asking for a seperate co-op/survival mode, so hopefully the devs do eventually include this.

34365305.review:
Wonderful atmosphere!  Well done audio!  This review is going to get a lot of exclamation points behind every other sentence!!

Survival horror done right and builds the tension to a crescendo as nights roll around and just about anything can happen.  

Find loads of items to create many things with to help survive each and every day and night.  

Nights seemingly last forever as even though it may take a good while for something to happen... the anticipation of waiting for it to come can make you go insane .....but in a good way!

The biggest downfall of this game are the triggered scenarios.  Once you have played through the game a few times, they will get a bit old.  

The fighting in this game is something I'm on the fence about.  On the one hand it's not easy to control and you will have a hard time in fights because of how unwieldy it is.  On the other hand, just about any good horror game creator will tell you that fighting is something that should always be secondary and not the primary reaction.  This will be something that you will have to be your own judge on as you think about purchasing this game.  Not used to running for your life and shooting everything down? 34359736.review:
I was super hesitant going into the game regarding the idea of a top-down survival horror. 

But after 7 hours of game play, I am hooked. I very much enjoy the sense of urgency that arises when dusk arrives to make sure you are prepared to endure and survive the night. The artwork is great and fits the timbre of the game very well. I also enjoy the fact that the game pressures you to move further away from safehouses as resources are depleted in hopes of finding a cache or a new safehouse. The bartering system depends on your proficiency in surviving the night, or how well you manage resources to sell. 

The keybindings are intuitive and easy to learn, and engaging in combat is entirely optional. Although with high risk is high reward as enemies are typically guarding valuable items. 

There are no cheesey jump scares here which I adore. The game uses ambiance, glimpses of creatures in the distance (depending on your field of vision) and the knowledge of impending nightfall to make one soil their pantaloons. 

Huge thumbs up here. 

Fantastic game.

34359462.review:
An amazing top down horror survival. It has a compelling story with mysterious backgrounds to the characters that you will meet, and the game also has multiple endings depending on how you play the game. 

Tough early game that stays challenging till the very end, as well as suspenseful nights that feel rewarding with each one you survive.

Controls could be a bit more refined, but the mechanics are awesome and well thought out. 

End result, the game is an amazing experience to play through with much replayability, especially with the rouge-like aspects in the maps orientation and land mark placements with ever new game.

!!Do not skip the prologue if you want the full story!!

(also helpful tutorial)

34358191.review:
I'm really quite surprised that I've put as much time into a game like this that I have. It's quite good.

I backed this game, so I've been playing since the Alpha off and on. And it's great.

The atmosphere is wonderfully murky, the sound design is excellent (you can always tell what type of terrible creature lurks in the shadows when you get learn their sounds), the gameplay is balanced unto itself (combat against easy enemies is easy when you know what you're doing, and the harder enemies... you're always finding yourself questioning if it's worth the ammo and healing items to take them on-if, you have a choice.) The feeling of progression is constant as you play through- even at times when you don't know what you're meant to be doing, you can always explore more, and that brings me to this game's highest success.

This game does rogue-like randomization/replayability right. The exploration always feels good, because every trip out, your finding something new, you're progressing, your map is getting filled. And it's not just locations, you're meeting new characters, finding crazy hallucinogenic dreams, getting new items. And the characters you interact with, your choices impact their lives and the story as you move along, leaving you curious what would have been if you had made different choices... And thereby promoting replayability.

The game also gives you a great sense that your skill is what's improving with the game. You get better at the combat, you don't just get better weapons that do more damage. You know what items are most important to you when as you learn how to build. This game makes you feel rewarded as a player for getting better- things that once scared you, you can survive with a breeze.

Anyways, I could go on and on, but suffice this game is well worth the money, and the extra YEARS they put into its development. And this game is anything but predictable- from the intriuging characters you'll meet and interact with, and the consequences of your own actions that you never could have seen coming.

Buy it.

34357268.review:
Darkwood is a top-down perspective survival horror game created by the independent developer Acid Wizard Studio.

Having followed the game since its early access alpha to the final release, the end result has not left me unsatisfied. Darkwood is one the most atmospheric games I have ever played, and I would place it among my personal favorites such as the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. and Souls series in its immersion and atmosphere.

The gameplay could be described as slow. A lot of your time will be spent looting, exploring and preparing. Encounters with enemies often have drastic results if you have not properly anticipated them. It takes time to start coping with your surroundings and learning to deal with various nasty creatures and insidious environmental threats. Surviving a hectic night feels rewarding, and the peaceful, slow morning relaxes you, only to get you on your toes again as you explore a new area or meet new foreign threats after the next sundown.

Darkwood is a visual and auditory feast. The fantastically detailed art with its often sickeningly morbid and grotesque imagery that ramps up throughout the game is complemented by an excellent sound design. The animations and sound design make the combat feel weighty and visceral, and the creative, unique characters you meet in the game ooze personality, keeping one interested in seeing their stories evolve and conclude. 

The player's choices can have great effects on the characters and their surroundings, giving way to replayability to see the alternate ways things could go. The main plot is not a simple journey either, and you will find yourself questioning the things you see to piece together what is really happening through the protagonist's sometimes questionable, decaying mind.

The horror in Darkwood mostly stems from the fear of the unknown rather than simplistic jumpscares. The audio once again plays a major role in building the atmosphere - you will know when you've stumbled into a location where something is terribly wrong, and the soundscape will have the hairs of your neck standing in the anticipation of the unknown terror that awaits you at the end of the corridor.

If you find yourself deprived of highly atmospheric horror, challenging and methodical gameplay, a horrific world to explore, and an interesting story to piece together, Darkwood was made for you. It has been a while since I've had an experience so intriguing, tense and enjoyable, and I wish to share these feelings with anyone who reads this review and finds something that may interest them.

34357010.review:
An incredible gaming experience.

Fantastic art, solid animation, amazing graphical effects, lots of content, a simple but satisfying combat system, great thrilling atmosphere with no jumpscares, gorgeous world and lore design. All around, masterpiece game.

There is not much to complement in depth since it all simply is just really well done and very fun to play. However it should be noted that the game is more linear then it sounds. The world is decently randomized, and involves lots of free roam exploration, however the game still progresses based on quests and objectives. There is an overarching story which the protagonist is following, it isn't just an open survival experience.

A big problem the player may have with the gameplay, is that it involves a lot of scavenging and travelling. Players run around each map, looking for resources and bringing them back to their hideout, fighting enemies whenever they appear or run into them. At night they stay in their hideout and wait for dawn. A significant amount of the gameplay is travelling between locations, so players that prefer fast paced gameplay will likely not be able to stand this much.


Most of the downsides of the game itself are negligible but still note worthy. 

Players can only move at a decent pace by running, and running drains from the small stamina gauge players have. It is thus common to have to briefly stop or slow to a walk to regain stamina; which can be very tedious since the game involves a decent amount of travelling.

The combat, while being very fun, has some rough edges. The game does que the players offensive moves, so if players try to attack and get interrupted; they will auto-attack when they can next. Which is blatantly annoying and can lead to unnecessary harm recieved. There is also the problem of some enemies being more offensive then the player can respond to, so if the player gets flustered or ambushed they can get stun-locked because it requires so much precision to properly respond and counter the enemy that it isn't always possible when under pressure. Certain weapons also consume ridiculous amounts of stamina to use, which makes it borderline impossible to fight more aggressive enemies which players need to be able to interrupt. Meaning at certain stages of the game, certain weapons become useless. Certain enemies are blatantly faster then the player offencively, and require dodging and spacing to fight, however because the player isn't agile getting hit a few times is almost mandatory unless the player fights with exact precision at all times and even then sometimes it still doesn't work. It is even worse since players have to charge most of their attacks, and sometimes they will pause before attacking if they are getting hit. The players alternate attack is useless, only their main slow charge attack is effective, players can't block, can only perform a slow backstep to dodge; yet most enemies swipe very quickly and thus hit through the backstep or they use a thrust attack which also hits through the backstep. 

Sometimes, you can die to a common enemy you've killed dozens of times because it jumped you, didn't get off, and since the combat is so imbalanced you just couldn't hit it once because it's just faster then you at all times. Can't dodge because the backstep is worthless, can't block at all, can't outrun it or strafe out of the way since it drains stamina which will pile onto your stamina drain from attacking and leave you exhausted. And virtually every weapon in the game has a major downside which can lead to these mandatory deaths occurring even more. The axe has a tiny hitbox, the spade has a long charge, the pitchfork has a long charge and huge stamina drain. The only weapon that is remotely useable to a tolerable degree is the default board with nails. Hands down, the combat is the worst and main problem of this game, it just is not structured properly and so it's possible for players to just die because the game lets enemies sometimes be impossible to kill. The depth of the players ability to avoid damage is utterly shallow and the restrictions on the enemies ability to spam players down are not present.


The game also likes punishing players with free damage because they stepped on one of the numerous ground traps and hazards in the game. Which would be fine if a lot of them weren't difficult to see in general, especially when the mixed lighting and limited visibility range are factored in. When players die they drop some of their items on that spot and respawn at their base, however even with the map icon marking where the items are it can be absurdly difficult and frustrating to find them again. Especially if they dropped in a dark place, or if the sprite for them just gets overwritten by a piece of ground texture and the items thus become invisible. This made even worse by the aforementioned broken combat leading to many unavoidable deaths.

During chapter transition periods of the game players also lose all the items they had in their previous base since they move to a brand new one in a seperate map. Only the items they brought with them are kept, so if players do not know this ahead of time they lose the opportunity to transfer more precious items over. The same can be said for exploring, if players do not know what mission advances the chapter they may end up doing it, getting advanced forward, and missing the chance to explore more in the original map. The level up system for the game includes a wide array of quirky, awkward abilities and benefits which often have very niche uses in general. The level up system not even long enough to accommodate for the full length of the game despite its shallow depth as a whole.

The random generation of the world is also not completely random. The world is pretty random, but every map has the same locations and points of interest inside it. They are just placed in different areas of that map and have slightly different layouts. So players will find that if they replay the game they will see the same locations again, which can harm replayability. But the first playthrough is quite lengthy and so getting a full experience really does not require multiple playthroughs at all.

The game also likes including optional progression elements the player can get locked out of if they die at a certain point in the event. So, better look up a guide to memorize the whole thing if you somehow know ahead of time that the event you're in is one of those kinds of events. Better hope some random amateurish design decision doesn't get you killed and lock you out of that content for the entire playthrough. Because that's what makes a game fun, significant optional events which players can get locked out of if they fail at any single point whether it's to something fair or not.

On a lesser note, it would be nice if there were more animations for doing tasks such as gathering mushrooms, looting chests and digging up things. Same goes for if the crafting system had more variance to it, such as acquirable recipes.



All the same, genius game, the quality and length worth more then the asking price. Just expect arbitrary and random deaths and frustration from the poor combat structure.

The atmosphere is fantastic, the game can be hard with 3 different settings (inf lives, 3 lives, permadeath).

I ended up buying it not just because it's intelligent, no-jump-scares survival horror, with great crafting elemnts, and an almost Geiger-esque atmosphere, but because the gameplay is solid.

Haven't felt this tense since Dead Space 1.

Highly reccomended for more mature horror gamers, who expect more than shallow scares.


-------------------------


TWO CAVEATS: First, I am concerned about the length, as I've read conflicting reports. On permadeath however, I haven't made it past day 2 yet, which is solid as far as gameplay time.

Second, the areas and maps in the game are only quasi-random. Loot drops, and map shape are different every time, but you'll see the same set pieces in random locations. This informs the first caveat, as I can't tell how large the maps are. Definitely does not seem like a sandbox game, it tells a linear story, in a Ullyses-like way. 

To the developers' huge credit, this is apparent before you purchase, in several forums. At no point was this ever presented as a game where you farm loot and experience, which is an honest thing to say on their part. Very impressed.

34350765.review:
[h1] Я очканул, когда...[/h1]
Я очканул, когда загрузка повисла на 10 сек и я думал, что не смогу опробовать эту игру.
Я очканул, когда идёшь, идёшь, никого не трогаешь и резко "ОТКРЫТА НОВАЯ ЛОКАЦИЯ"
Я очканул, когда идёшь и резко ВОРОНЫ.
Я очканул, когда идёшь, идёшь, лай собаки и бежишь резко домой.
Я очканул, когда идёшь, идёшь и наступаешь на ядовитые грибы.
Я очканул, когда идёшь, идёшь по своему дому и задеваешь лампу.
Я очканул, когда поставил капкан возле окна, и в него попался дикарь и заорал.
Я очканул, когда я пол ночи дрался с дикарём, потому что этот муд*к кидался в меня камнями, убил его, а потом пришла банши и поимела меня.
Я очканул, когда дверь сама открылась (в этот момент появляется призрак на кровати).
Я очканул, когда ЧЁ ЗА МУД*К ПРИПЁРСЯ, (ударяю) Ох ска, торговец.
Я очканул, когда ЧЁ ЭТО В УГЛУ ШЕВЕЛИТСЯ (херакс факелом), а грибы, и траванулся.
Я очканул, когда свернул игру, написать сообщение в ВК (а она не ставится на паузу) и услышал шаги в доме, но я то стоял на месте. 
[h1] А если серьёзно.[/h1]
-В игре лучшее-это атмосфера. Исследовать-не особо интересно. Сюжет-не особо интересен. Персонажи-интересны, но не особо. Враги, ты к ним тоже привыкаешь постепенно и не боишься их. А вот атмосфера ужаса...
-Я ходил по дому, задевал лампу, она скрипела, от того, что передвигалась по полу от моего толчка, а я дёргался каждый раз. В первые разы я вообще бить её пробовал, ибо ночью думал, что это враг (она не светила).
-Как это жутко, когда ты в доме, и слышишь вокруг себя шаги, голоса, или что ещё хуже, стук в дверь :).
-Я боялся к окнам подходить.
-После второй ночи я просто везде поставил капканы, стоял в центре комнаты с палкой с гвоздями и зажатой ПКМ.
[h1] Минусы, или чего хотелось бы, но добавят разработчики или нет, неизвестно[/h1]
1-В некоторых подобных играх есть 2 режима. Оригинальный и HD. Я бы выбрал HD,но его тут нет. Довольно пиксельно всё, хоть это и такой стиль.
2-Капканы. Их нельзя передвигать. Их нельзя брать. Их можно только разбирать на металлолом. Капкан стоит 2, разбираешь на 1. Было бы круто, ночью, например, расставил ловушки, а утром пошёл собрал и в ящик.
3-Во всех нормальных выживалках есть такая приколюха, как быстрой склад вещей в инвентарь. Тут приходится каждый предмет перетаскивать мышкой по экрану из одной части экрана в другую.
4-Мясо. Им можно кидаться... Приманивать врагов... Но его нельзя есть. ВАТАФАК.
5-Трупы "Аборигенов" исчезают по наступлению утра. Серьёзно? Я нахерачил этих шаманов ночью, думал, что под утро залутаю, а они исчезли.
6-Стаки. Нельзя стакать, например, мясо. 3 штуки в 1 стаке. 9 штук это 3 стака, это 3 лота. Почему, типа, какого хрена? Так же со многими предметами. Один и тот же предмет, но 2-4 штуки в 1 стаке, то есть в 1 лоте инвентаря. А инвентарь тут не огромен, но можно расширять на верстаке.
7-Есть предметы, которые неизвестно, зачем нужны. Показывать торговцам, и то не все. Нашёл "Платье маленькой девочки" и чё с ним делать. Даже торговцам показать нельзя. Нахрен я его нашёл, нахрен оно было спрятано?
[h1] Обзор сделан по прожитым 7 дням. Я в предвкушении, что будет дальше.[/h1]
P.S. Можете кидать свои "Я очканул, когда" в комменты ;)

34349467.review:
I'm really liking this so far, as mentioned before this game doesn't really rely on jumpscares. It's more an environmental horror, since the noises, the landscape, the music, etc. are what makes this game.

So far I just played it blindly so it's fun figuring out what to do and where to go, you don't really get stuck in the story aslong you pay attention to your surroundings.

Paying attention to your surroundings is probably what's most important at night too, whatever happens at night is variating within time.

At one point I was standing next to my light at night, minding my own business when suddenly one of those antler dudes came storming in and bashed the hell out of me. 
After I was done with him and barely survived, thought it was over, the door of the room I was in suddenly opens slowly, but then nothing happened.

It's little details like this that make the game cause I was really tensed up in that moment and probably wouldn't have survived another attack.

I haven't encountered a single problem with the controls so far either, nor did I encounter any bugs, glitches or got any errors while playing.

Graphically it's right up my alley but it's nothing for graphicwhores of course. You get simple graphics with no over-the-top animations, except when encountering NPCs who are really detailed and look great.

I'd definitely recommend this game!

34340214.review:
First ever game review.

I should preface by disclaiming that I've waited for the full release of this game for quite some time (being a huge survival horror fan), without ever playing it in its alpha or beta stages, so I can't comment much on its development. 

However, this game really is a welcome breath of fresh air in the stagnating horror genre. The game ackowledges the formulas of well-loved successful titles such as 'Sunless Sea' and 'Don't Starve' in its gameplay and lends an atomosphere and world akin to those the likes of 'Silent Hill' and cult titles like 'Pathologic'. 

They've emphasised the 'survival' element of the genre's namesake and this really hyperboles the tension and fear generated by the game. This contributes towards a relatively balanced game pace, although I'd recommend it primarily to those who prefer to play in short bursts, rather than hour long marathons. 

It explores some original concepts in its plot and setting (dark woods, if you didn't guess, though it's far more ineteresting than its title) and has some very interesting gameplay mechanics (i.e. crafting, night/day cycle).

It's definitely worth the price tag for those who enjoy the survival/horror genres (either exclusively or combined) and I would encourage people to get involved as the community surrounding the game is very positive and active (at the time of writing) and the developers - from what I can tell - are responsive to fans of the game.

34337277.review:
"The thing that makes you most uncomfortable, is the thing you need to embrace most"

To be honest i didnt expected anything from this game. I watched some of its trailer while it was still in developement and thought "well..looks kinda interesting, but i guess it will just flop like most of these indie horror games" 

yesterday by accident i saw that this game just came out, and since i havent played a horror game for way to long, and i wanted to have one or two hours some horror fun until i refund it, i said myself "ohh well, why i dont play this game for a while" 

And now i look at my prejudices and laugh about how wrong i was.
This little indie game...is maybe the best best horror game i played in my life!

Everything is so perfect. The horror is sooo real! It is not coming from this jumpscares where out of nowhere a screaming ghost lady appears, it is not a gore horror game, where the developer just wants to make as much virtual blood as possible and call this horror... No the horror in this game is so subtile and well done, i really have to say my appreciation to the developer who did create such an immersive experience! 

You wake up in a little cottage. In the kitchen is a strange gas leaking, you have no memorys of your self. You remember that you are already a few days in the woods, and strangely you have realised that you havent eaten or drink anythink for already a few days...but you didnt needet it. Somethink is wrong with you, with this place and with the world around you, and everything you want is leave. But the woods are alive. Trees are growing out of no where and are surrounding the whole place. The streets out, are all consumed by the wood, and strange things can be found lurking around. Some disaster has happend here, but what causes it and what exactly did happen...you dont know. 

The game plays like a survival game..in some way. While you move around in the day to search for interesting places, you will find material like planks, nails, matches. With this material you can craft more advanced tools. Like bandages to heal your wounds, torches to give you light in the dark, or maybe some basic weapon. Your only goal that you have to follow is...to survive of course. Because while your body doesnt need water or food...he has to survive the horror of the woods. And what horrors they are. 

Because while the wood is already dark and creepy..its getting worse in the night. The horrors are to strong to survive them in the night, you have to hide inside your basement and do what you can to stay safe. Have you found some Planks to barricade the windows and doors? a beartrap perhaps to keep the mosters out? could you found fuel somewher to keeep your generator running so you can use the lights? And while you are hiding in a corner of the room, hoping that the horror will end to see the welcoming light of the new day...you know that what ever lurks in the woods will be back. And they will be hungry. 

A true masterpiece of an horrorgame, that could create all of his horror from its gameplay, and its intense immersion that is coming from the awesome visuals and the sounds. Ohh boy the sounds. I would recommend this game for everyone who likes horror games by any means. Its an experience that you will find no where else except this game.

34336920.review: This is already my favorite horror game ever.

34336649.review:
I love this game. I saw the post on Reddit on launch day and the devs seemed so honest and humble that I wanted to pay for their game.

I rarely buy games on launch day but with this one my gut told me to buy it. And I have to say that it is a very good game!

I love the atmosphere and how makes you feel. You may think a top-down game cannot be a scary game, well guess what: WRONG. This and Teleglitch show that, with effort, these types of games can be scary as hell. And not because you jump at every corner, mainly because you are on high alert in some situations, without knowing what to expect, without having a clue about what will happen.

It is great how the game manages to shatter your plans and confidence. I mean, during the day everything seems to be fine, you just have to be careful, because there a few surprises but the "relatively safe" feeling you get is real. But at night.. oh boy... It is something like this: Do I barricade this door? Or the other one? I don't have resources for both! Damn, they will enter from the left one... yes, sure... or not? Agh! I'll just barricade the left one and put furniture on the right one!... Yeah... *Prepares weapon*... *Strange sounds*... Oh shit here we go!... *More creepy sounds* Where is he?... *Starts to nervously look at both doors, alternating*... Shit shit he is near! *The unbarricaded door opens* Oh fuck! *You strike him and kill him like a hero! Just to listen another door somwhere in your home being opened*... Fuck, and now I have my weapon damaged and I don't have time to heal myself! What should I do? WHAT SHOULD I DO?!... *Night ends*

More or less this si the summary of this game. It is unpredictable, you try to defend yourself but it is frustrating because you know your plans could fail at any moment. If you manage your resources well you can sort of survive, but unexpected things will happen... and you better prepare for them!

I love this game. It makes me feel tense, scared and alert at the same time I have to think what to do to stay alive, just like a real life stressful situation! Amazing.

34333540.review:
Чем именно эта игра мне понравилась.

1. Horror составляющая определенно в наличии и она правильная - крадущаяся, нарастающая постепенно, можно назвать её не столько страшной игрой, как игрой с атмосферой отчуждённости во враждебном мире.
Так что здесь horror это не истерические "ОЧЕНЬ СТРАШНЫЕ" вопли орд голливудских зомби и не реки "ОЧЕНЬ СТРАШНОГО" кетчупа на полу и стенах - наконец-то.

2. Выживание. Уровни сложности четко проводят границы, создавая условия игры как для харкорщиков, так и для тех, кто ищет неспешное задумчивое погружение.

3. В плане сюжета и игрового мира все что я увидел, напоминает мне старые фильмы и книги horror жанра, с этническими элементами. Это как "Вий" Гоголя на мотив Resident Evil с Bear Grylls'ом в главной роли, но без голливуда и Фёдора Бондарчука. Днём мы исследуем лес, ищем остатки цивилизации, крафтим из того что нашли оружие, ловушки, разные препараты, ночью - закрываемся в единственном безопасном месте - доме. Он же база\убежище, оборудованное генератором для освещения и специальной печью (за которой я уверен живет домовой), отвечающей за "окуривание" дома зловонным дымом, отпугиващим духов и прочих любопытных, если они не слишком голодные.
В игре есть как враждебные, так и нейтральные персонажи, который дают главному герою задания и некую репутацию, которая фактически открывает доступ к бартеру. Найдя некоторые особые предметы (из прошлого), можно услышать от некоторых персонажей реплики, дающие понять, что происходило и происходит в мире игры, как все завязалось и дошло до такого жуткого состояния.

У визуальной, музыкальной и атмосферной составляющих игры есть свой неповторимый шарм, не диссонанс, не резкий грохот или шум, а именно шарм, мрачноватый лампово-пиксельный отчужденный мотив.

34327361.review:
Mit Abstand das beste Horror-Spiel der letzten Jahre (mit Ausnahme vllt von Durkest Dungeon, so man diesen Titel zum Horror Genre dazuzählen mag). 

Wo andere mit tollen AAA-Effekten, professionellen Synchros und Riesenbuedgets für mich auf ganzer Linie versagt haben, das schafft dieses kleine Game mit grandios platzierten Soundeffekten, einer stets etwas verschwommenen Kamera die dafür sorgt, dass man Details eher "ahnt" als sieht, einem absolut ausreichendem crafting System und einer Story, die nach gerade mal einer Stunde (musste aufgrund des heutigen Launches neu starten) absolut fesselnd ist.

Während des Spielverlaufs herrscht durchweg eine gewisse Beklommenheit und selbst mit ausreichend Benzin für meinen lebensnotwendigen Stromgenerator fühle ich mich unter Zeitdruck (im positiven Sinne) und nie sicher. Auch die zuvor erwähnten Geräusche sorgen für eine enorme Spannung, da man diese aufgrund des beschränkten Sichtfelds zur Orientierung von Gefahren benötigt.

Gefällt mir bislang irgendetwas NICHT an dem Game? 

Eventuell könnten die Laufwege dem einen oder anderen Spieler etwas auf den Geist gehen. 

Für den Preis aber absolut empfehlenswert, auch für diejenigen die nicht unbedingt eine Affinität zum Horrorgenre aufweisen.

34320836.review:
TL;DR: Middle-Aged Snobby PC-Guy Loves This Game!

I love this game, having bought it on its first official release day. I had been watching it for a while, but at the time I first spotted DARKWOOD I felt I owned WAY WAY WAY too many early release survival and/or horror games to snag another. Anyway, I am glad I found it, glad I watched it, glad it released, and glad I BOUGHT IT!!!! Toot Toot!

This game proves that games can be HARD but can be FUN. EUREKA! This review is coming from a 39-year-old PC gamer who remembers when Atari 2600s were still in stores. (Man I thought those fake wood-grain panels were boss!)

Anyway DARKWOOD: I never thought I would be so terrified or bug-eyed by watching a mostly-black PC monitor screen. At night in-game, I listen so hard my ears almost fall off! Wow this game can be tense at night, when all my character is doing is trying to impersonate a rock! Yes, a rock, preferably a heavy, black or shadow-colored rock.

I love oddities and this game is a wyrd byrd. I love the strangeness. I love the warped perspectives. I love how hope isn't totally quashed, but the game yet remains overall atmospherically dreadful. The sense of humor is sly and downright Tolstoy-ish at times; Russian humor is almost indefinable, yet I know it when I experience it. If you liked the bizarre characters and lore of the Metro games or Stalker then you will enjoy this too, most likely. It has the same mood and sense of humor (just a totally different setting.)

If you like survival, and building, and horror, and looting without having to get all grind-y, and atmosphere, and then a unique take on all of that, then try this game out. Even at the $15 price point, you will not be disappointed. I give it 7.9/10, maybe? It is a good game, and the price makes it approach greatness.

EDIT: 2 weeks later and I am about 43 hours in, game about half beat, restarted several times, and really....7.9 was a bit conservative. I could go higher actually. DARKWOOD is just a really good game and I regret not supporting the early release. I am still floored that a top-down horror game has me this excited and immersed days after that first play and glowing review. I have a fast gaming rig that plays anything I want on ultra max settings; I have Witcher 3, the new DOOM, and plenty of other eye-candy to tear me away, but even with all of that? DARKWOOD is the game that gets all of my time right now. Darkwood FTW!

34316598.review:
Игра шикарна своей атмосферой,звуками,музыкой и непредсказуемостью.Каждая пережитая ночь будет для тебя самым счастливым моментом в жизни,так как каждая ночь-это сущий ад,в котором все время что-то меняется,изменяются враги и с каждой ночью враги становятся все сложнее и сложнее
А теперь несколько советов для чайников:
1)В первую ночь можно и обойтись без источника света,вам ничего не будет угрожать,кроме как дикарей
2)Всегда имейте при себе факел,т.к вам придётся заходить в тёмные уголки игры даже днём
3)В каждом убежище есть железный шкаф,закройте огромную дыру в убежище им(Закрывайте снаружи убежища,т.к дикари их могут отодвинуть и проникнуть в убежище)
4)Исследуйте ВСЮ начальную локацию вдоль и поперек, включая само подземелье
5)Не баррикадируйте окна в вашем убежище,это бесполезно,дикарь все равно выбьет баррикаду
6)Денег в игре нету,валюта в этой игре,это репутация у NPC,у каждого NPC своё количество репутации.На 3 день к вам придёт торговец,и за каждую прожитую ночь будет прибавляться по 100 репутации.
7)После прожитой ночи включается режим "Freeze Time" -это заморозка времени,примэтом бафе,время не идёт,пока вы не уйдете от своего убежища далеко,ОЧЕНЬ ПОЛЕЗНЫЙ БАФ В ИГРЕ,т.к вы можете заправить лесопилка илииже генератор,создать полезные вещи,которые вы израсходовали сейчас ночь
8)Не спускайтесь в подземелье,пока не сделаете лопату
9)На вторую ночь,к вам могут придти призраки,вас генератор не спасёт, поэтому используем факел,лампу,сигнальный факел
10)Лампу можно создать,если проапгрейдить верстак до 3 уровня,лампа может заменить вам генератор,её хватит на всю ночь и ещё останется немного,требует всего 0.2 литра бензина-это оооооочень дёшево!

34315456.review:
I don't ever write reviews but i had to give this one a go.

I've played a lot of horror games and in general have pretty high standards when it comes to gaming. Honestly i did not expect much from a top down horror survival game, how scary could it be? Well not only is the game scary but it's also pretty damn good in a lot of aspects which i would like to elaborate on.

Darkwood is a dark, grim, desperate and creepy world, it feels very inspired and it's easy to get emersed into.
The atmosphere, sound design, characters, environment, tension are simply spot on.

Your view is limited to a 90 degree angle infront of you while the rest is shadowy where only the environment will be visible... yet twisted and playing little tricks on you. The 90 degree angle is a big reason on why this game manages to give you that sense of dread like... oh i heard some rustling... is something behind me or is the game playing tricks on me?
 
The sense of dread throughout the game is immense, especially at night, where you will be left at the mercy of darkness and the unknown.

Nearly every location/landmark you uncover will have a story to it and gives you a chance to understand more on what happened in Darkwood and how people survive and cope with it.

The combat system is surprisingly satisfying in both melee and ranged combat, but you will most likely need a little bit of time to get a hold of it.

Enemies are diverse and have interesting strategies to deal with you. Some enemies go head on while others prefer to scare and mess with you.

The user interface is clear and simple, you won't have much trouble figuring it out. The crafting system is also straightforward.

I'm trying to come up with anything negative but it mostly comes down to length. Not that i wasn't satisfied with it but i wish it stuck around for a bit longer since it was doing so well.

The game still offers a lot content for its modest price tag so if you are a fan of horror games, you won't be disappointed picking this one up.

34315230.review: Отличная, атмосферная игра. С элементами хоррора, но без тупых скриммеров. Авторы поработали на славу!

34314415.review:
Darkwood is a top down horror survival game set in a very tense and dark world. The excellent graphics style and sound design work together to make a surprisingly intense atmosphere. The top down view does nothing to distance you from the chracter and I've found myself holding my breath, jumping, and panicking in the more tense moments. I highly recommend that you play this in a dark setting and use headphones. 

Graphics: The graphics are simple, but the interplay of light and field of view make for an incredibly tense atmosphere, especially at night. Every entity, object, and texture intermeshes with fluid grace and the end result is a beautiful game that has you double checking over your shoulder saying, "did I see something moving in that grove of trees?", or "What just moved outside my window", or "OH GOD WHAT IS THAT?!"

Gameplay: Tall objects break line of sight and your vision of other creatures is dependent on you keeping them in your field of view. Early on any given fight could have been my last but as I mastered the timing of melee combat I found a flow and, at least for the easier enemies, combat became this beautifully orchestrated dance of dodging and swiping. Darkwood is very well balanced, and while you are always looking to find some piece of loot to upgrade or build something new, I never once felt that the game was being unfair.

Sound: The sound design is amazing. Every cracking branch and growl or howl drags you deeper into the world. I spent my first night cowering in a hidout in the pitch black night afraid that every sound was some horrifying creature that I had never seen seconds away from finding the unreinforced door of my room. Even out in the open, surrounded by activity, it is never hard to hear where a sound is coming from.

The story is mysterious, the atmosphere is very tense, the controls are intuative. Darkwood has a lot going for it. I've played for more than 100 hours in the early access, and I find myself coming back time and time again to the world of Darkwood.

This Darkwood is right up my alley, and if you like intense highly atmospheric thrill rides then Darkwood is for you too.
For what it is, I can't think of a single thing I would change about this gem of a game.

10/10. Well worth $20 (let alone the $15 they are asking for!).

34314314.review:
Потрясающая игра. Очень качественная, очень стильная. При том, вместе с тем очень атмосферный хоррор вышел. Казалось бы, где вы видели хоррор top-down, да ещё и без скримеров? Выглядит чем-то фантастичным, не так ли? 
Отлично сделанный звук, шикарная рисовка, анимации (вокруг вас постоянно всё в движении: лес, грибы, трава... некоторые трупы), цветовая компоновка. Много новаторского, по-настоящему новаторского, что очень удачно зашло. Например, depth of field. В top-down, ага. 
Сурвайвл тут тоже довольно приятный: не надо 50% геймплея тратить на поиск жратвы/питья/места сна/лекарств от спида/гвоздей с алмазным напылением. Нам нужен свет, как можно больше света; верная дубинка в руках и надёжные стены. Желательно, двойные, железобетонные. Внимательно вслушиваясь в скрип половиц и треск веток под окном.
Стоит отметить и хорошо проработанных персонажей, при том ГГ тоже не болванчик какой без голоса и без прошлого. Фишка ведь ещё в том, что в этом проклятом лесу нормальных людей просто нет, поэтому каждый мутант или псих вдвойне интереснее.
В общем, однозначны плюсы этой игры: атмосфэра (звук, рисовка, цветовая палитра, расстановка foliage вместе с DOF, тексты персонажей и не персонажей, фотореалистичные модели квестовых вещей), собсна вполне себе приятный геймплей, продолжительность игры, сюжет, качество (рофл, продукт в 2к17 без багов?), хороший разработчик. Ну вот рил при всей этой сумбурности не знаю как бы так сказать, что игра топ и просто необходима к покупке, если вы хоть иногда хотите сыграть во что-то такое мистическое, пугающее, атмосферное, неспешное, при том не нудное (ну так, разве что когда вам надо шкаф перетаскивать через всю хату :D). В конце концов, наверно, 270 рублей хорошему разработчику на кефир и закинуть приятно.
P.S. Ну его нахер, снёс игру: нервы дороже.
