34153856.review:
Despite still being in Early Access, this game has nailed down the foundation of a horror game- atmosphere. This game has the most errie, sketchy atmosphere I have seen in a game yet. The more amazing fact is that there is such a long, well done story to it as well.

The next best thing about this game is the two gameplay choices. This is one of the few games that you need balls to fight some enemies. Some can and will screetch while charging you like a bull, simultaneously blowing out all the lights in your puny, poorly barricaded shelter throwing you into a pitch black room fighting an enemy you can't see. Fighting isn't an option all the time either, you will find situations where you have to run or die to the hands of a chomper hovering around some resources you need.

It does have a few minor drawbacks, however. Death can be unpunishing at times, however, there aren't many ways to solve this without implimenting irritating gameplay mechanics. Some enemies can be cheesed with certain weapons, though this has been fixed for the most part (it was originally possible to kill any lone Chomper using only a spiked plank by simply backing up and swinging).

If you are looking for a new, high quality horror game- buy this! It is constantly getting new updates and is being very actively developed.

33866737.review: This game is amazing. It has a high difficulty, even on the lowest setting (normal), and it has a unique, retro, and hunting atmosphere. I love the survival aspect of night, and the value this game puts in something as small as a bullet. There were points in the game when I finally felt like the hunter: beating wild dogs to death, hunting elk with a bolt action rifle, but I have never reached a point were something doesn't kill me outright. The red chompers, spiders, savages, etc. Killing just one of those creatures called for so much tension and resources to remove, just to survive that single night.  Even in it's current state in Beta 3.0, this game is well worth the buy, and I suspect that will become even more so after this Darkwood's official release.

33858625.review:
If I could describe this game's gameplay with one word, it would be dreadful. Not because I hate the way it plays, I actually love it, but because even from tge starting prologue, you know you're not playing as some invincible action hero, you're just playing as someone who's trying to survive in incredibly harsh conditions.......

Like the description says, you're scavaging and fighting during the day, but as soon as dusk sets, you'll find yourself sprinting back to your hideout, because this game has the scariest night system I have personally experienced. You can hear the creatures walking outside looking for a way in, you can hear the cracking of wood as they try, and eventually break your barricades, you can hear their heavy footsteps as they look for a way to get to you. The game is very unforgiving because you never get to feel like a hero, I found myself cowering in fear as I uselessly used wardroves to try and cover the door at night, to keep me away from them, and literally pushing the wardrove back as they pushed it toward the room, and eventually got in.

The soundtrack is incredibly fitting and the game OOZES with atmosphere, the music that plays when you're just mere minutes away from the safety of daylight is so perfect for the situation, because you simply made it through ONE night, and managed to escape death one more time, and you gotta do it all again the next day. I really recommend this game to everyone who enjoys a survival horror experience. I know I know it's a topdown thirdperson game but it makes up for this by only showing what's inside your character's field of view, you cannot see behind you, all you see is black and white.

[b] I think if anybody likes an alternate survival experience, and a real take on horror, they should spend 15$ wisely on this game, you surely won't regret it! [/b]

33744429.review:
<정식 릴리즈 이후 다시 플레이해보고 수정함>

탑다운 뷰의 그래픽으로 이정도의 긴장감을 선사하는 게임은 없었다. 

삐그덕거리는 널빤지와 괴생명체의 신음소리가 플레이어를 미치도록 만들고, 미스터리로 가득한 스토리와 스푸키한 분위기가 유저의 상상력을 매꿈으로써 부족한 그래픽을 커버한다. 특히 게임의 배경이 되는 어두운 숲은 낮에도 으스스하지만, 밤이 되면 낮에 느꼈던 두려움 조차 그리워질 정도.

자원은 한정적이며 무기에는 내구도가 존재함에도 적들은 굉장히 강력하고, 궁금증을 유발하는 기괴한 스토리와, 다크우드 특유의 스푸키한 분위기와 컨셉,  적당히 어려운 난이도까지 더하여 엄청난 몰입을 선사한다.

의식주를 해결하는 방식의 생존 게임이 식상해지기 시작한 지금, 정말 살아남고 싶어지는 생존에 목이 마른 유저들에게 강력히 추천!!!

33713378.review:
The atmosphere is already second to none!

It's a cryptic and harsh game but because of this everything feels much more rewarding. In a way pretty difficult to find examples of in the 'survival' genre there are no food requirements. Meat is used as lures to chase away predators. Your focus can stay on looking deeper and deeper into the nightmare forest trying to find new people to talk to, trade with, or kill and new objects to combine or use to bolster your meager defenses. There's a vague map but it's enough to know your general location. Also the lack of voice over just makes the menace of the game more pronounced as you can't tell the emotion of a character talking and not even their state of mind, just their general location. 

I'm greatly loving this game and I'm glad it's gotten picked out of the doldrums it was languishing in. At full release I hope there's more of a prologue but that's been promised. 

Great music, great sound effects, meaty and strategic and suspenseful combat, lots of exploration. I've wanted a game like this for years and I hope this turns out to be it!

33704509.review:
This is one of the best survival games I have ever seen. in the steam forums I compared it to Dont Starve. however I feel that doesn't come close to describing it fully. this is practically the only game on steam I have seen that has an engaging and open story. the story itself is interactable. your choices directly and indirectly affect the story and outcomes. despite the emphasis on story, Darkwood is a very solid game even ignoring the story. you run around a randomly generated map collecting resources like wood and nails. you use these resources to fortify your hideout. during the night, you have to retreat to your hideout, turn on your generator and retreat to a back fortified room to cower in the corner until morning. this  is the genre of survival that throws you into the madness with no handholding apart from an optional prolouge that, while also serves as an introduction to the controls, delivers a lot of story. the entire game is very eerie and can be downright terrifying sometimes. it also obeys the laws of physics. meaning you cant just build what you want or sprint forever, but also, there is a unique "cone of vision" that complicates things. you can only see movement and enemies when they are in your cone of vision. other things, like the landscape and structures, stay visible no matter what you are looking at, so you are not completely lost. the "voices" mainly consist of floating text, however this allows you to pinpoint somethings location without seeing it, like you could IRL. NPCs and enemies behave realistically, for instance dogs turn tail and run once their health drops below a certain point. savages cant see you if you are behind them. crafting requires a lot of work. things break easily, and so on. this game was originally polish (I think) or set somewhere in poland, although the game is available in complete perfect english there are still a few polish things, like a polish cigar box, and a polish newspaper. these items have little to no effect on the game though, and are just to reinforce that unfamiliar aspect. the game is also leaving early access august 17, so thats another thing to look forward to.
one word of warning: Darkwood is just that; dark. you have the option to kill almost every quest giver to avoid completing their quest. this can and does impact the story in various ways. blood, gore, and swearing are abound. PG13.
in short, yes, get this game, but not yet. wait for it to hit release as every major update in the past did not come with save compatibility. hopefully this changes after release, as the future updates wont have such drastic changes that caused the save incompatibility.

33660425.review:
For me, this is a masterpiece!

I came across this game a month ago, and had no expectations, it looked interesting, mysterious.
But omg what did I find here?! And yes, this may sound crawly, but this game is worth every praise!

Why? 

It enthralls you so much, from the beginning to the last breath..
The story is like a mixture between a David Lynch and a Alfred Hitchcock movie - if you like or adore the two Directors than you just HAVE to play Darkwood!
The Gameplay is great, the sound fits perfect and makes a mysterious ambience, the events and animations are breathtaking and scary! And every time you think you saw and experienced everything, Darkwood punishes you...

The last point: if you read the letters and dreams and events -  and actually try to solve what happend in Darkwood - and I highly recommend to do so - you can't stop trying and you want to find the next clue and go on playing.

I really wished I didn't finish it (Beta 2.0) - to experience Darkwood again. But I am looking forward seeing the final version coming in August - and the Epilogue of course! (because I still have some questions ;)

greetings
Ninja

33623494.review: Right off the bat you are hurled into a surreal and seemingly empty world with no objective, no resources, and no help. I am writing this review with only two hours into the game but what I've seen so far is unlike anything I've ever laid my eyes upon. This game takes the best (and I mean best) parts from games of the survival horror genre and adds it's own twist of horror and madness to create the most entertaining, terrifying, and involved game of it's type. The art style is gorgeous and the simple details such as grassy fields blowing in the wind are an oustanding touch to the already in-depth world. The characters you meet aren't run-of-the-mill copy and paste characters, no not in Darkwood. These characters are all very unique and offer much depth to the overall atmosphere. I've been following this game for years and I can proudly say that I am truly excited for future content. This is an early access title that is renewing my hope in the idea of early access.

33412767.review:
С первого взгляда про эту игру можно сказать лишь: "Ну, такое себе." Так ошибался каждый, кто в неё поиграл. 
Возможно кому-то будет непривычен вид сверху и оригинальное зрение героя, но к этому можно привыкнуть. Помимо своих интересных фишек, по типу того же зрения, что я упомянул, игра отлично подойдёт любителям определённых жанров. Например мне она зашла из-за того, что я не только фанат вида сверху (Hotline Miami), хорроров и постапокалипсиса. Я большой ценитель Лавкрафтовской и иной атмосферы ужаса, мрака. Этим Darkwood просто переполнен, поверьте, поджилки  у вас затрясутся. 
В игре огромную роль играют звуки, поэтому лучше играть ночью и в наушниках. Каждое живое существо в игре издаёт определённые звуки, да и музыка весьма неплохая, атмосферная. К тому же главного героя может не хило так глючить, так что вздрагивать вам придётся часто. Например, если я только по началу шугался того, как дикари шастают по моему убежищу ночью, то потом дело начинало заходить совсем далеко. Банши, которые хоть и умирают от прикосновения, но орут дичейше, да и главного героя начинает от них воротить нормально. Про самооткрывающиеся двери и самодвигающиеся (с жутким скрежетом) лампы вы тоже узнаете. 
Помимо этого игра переполнена и весьма милыми моментами, например, Оборотень ласково называет главного героя мясом: "Yes, Meat?". 
С нетерпением ожидаю официальный релиз и русификацию. 10 чёрных чомперов из 10.

33071716.review:
This game is actually the best game I've played in months. It's not often you find a game that's horror survival as unique as this. Mostly all the games in that category are booring zombie / ghost survival...

Lets face it that trope is old, and nothing else has to be said...

(Except that I've had this itch for a survival game that included a twisted distorted reality)

Darkwood on the other hand is terrifying, and even once all the scripted yet random events become known to you it becomes a compelling interesting experience unlike other games that would just become stale. I have not even completed whats in the game yet (including the fact that the ending is blocked off until full release)

I'm glad i'm not beating up zombies, but rather "savages" that like to draw childish drawings with sticks. I'm glad i'm running out of storage space while running out of fuel, wood, metal, rags and alchohol for some nice molitov cocktails. I'm glad I still have my watch to tell me waht time it is...

(incomming sarcasam)
I'm not glad I'm being chased in tight tunnels. I'm not glad the savages are also breaking my sofas and wardrobes. I'm not glad my torch is running out, or that my wooden stick with nails is falling apart. I'm also not glad I accidently killed the trader with a pitchfork because I was excited to see him.

Most of all though... I'm glad that Darkwood is a game that I own.

Best of luck to Acid Wizard Studios and the talent they have.

33047216.review:
Darkwood, at its core, is a game that's made to be difficult. It's a different style of difficult than some other games, but to be good at this game, it requires timing, accuracy, memorization, and serious caution. Playing, you may die many times. But every time, you grow and learn more, what not to do. There is rarely a time (except early with chompers) that you feel you were cheated when dying. A lot of the experience of the game is raw fear of the unknown. Seeing something move in a distant room through your bird's eye perception, but lacking further knowledge of what it is. It's a fear of the noises you  hear, in the creaking footsteps almost sounding outside your room's door or window. It's in the horrific thought of a person whose body morphed to become a hideous monstrosity. It's a building fear that, as you play, you become a bit hardended to. The lingering fear disappears as you become knowledgable in the environment. You'll still definitely clench for dear life onto your mouse as a chomper flies through your barricaded door, but there becomes a sort of knowing. "Fear is a leaf off of the stem of ignorance. Once I knew what it was, it was simply a problem. Nothing to fear." The story is really amazing too, because the game really makes you work to figure out the story. Riddles and slight pieces of information that glue into an almost imperfect web of story that is nightmarish and solemn. And you really can't have better devs. Every bug they're emailed about gets looked into, and hotfixes / updates are large and frequent. 


TL;DR: The game's atmosphere really feels powerful, the story is amazing, and the devs work so hard for us.

33017841.review: This game even in its beta state feels like a full game. The enviroment feels fleshed out and the atmosphere is excitingly unsettling. Every sound puts you on edge, every enemy is dangerous in its own right, and every location holds mysteries to be discovered. The ambiguity of this games plot and world only make it more interesting to dive into. I'd say its definently a good buy on-sale or not.

32992668.review:
I must admit, for a game that has been in Early Access for such a long time, and it's only just recently, and finally, reached its Beta day; I must admit that I'm quite impressed with how well this game has slowly developed into a whole story. Of course we're just now on the stage of just waiting until somethings get fixed and a few changes here and there, etc. before BAM! full game release. 

The people working on it are constantly on the move to improve the game, fix things that are wrong and overall not abandoning this project even though it's taken them so long to get here. 

As for gameplay. Stunning! The atmosphere to it is extremely fitting, and it really lives up to its namesake of Darkwood. It's challenging at the same time as intriguing. You have to learn to adept and sometimes even learn on the go. And not to mention it's on point with its horror and survival aspects, while at the same time (depending on your difficulty) it can be a bit forgiving as well to the player as well. 

I honestly find it to be one of the best survival horror games I've played thus far, and totally would recommend other people to play. So yes, I say this game is definitely worth it.

32893921.review:
Darkwood is the sort of video game that is incomparable to any other. This game is not only a labor of deep love, but it is so carefully crafted and exotic that attempting to compare it to any other released title does neither any justice. This is a top-down game that will have your pants filling from the ass-downwards with a genuine crafted horror. This is Slavic horror at its absolute finest- a young Polish group breaking all sorts of molds due in part to them being naive and enthusiastic. "Hotline Miami meets Blair Witch" is something I have seen said several times about this game- it's simply not a proper comparison. This game is more psychologically distorted than Hotline Miami. The tension built, released, and built up again far exceeds the layered pacing of The Blair Witch.

In terms of Combat, it is simple in its execution and varied in its approach. Melee, ranged, traps, and environmental usage all take factor. Its simplicity is a boon, and allows for very creative aggression from the player and nail biting defenses in the games evenings. The better weapons, the more you feel the weight of their impact on the enemies. The more accurate you become with the very rare guns that exist, the more satisfying they feel to use. Scarcity of ammunition and the requirement to repair weaponry add to a constant tension of knowing when to err on the side of caution.

In terms of sound production, design, and usage, I cannot think of an indie game which has done it better. The utilization of sound effects in this game is absolutely top notch. I cannot sing the praises of this enough- everything from radio static, to enemy noise, to the differing weight in footprints allowing veteran players to know precisely what is lurking and stalking them adds to the atmosphere in the best of ways.

Every other scene or building you will explore in Darkwood contains plot, lore, character development- all of which feed into an over-arching narrative that many players will not experience in a first playthrough, or second. For those looking for a story-driven horror game, Darkwood will offer you this in spades. There is no narrator telling you how to interpret the clues you find. As you play more, as you look back on your in-game journal and review information, cross-reference baubles with the locations they were found in, you will discover more and more stories in Darkwood than you thought existed. Each of them unlocks yet another piece to a puzzle you genuinely wish to solve.

All of this is done without sacrificing the flow of the game. You can choose to think hard about what you find and piece it together, or simply marvel at the brains that would conjur such macabre machinations and continue just trying to escape Darkwood.

This game is for a particular audience: for those who remember what it was like to be scared by video games in the 1990's and early 2000's, with all the lights off in your room and the television RCA/SD cables providing a warm comforting glow to the scares they were producing to you. Personally, I am a rather jaded, pessimistic, and cynical gamer these days. There hasn't been a game released in the last 5 years on the PC which has genuinely horrified me like Darkwood has. I am very difficult to manipulate into falling for the 'atmosphere' that developers in AAA companies desperately try and create. Darkwood is like the 'PT' demo outstretched for 15-20 hours of gameplay on your first playthrough- and trust me, you will replay it again.

32864482.review: A nice, long and exciting journey ;)

32634646.review:
Недавно подумал написать обзор на игру, в которой я Профи. 
Ладно, думаю лучше всего будет поступить классически - описать плюсы и минусы игры.
 
Погнали!!!

Плюсы:
1.Атмосфера
Пожалуй основная причина, по которой стоит купить эту игру. Да, графа тут не как в ваших ДаунЛастах. Но здесь есть
охеренная озвучка  (обсираешься даже от скрипа доски под своей ногой, это не говоря уже о криках тварей, которые ждут тебя ночью за окном), делает свое дело. Охеренный бестиарий (лучше не перечислять этот пизд ец)
Да и если подумать здесь все хочет тебя напугать, даже твоё отражение в зеркале. Даже человек, который хочет тебе помочь. Даже иконки предметов в инвентаре.
2.Изменчивый и интересный мир 
Просто расскажу случай из игры. Сижу я такой ночью в убежище, вроде все спокойно. Как вдруг кто-то начинает стучать во входную дверь. Подумал- "ладно насрать"- и открыл дверь. Было страшно, но за дверью я нашел какую-то бумажку.
При ближайшем рассмотрении это оказалось приглашение на СВАДЬБУ(!!!). Что случилось дальше? - смотрите в первом трейлере игры. 
Да и еще, локации здесь сделаны так старательно, что реально желаешь бесконечных обновлений, в которых будет вводиться дохрена локаций с разными вещами и событиями (их тут дохрена). Иследовать их никогда не надоест.
3.Глубокий сюжет
Вы поймете это сами, когда начнете проходить эту игру.
4.Охеренейшая эстетика 
Бегая по этому лесу, глядя на местные красоты, грех не вспомнить старый добрый S.T.A.L.K.E.R. На самом деле авторы  Darkwood вдохновлялись творчеством Братьев Стругацких, Говарда Лавкрафта, Станислава Лема.
5.Что-то действительно новое в жанре хорроров
В то время как огромные, богатые студии выпускают говно от 1-лица, в которых пугают только скримеры. Ребята из Acid Wizard Studio выпускают самую страшную игру за последнее десятилетие. Надо сказать что здесь пугают не скримеры, которые трудно вспомнить, а ВСЁ ОСТАЛЬНОЕ!!!
6.Добросовестные разрабы (их всего три)
Ребята реально молодцы, работали над этой игрой целых 4 года. Недавно выложили свою игру на ТОРРЕНТЫ, чтобы те, кто не имеет денег поиграли в их шедевр, и может потом купили-бы игру.
7.Отличное место для теоретиков (загадочного здесь много)
Сюжет сюрреалистичный и странный. То-же самое касается персонажей. Можно найти вещи которые чуть-чуть проясняют всю картину.

Минусы:
1.Некоторые могут недооценить игру из-за графики.
Можете не слушать этих дурачков.
2.В сюжете и вселенной игры очень много странных несостыковок и недорасказанного.
Да, всё как-то чересчур непонятно.
3.Глупым и невнимательным людям (летсплейщикам, которые не могут догадаться как открыть дверь и пропускают топор) в этой игре делать нечего. 
4.Слабоватая оптимизация
Время от времени может лагать на слабых машинах. К сожалению здесь еще и немаленькая загрузка.

Стоит ли купить эту игру? Конечно стоит мать вашу! Лично я подобных игр ни разу не видел. Очень хочется чтобы все игры были как Darkwood.

31824363.review:
[h1] Когда я в первый раз увидил эту игру я подумал:"Как в ней можно испугаться?!" Какой я был наивный...    [/h1] 
Darkwood - очень необычный коктель разных жанров. Вот где вы найдёте хоррор с крафтом? Или где можно свободно побегать по миру? И несмотря на то что игра с видом сверху, она может очень сильно напугать. Darkwood  пугает не скримерами, а Атмосферой. От скрипа досок можно реально наложить в штаны. Плюс к этому страх потерять дорого заработанные вещи, ну и криповые и очень опасные мобы которые постараются сожрать игрока, попутно его испугав. Добавить к этому ещё очень интерестный сюжет и моральный выбор (Который не только решит как вы будете выбираться из Тёмнолесья, но и судьбу персонажей). Сама игра делится на День и Ночь. Днём лес хоть и опасен (особенно некоторые его части) но открыт для иследования. В это время надо искать бензин для генераторов, лут для улучшения оружия/крафта нового, баррикадировать своё убежище, проходить сюжет, и.т.д. Ночью же выход за убежище сулит верную смерть. Лишь специальный газ и свет ламп отпугивает некоторых чудищь. Остаётся лишь спрятаться в самом безопастном углу и надеятся что в этот раз никто не придёт ломать ваше убежище. Иногда слышно как разные мобы ломают баррикады, двигают шкафы и ты просто покрываешься потом и надеяшься что они тебя ненайдут. Описать ощущения полученные от игры невозможно никакими словами. Я сам не любитель хорроров, но в эту игру с большим интересом. Рекомендую сыграть всем, кто любит пощекотать свои нервы, хороший сюжет ну и крафт. 1000 кирпичных заводов из 10

30883526.review:
"Deep and rewarding experience"...doesnt seem very deep or rewarding to be surrounded by woodland areas, where in, you can not even pick up a stick. Speaks volumes for a "survival" experience.

[quote=The Acid Wizard;135512931355867555]Yeah, I know it makes no sense that you can't pick up sticks from the ground, but this is a game, and game design will sometimes be prioritized over logic. 

Anyways, we'll look into this and try to solve this issue so it's more "believable". [/quote]

You're absolutely right. And just because that aspect of the game did'nt meet my expectations doesnt mean it isnt a good game. The art style, lighting, sound and overall mood creates a very unique atmosphere. An atmos I really enjoy. With many aspects of the game in near perfect ratio...I just felt a little cheated by the forrest. 

During the day I love cutting my own trials through the thickest of woods, peeling the layers, discovering its secrets. The dark woods however are a very different place. A place that always makes me question my hiarchy as a homosapian. As if the playing field has been reversed like a flip of a coin. Once you have heard a roaring growl from amoungst the pitch black of the dark woods, an experience of near perfect suspense, where neither fight nor flight are viable options. In that moment, you will feel truly alive. 

I'm speaking as someone who spent a fair amount of time in the woods, as both a child and an adult. By daylight, the forrest is still dimly lit, it presents its own challanges, especially when traversing on unknown property. But it has provided mankind with avenues for survival. Wood for crafting very primitive tools, weapons and traps. Firewood for cooking, warmth and lighting the darkness. Things used for survival. Even things which could possibly be used to defend oneself against the paranormal.

Sticks are life. Wood is good. Game is good.

Just needs some tweaking imo.

30104099.review:
RPG öğeleri ile süslenmiş kuş bakışı ile oynadığımız Darkwood'un hikayesini anlamak güç. Yapımcıların açıklamasına göre oyun bittikten sonra bile birşey anlamanız mümkün değil. Bir salgın ile karşı karşıyayız. Salgın çok tehlikeli ve yaşayan ne varsa yaşamasına izin vermiyor.

Kapıları sağlamlaştırıp pencerelere tahta çivileyip orda konaklamak, olası bir saldırıya karşı gerilerek hazırda beklemek mükemmel. Etrafta dolaşırken birbirinden farklı mekanlarda araştırma iç güdümüzü ortaya çıkartıyoruz. 

Wolfman diye biri var. Takas yöntemi ile eşyalar alabiliyoruz. Envantere sahibiz. İstediğimiz anda envanterimize ulaşmak mümkün değil çünkü envanterimizi açtığımızda karakterimiz yere oturuyor eşyalarını seriyor ve görüş açısı azalıyor. Bunu ulu orta bir yerde yapmak tehlikeli olacağından kuytu köşe bir yer bulmak daha mantıklı. 

Herşey çürümüş, mantarlaşmış ve kokuşmuş. Oyun rahatsız ediciliği o kadar iyi aşılıyor ki koku burnunuza kadar gelecek. Her yer kasvet içinde ve hiç rahat yok. Asıl sizi sıkıntıya düşüren şey ise herhangi bir yönergenin olmaması. Yönergeden kastım, hani birden birşey olur ve hemen bir mesaj gelir ekrana "3. kata çık 305'teki odanın içindeki anahtarı alıp görevi tamamla". Oldu ben napıcam. Bence oyunlar yönergesiz daha güzel çünkü yönergeler oyunun atmosferini baltalıyor. Vahiy mi geliyor ne oluyor yani?

Oyunda öldükten sonra hiç birşey eskisi gibi kalmıyor. Çünkü random generation var ve herşey değişiyor. Bu da "iyi bari orayı çabuk geçer öldüğüm yere gelirim" lafını söylemenize fırsat vermiyor. Her yeni bir ölüm her yeni bir Darkwood demek.

Erken erişimdeki diğer oyunların arasından sıyrılıp kendi farkını ortaya koyuyor.

29433191.review:
=|Heads Up|=
The Time spent in game has a reason. No, I have not played it anywhere but steam. I am just a big damn coward.

=|Review|=
So, I have seen this game played by Markiplier. And I found it quite interesting but not all that scary. I mean sure it had its scarefactors but not that much on video. So what happened? Why did I only play this game for not even an hour? Well, I did not get far. And by that mean, I got into the tutorial, shat my pants and uninstalled and refunded the game. Because, god damn, it was that good at scaring me. See, I am usually not the type of person that gets scared by simple imagery. I have quite wild dreams in terms of horror. I enjoy it a lot. Being scared, helpless. Thats the feeling I tend to enjoy in these games and stories. Having to play this game however made me not only realise that I just cant play it but also made me remember one specific dream where I, and that for the first time ever and never again, woke up because the dream was that scary.

And this game is on the same level. I got into the tutorial at first and all was good. And weirdly enough it followed the same specifics of my dream. So then I went towards the next and suddenly woke up in that dark shack. And holy balls, the athmosphere! I tried to give it my best shot. I tried to take it but I couldnt. I played just for a few minutes and, even though nothing happened at all, the athmosphere scared the s*** out of me. I didnt see a monster, I didnt hear a monster nor did I even see anything remotely scary. I only heard things. And that was quite enough for me to leave.

So. Is this game good? Its quite effective for all I care so, yes. I mean, I refunded it but not because I disliked it. But because I will NEVER play it. No matter what the circumstances may be. But hey. If you want a game with an amazing horror athmosphere, go for this game right away. Because it scared me without even trying.

29349553.review:
An absolute masterpiece; lucky are we who are so privileged to observe its creation. 100% worth the money. 

If you enjoy an unfaltering atmosphere of tension, uncertainty and despair, a rich but jealously guarded story-behind-the-story which demands you work for every detail, compelling and unique gameplay and mechanics and all the best aspects of an explorative, survival horror game, then Darkwood is exactly the medicine you need to restore your faith in the notion that video games can be good.

From the very beginning to the very end, Darkwood devotes every moment of the time you play to making you feel like all's wrong with the world, and you constantly at the center of it. Even the local flora are actively hostile to you, and as you make your way deeper into the woods in your attempt to escape you face only greater and greater dangers. The upgrades and new items you find come as a breath of only temporary relief as you are forced to adapt to tougher enemies, harsher environments and scarcer resources as the game goes on. And even towards the end, you'll find yourself constantly struggling to decide not what to take with you, but what you can afford to leave behind. The tension is constant, and the threats to your life are omnipresent and very persistent. Even turning your back as you walk through an open field can be devastating if you take a step in the wrong direction.

The mechanics of combat and of general interaction with the rest of the world come together very nicely to create a very smooth and mostly unpunctuated experience. Combat is very skill based and fast paced, especially in the end-game areas, and the game in general requires a swift mind and swift foot to keep up with the constantly looming threat of the night. Nighttime can be either a welcome reprieve from the constant dangers you face in the day or a hellish gauntlet of relentless assault, and you'll never know which until the hounds are upon you. 

The story is captivating, well-told and rewarding to follow. It is hidden in the people and creatures you encounter, as well as the very environment around you, requiring much exploration and personal effort to uncover the secrets of the ruined Forest and Swamp and learn the root of the evil plauging the land. There are so many different ways to approach and complete situations that multiple playthroughs aren't just possible, but rather an absolute must, and the procedural generation is enough to provide a fresh-feeling world to play through with its own unique quirks, joys, and obstacles each time.

Some claim this game is too difficult. I agree that there is difficulty, indeed, but it is just enough, and if anything it could use a little more. You will learn to be patient, thoughtful, and strong in the Forest, and all you learn will be tested in the Swamp. 

My profile says 240 hours or something but frankly that's an underestimate as I've followed this game since it was announced in 2013 and I played every damn version I could get my hands on until I could purchase the game for myself. I've watched it grow and evolve since weird stones did something and it's been a joy because for once I have genuine hope that Early Access has facilitated something that I am proud to say I supported and believed in from the very beginning.

This is the first game I've ever played that I felt passionate enough about to write a review for. But the emptiness I felt after I played Resident Evil 4 into the fucking ground as a child was filled at last when I found this game. The disappointment I've felt with every other would-be surivival game was forgotten, and I have never looked back. If you like good survival games that you will come back to time and time again, if you like games that make you shout with joy after you manage to get inside before the nightmares behind the door tear you open, if you like games that take away from time with your friends and loved ones because "i'll only play through one more day", Darkwood is for you. This game earned my money, and if you give it even two hours, it will earn yours too.

I give this game an x/10, where x is any real number greater than 10.

29157396.review:
In terms of Early Access, I'm usually in favour of waiting for the full game to release. But there's a lot to like about Darkwood, even in the early Alpha 9.1 version that has sucked me in.
The game is [i]much[/i] more polished than when I tried it last (I think it was Alpha ~6 or thereabouts) and, at least in terms of the early chapters, seems pretty playable and largely functional as a "game".
Okay, so enough about the development, is it fun to play?
Oh god, yes. The game feels like an enmeshing of Don't Starve and Dark Souls (or perhaps classic Biohazard/Resident Evil) to me. With lots of small pixel detail thrown in. The sounds and the small details, like your character absently rubbing his arms, feels fleshed out like the little world on the screen is truly alive. And everything about it just feels kind of... [i]off[/i] (in a good way). Sort of like when you first watched Don't Hug Me. I'm Scared videos. Well, except that the overt weirdness and horror is up front, that is. 

The tutorial helps you learn how to control the game, but after that, it doesn't really hold your hand. But this is largely a good thing, because it gives you a chance to learn what's going, on your own.

And whatever is going on is weeeeiiird, in a very good way. Everything about it is unsettling, and leads you toward unsettling conclusions. 

The forest encroaches on everything, and everything has a twisted, sinister sheen to it. Like playing Nocturne, but, ahem, genuinely scary. 

So even though it's early access, I feel compelled to play it, and that's a very good thing in my book. 

If you liked the creepier parts of the tabletop RPGs Summerland, or Symbaroum, or have even gotten sucked into playing Noio's Kingdom for hours because of the base building and scavenging loop... you will be in good hands here. I think the systems and mechanics feel a lot like a tooled up version of The Last Stand flash games. You forage for materials during the day (sadly, so far I haven't encountered any other survivors willing to help me defend my hideout in the dark hours), and then hole up at night, just praying for dawn.

I strongly recommend checking a wiki or a guide for some basics, otherwise it may feel frustrating. The game, at least on Normal difficulty, is forgiving [i]just enough[/i] to not feel artificial. You'll breathe a sigh of relief when you find that lucky pile of wood to build your next barricade. But be sure not to "level up" via cooking too soon, or else you may find you'll be wasting precious resources on light... yes, at least in the version I played, if you skulk in the darkness of your hideout, in the beginning, you may survive okay.

29065844.review:
This game is utterly fantastic, a true labor of love. Yes, it has been in development a long time, but progress is constant, and even a couple years ago this game was the type and quality you could replay over and over. It's that good. And it has only gotten better.

It is, at its core, a survival and scavenging game. During the day, you leave the relative safety of your hideout to explore and scavenge the ruins of the world that is Darkwood. You collect crafting materials, and ferry them back to your hideout in an attempt to improve your situation. Do you want to use the wood you collected to board up those windows, rebuild that door, upgrade your workbench, or craft a new weapon? These choices have weight and affect your very survival.

Of course, there are plenty of animals and ridiculously scary creatures to contend with as you do this, especially as you progress to increasingly difficult areas. The combat is tricky to get the hang of at first. Once you do, it's a very intense, yet rewarding system. It's not a kill, kill, kill type of game; each fight is a battle, and sometimes running your ass off is the only way to save yourself. There tends to be a desperate feel to it that can really get your heart going. For a game to draw the player in like that is quite a feat in its own right.

Then nighttime comes. This is when you really have to hunker down, this is what you were preparing for during the day. This is the time when the violent creatures of Darkwood come to you looking for food, and they only have a taste for flesh.

You fortify yourself in your hideout in one way or another, whether your broad strategy is to hide in a corner, patrol with weapons at the ready, or anything in between. You can craft and set traps, from something as simple as smashing a bottle on the ground to create a patch of broken glass, to working metal to create bear traps. You can stalk around in the dark (and it is DARK!) or utilize one of the many methods of creating light, such as using the generator (each hideout has one, but requires fuel to run it), crafting a torch or lamp, or dropping a (very valuable) flare. Again, each of these requiring resources. The game is filled with choices that may help you now, but leave you scraping tomorrow.

I jumped right into talking about gameplay, because it's one of the many things that shines about this game. But it's really the atmosphere that gets the player into the characters shoes, makes you feel the intensity of it. They have achieved a very right combination of visuals, music, and creepy storylines to flesh out the Darkwood universe. And it is a creeeeepy place.

In the end, after playing this game for countless hours (much of it offline), the only thing I really need from it is another difficulty level. Don't get me wrong, this game is difficult. It has a definite learning curve that can be punishing to new players. However, the game is so good that it's worth playing A LOT, and veteran status is bound to happen eventually. With the care and attention the devs give the game, I could see it being added down the line, closer to release. And still being in EA, anything is possible!


PROS:
-Atmosphere is phenomenally creepy
-Intense, high stakes combat
-Great scavenging and crafting system
-Procedurally generated maps enhance replayability
-A unique RPG-like skill system that forces a negative perk for every two positive
-Day/Night system that pressures you to scavenge for supplies during the day, and make sure you're in shelter and fortified for the night
-Multiple difficulties (unlimited lives, limited lives, permadeath)
-Developers that are involved with the community and truly care about their game


CONS:
-Perhaps not the best game for the overly-casual gamer, as there is a decent learning curve
-Once the learning curve is finally overcome, the game eventually becomes too easy; as it stands in EA, veterans are clamoring for a more difficult setting than even permadeath

As Darkwood nears completion, it is better than ever. One of the best games I've ever played, let alone one of the best indy games. Darkwood is a world I will be returning to again and again.

29037390.developer_response:
Hi! Until the last update (which is Beta 2.0) Darkwood's Windows executable was sometimes being falsely recognized as a virus / malware by some antivirus applications. This was caused by adding Steam's DRM. 

For this update, the DRM has been removed, so there is no way your antivirus will flag the .exe as a infected file. Please let me know if your issue still persists, otherwise I would kindly ask you to remove this review.

28927523.review:
Сумарно на всех аккаунтах наиграл уже больше 250 часов. И до сих пор игра не надоедает. Мне она до боли напоминает серию silent hill - эдакая смесь настоящего хоррора, хороший экш и элементы трагедии и тайны. Здесь все это есть. 
[h1] Плюсы игры:[/h1]
- [b] Реиграбельность	[/b]. В игру можно переигрывать несколько раз. Рэндомно генерируемый мир и несколько возможных вариантов сценария. Каждый раз начиная игру заново все будет по другому.
- [b] Атмосфера	[/b]. Визуальное и звуковое сопровождение на самом высоком уровне: скрипы досок под ногами, шорох листвы, отдаленные крики все это держит в напряжении и в страхе заставляет прислушиваться. Помню как в первый раз увидел Волка, очень впечатлило. Если вы впечатлительны как и я, то не рекомендую играть эту игру после 6 вечера.
- [b] Сюжет	[/b]. Он тут есть, он переплетен, запутан и очень интересен. Но понять его можно только после нескольких прохождений.
- [b] Отношение разработчиков к игре	[/b]. Игру разрабатывают уже несколько лет. И стабильно раз в несколько месяцев выходят обновления, которые меняют игровой процесс. Всегда с интересом переигрываешь игру, обнаруживая в ней новые фишки. 
- [b] Цена игры	[/b]. Она явно занижена. За такой проработанный многочасовой контент можно просить в несколько раз больше.
[h1] Минусы игры:[/h1]
Коих значительных минусов в игре выделить я не могу. Из мелких минусов
- [b] Графика	[/b]. Графика в игре не верх идиализма. Но к ней привыкаешь, часа через 3 уже не замечаешь ее недостатков. Воображение дорисовывает эти недостатки
- [b] Система крафтинга и предметы	[/b]. Система крафтинга постоянно меняется и уже образовалось значительное количество предметов, не имеющих какого либо назначения. Их нельзя продать или использовать. Ряд предметов по функционалу абсолютно бесполезны. Хотелось бы вообще больше тактического разнообразия оружия.

Оценка игра 10 темных чомперов из 10. Ркомендую всем фанатам хорроров и серии silent hill.

28886873.review:
When i first started the game up, i did not care for the intro gameplay and went straight in to the actuall game. On day two i encountered a red chomper and thought it was a random newbie creature and died the same night or so by banshee babies. I thought the game was to freaking hard and gave it a negative thumbs down and some rambling review comments. But i was wrong, the game is doable. 

It is still a very hard game, that casual players will find problematic to rush through. But that is a good thing, that some people dare to make games that does not target every possible gamer out there, in order to make money.

A problem that consists with many "similar" games, is that random will kill you. In this game, there is such a good enough mixture of random and none random, that you can not blame the game entirely when you screw up. 

This is a solid game though still in alpha. There are a few bug issues but i have not seen anything close to major. My only beef with the game so far is some lag after a particular encounter. But i hope that is something that is due to it still being alpha. 

Anyone who likes survival horror games should have this one. It might not be a game for the average gamer or gamers that are mostly in to action.

28852190.review:
День 1:

Проснулся в каком-то доме рядом с печко-плитой. В стене дыра, через неё я и вышел прогуляться по округе, познакомится с местными, может даже доски у кого-нибудь одолжить, чтобы заколотить себе окна. Пошёл направо, сначала наткнулся на сломанный трактор, забрал с собой бензин, иду дальше. По поляне бегает животное, на вид хрен-знает-что, но по воплям - псина. Решил подойди поближе, мои первые мысли - 'интересно, а это жрать можно?'. Собаке мои мысли не понравились, она сначала укусила, а потом и вовсе погналась, в итоге я успел добежать до дома, войти через ту же дыру, а потом даже как-то додумался заткнуть её шкафом. Решил что это гениальная идея, походил по дому, нашёл капкан, на всякий случай поставил перед шкафом. Дома сидеть надоело, решил прогуляться вокруг дома, раз местные шавки такие агрессивные, что по лесу без плетки гулять стремно. Нашёл электропилу и бревна, распил их на доски, первым делом заколотил главный вход, который так и не додумался использовать, пусть считают что тут никто не живет. Вечереет, я запускаю генератор в сарае, а ночью хожу по дому и то и дело закалачиваю окна.

День 2:

Отодвинул шкаф и вышел на улицу. Псин вроде не слыхать, решил пойти налево, может местных наконец встречу. Прихожу к какому-то лабиринту из кустов, из которого то и дело слышно, как кто-то стонет. Подумал, может кто-то из местных застрял и не может выбраться, но я ведь не кидала, надо помочь братану. Спустя некоторое время добрался к концу, за кустами стонет бледное тело в луже кровищи, ещё и дергается. За другим кустом валяется ящик. Быстро забрал вещички из ящика, но к телу подходить так и не решился. Ничего, думаю, к вечеру может сам протрезвеет. Покинул лабиринт и вернулся домой, залил бензина в генератор, напилил досок и заколотил почти все, что смог, даже двери. Наступает ночь, откуда-то доносятся странные звуки, поэтому я сразу додумался запереться в одной комнате, да и ещё и забаррикадировать оба дверных проема. Внезапно над домом начинают кружится вороны, а пока я на них смотрел, пол в другой стороне комнаты начинает трескаться и из под него вылезает чёрная хeрня с длинными руками и клювом, начинает смотреть на меня. Я просто охyeл, даже не понял что происходит. Мне так сильно захотелось перейти в другую комнату, что я уже было повернулся, как чёрная хepня издаёт вопль, похуже чем на базаре, в доме наxyй вырубается свет, чёрная xepня куда-то пропадает, наступает тишина. Я решил, что надо бы пойти пощелкать генератор, как вдруг комнатную дверь кто-то начинает ломать на щепки. Не успел отойти, в комнату врывается стая ползучих тварей, они начинают меня кусать, я чудом вырываюсь и бегу вон из комнаты. К моему несчастью и криворукости, я сам попадаю именно в тот капкан, который поставил у шкафа. А твари то-уже просекли, что я попал, догнали, обступили меня, одна успела укусить... ещё немного и я валялся  так же как и тело в лабиринте, но тут, наступает утро, наверное первый раз как раз вовремя.

День 3: 

После ночных покатушек настроение у меня как у денди, чувствую себя родственником Чака Норриса, вышел из дома и пошёл прямо. Выхожу на поляну, на которой какой-то хрен сидит в яме и что-то чертит палкой вокруг себя. Я обрадовался - 'Пресвятые лесбиянки, наконец-то я нашёл адеквата в этом оборзевшем лесу'. Решил подойти ближе, этот хрен по ходу тоже обрадовался, он даже начал махать палкой и руками, мол, братан, давай сюда. Только подошёл - хрен выпрыгивает из своей ямы, и я получаю палкой прямо в eбaльник, а в следующую секунду уже валяюсь на земле.

10/10 Никогда ещё не чувствовал себя настолько униженным.

Ночное ЧП 1/1/2017:

После поучительного случая с черной xерней и капканом, кто-то сказал мне, что если подпереть дверь в спальню шкафом снаружи, то хрен кто туда ночью сможет пройти. Собственно, сегодня так и сделал. Перетащил обе лампы в одну комнату, чтобы призраки не сожрали, сижу, слышу как то ли снаружи дома, то ли по другим комнатам кто-то ходит и ищет меня, издавая рычание и непонятные слова. Думаю, во дибил, пришел бы сюда вчера может и нашел бы меня. И тут, через пару секунд, МОЯ ПОДПЕРТАЯ ШКАФОМ ДВЕРЬ ОТКРЫВАЕТСЯ, и в комнату на четвереньках влетает тот самый хрен, что в прошлый раз отделал меня палкой. КАК ДУМАЕТЕ, КАКОГО МНЕ БЫЛО В ЭТОТ МОМЕНТ?

Но вы не волнуйтесь, во второй раз отделать он меня не успел, я игру быстрее выключил.

Впредь буду подпирать дверь еще и тумбочкой.

28808941.review:
Цена данной игры всего то три сотни рублей, но по атмосферности и криповости заткнет за пояс многие проекты ААА-класса. И делают ее лишь три поляка! (Поляки в последнее время вообще жгут напалмом, ага).

А когда ночью начинает натужно скрипеть отодвигаемый шкаф, который загораживает единственный проход в ваше убежище, ммм...в этот момент вы сможете успешно выполнить годовой план кирпичных заводов Саратовской области.

10 скрипнувших половиц и последующих инфарктов из 10

28705683.review:
Я люблю эту игру.

На рынке игр за последние годы появились тонны хорроров, но много ли из них действительно годных? Я молчу про бесконечные попытки разработчиков запилить сюрвайвалы в погоне за славой "Негородайки" и иже с ними.
Создать качественный хоррор с элементами сюрвайвала и потрясающей атмосферой - для этого надо иметь поистине золотые руки. На мой взгляд, в этой игре нет ничего лишнего: нет лишних статов, лишних неубиваемых тварей, лишних строк в диалогах. Каждый небольшой квест, каждый персонаж и далог с ним, каждая мерзкая и страшная тварина, которая шуршит по ночам в кустах под окнами или уже отодвигает стол, которым вы забаррикадировали дверь - они все прекрасны. 
Я уже год где-то жду (еще с Альфы 0.2 и 0.3), когда же её доделают полностью. Но ради таких игр можно и потерпеть. Потому что сюжет и атмосфера этого хоррора точно останутся в моей памяти надолго.

Мастхэв, если вы любитель этих жанров.

28690404.review:
Ignoring the fact that the devs have been far too slow at progression for this to have a glimmer of hope at seeing sunshine, I'd been eyeing this for a while and decided to check it out.

First impressions almost immediately turned me off. I like the whole survival-horror gig, but this doesn't deliver--the suspense and horror largely comes from the clunky controls and animation not working intuitively. One could argue that you "get used to it," and I wasn't expecting to be the next Ash Williams, but the bottom line is I didn't anticipate any sort of gratifying reward for the frustration.

See, the problem is, at this point I'm not even looking forward to a full release. The focus of what little development there is seems to be on content rather than core gameplay, as if the latter is already tippy-top. It's functional, at best. This game *feels* like an Alpha product within minutes to the point where it doesn't matter what more there is, at least to me. Refund requested, itch remains unscratched.

28569793.review: A hidden gem of a game which captures the menacing ambience of an early Silent Hill.

28543276.review: This is a fantastic game.  It is a near perfect combination of open world survival and progressive story telling.  This game has come a long way.  It has quadruple the amount of content that it did when it first released back in 2014.  This game is procedurally generated, but the world feels handcrafted.  The combat may be slow and hard to handle, but that just feeds the intensity.  It is amazing what the developer has done.  In my opinion, no other open world survival game has come close to the amount of depth that this game has.  I also adore the art style.  It is somewhat reminiscent of those "Scary Stories" books by Neal Shusterman and Alvin Schwartz.  All in all, I highly recommend buying this game.

28437892.review:
Darkwood is an intense survival horror game set in a mysterious forest. The gameplay is viewed from a top-down perspective and blends combat, exploration, story and survival mechanics in a satisfying way. The prologue is deliciously disturbing and sets the tone of things to come: you start each day in your hideout and must venture out to collect supplies to safeguard yourself and your hideout. As you progress, you'll encounter numerous weird allies and enemies. There's some crafting elements - such as the ability to construct torches, weapons and bandages - and RPG additions - like the ability to inject odd mushrooms which give you various abilities/weaknesses.

The unique gameplay mechanism comes in the form of the view cone wherein your character can only see things they are looking at directly. This creates alot of tension and many interesting gameplay scenarios: for instance, you may hear the snap of a twig or the bark of a demon dog as you explore the forest which may force you to look around, bolt away or tread more carefully. The game rewards careful planning and punishes wrecklessness. If you run mindlessly through the forest without checking to see what's around you you'll likely stumble into a beartrap or some poisoned mushrooms; if you take your time and play cautiously you will be able to progress to new regions and advance the story. 

The combat is nicely balanced and reminiscent of classic survival horror games: you don't feel overpowered but you can muster just enough equipment to defend yourself if you try. The game permits you to choose from 1 of 3 difficulties: the easiest difficulty gives you infinite lives and the option to collect some dropped equipment on death; the hardest difficulty - and by far the most thrilling - gives you just 1 life and forces you to play very carefully and cautiously. The game becomes even more terrifying by night as you must get back to your hideout and survive until morning. Many of the games best scares come at this point as numerous creatures try to break into your house and various strange events occur.

The lighting/shadow effects are wonderful - especially considering the game is mostly in 2D - and the muted colour scheme and odd enemy/ally design combine to create an unnerving atmosphere. The sound design is incredibly atmospheric: the menu music captures the tone of the game perfectly and the dynamic soundtrack does a good job of setting the mood as the time and setting change. The 'Time Freeze' music is particularly wonderful and the sound effects are suitably strange and eerie throughout.

So far I've played around 35 hours and explored 2/3 regions of the forest: I feel the game is already satisfying and worthy of its price tag based on the current content and my enjoyment thus far. My only minor complaints are some of the UI elements could be better explained - for instance it took me a little while to understand that many items in the world had their own progress/health bar - and it would be nice to be able to repair some of your damaged structures.The game is still in development however and I expect things will only get better as the Acid Wizard team push towards release. 

I would highly recommend this game to fans of 'weird' survival horrors like Silent Hill and Lone Survivor but if you're a fan of recent atmospheric survival games like The Long Dark you may find lots to enjoy here also.

28396170.review:
This is a game. A game of twists and turns. A game of pure horror as the ambience and atmosphere of the game is enough to keep your spine chilling throughout the entire experience. The story is captivating, disgusting, and the work of pure geniuses. It is only early access and I'm already addicted especially by their progress to the development of the game. It's challenging but yet fair. It has a unique leveling system which is used by collecting certain items (mainly mushrooms) and extracting their essence into a syringe on your very own oven to inject yourself causing you to not only choose a skill but choose a downside as well. The nights are ferocious and nerve-racking as you must stay inside and hide behind your barricades that you have created with either some feeble wood and nails or some furniture you have found laying around. When you need a drink of water (you know, to live) you must wait till night when the well is not dry. But the well isn't inside your house. You must run outside, get a drink, get back in, and hope that nothing was chasing you along the way. But don't forget to put gasoline in your generator and turn it on, the dark is not a safe place to be... 

I strongly recomend this game to anyone who loves horror and survival games

27159145.review:
"Challenging and Creepy" 

It's been a bit since I've played due to life, but this Darkwood has been a great experience for me. The crafting/survival genre of game has been running through a lot for awhile and believe me I know that can put a person off from wanting to give a go at another one. This has done it very well though, and with its own twists that make it worthwhile. The aspect of only seeing what is in the light when it is very likely trying to kill you is a challenging touch that I've come to love. My first few run throughs of this game it got me to jump and had me on the edge of my seat most of the time. It gives you chances to feel safe to only take them away with the terrors that come after you in the dark. 

I give it an 8/10 for what my experience has been so far. 

To explain my score:

On the plus side, there is an interesting art style to the game, and the atmosphere created for it blends well to give it a creepy chill. The creatures are pretty challenging and horrifying creations, even the wild animals can be difficult if you aren't used to the combat system. Which is another thing, the combat system isn't too unfamiliar to those used to top down style games, but it requires a bit more strategy and reflex than some have to offer. Without spoiling too much, the crafting isn't all that unique when you look at it an overall objective way, but there are certain aspects to it that make it different and keeps the interest. I do like the ability to "upgrade" your character in the way implemented, so that's a plus in my book. 

On the down side however, as I just said the crafting is just that, crafting. What I mean by that is that it is not all that different in comparrison to other games with crafting implemented even in the idea of having to first find/build the crafting tables. The weapons aren't all too creative, even if the creatures are. Don't get me wrong I do love the touch of a more realistic feel for it, but a little fantasy wouldn't hurt in the weapon department either. I would say the bugs/unfinished story/glitches were an issue, but it's still in early access and I'd rather a long development that I can see the improvements on over time over a released version that could have been better. Which I bring up because it is my next point, the updates it has been recieving over time (yes I do keep up with at least checking the updates) is great I grow tired of games that just don't ever quite leave "early access" or "beta". I love the work they do and all, but if you wait to release a game till it's perfect it'll never really get released.

What sold me on this game though...Darkwood, for what story I have seen it has been great for a fan of the creepy and horror genre. The personallity put into each character gives it a certain air of mystery to the story that makes me just need to know more. The trial and error I put into getting it "right" on a playthrough so I could finally make my way through to both survive as long as I can and progress through the story. The game has so much potential and they've done a great job with it thus far, and I think it will continue to do great regardless of my few gripes. The main gripe I wish they'd do something about is the combinations/treasures, which if you've played you probably know what I'm talking about. 

At any rate that is with as little spoil as I could manage why my rating is a solid 8/10. If you're a person who likes a challenge, that creepy feeling you get when you know somethings just out of sight, or if you just like a dark atmosphere in your games, I'd recommend you to give this game a go.

26703342.review:
[h1]NOTICE ME![/h1]

     Now that we've got that out of the way... Do not purchase Darkwood expecting a shallow game to quench your thirst for empty jumpscares and cheap horror thrills. This isn't one of those games where you do something lame like walking around or looking at a screen while waiting for monsters to pop up in your face. I think you all know what games I'm talkin-- *cough* SLENDER MAN CLONES *cough cough* FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S *cough*. Sorry, I don't know what got into me... Ahem.. Anyway, this game is so much more than that, so don't make the same mistake I did. 
     I'll be dividing this review into Pros, Notes, and Cons. Pros are what most people would consider good for what this game wants to be, Notes are noteworthy things about the game that some people may like or dislike based on preference, and Cons are things that most people would generally consider to be negative in a game. Let's get right into it!


Pros: 

- Very atmospheric. Everything from the pixel art, to the sound, to the fact that you can only see what's in front of you adds up to a very tense experience, even during the day time. I remember the first time I flicked on a flashlight in a dark home. The reverb made my stomach sink. The sounds of moving furnature, door interactions, and even ambience all sound believable and genuine to what they are for. The lighting and post-processing looks great, and the art style (more on that in the Notes section) is one of the best I've seen on any overhead game. And because of this...
- ... This game has its own very unique character. If you take a step back after advancing through the game for awhile, you'll come to realize that there's nothing out there like this game. It feels very much like it's doing its own thing.
- Crafting doesn't feel like crafting in the [strike]beaten-to-death sandbox survival genre[/strike] "traditional" sense. Every ingredient and required quantity for that ingredient makes sense, and sometimes you really need to think about what you're about to make, because those resources aren't coming back and you won't find any new ones if you've cleared the area until you advance the story, and trading for those resources could cost you an arm and a leg.
- The story is shrouded in mystery and darkness, and things aren't always as they seem. Certain actions can have real consequences in the future, which was not something I expected when I.. ah nevermind, I don't want any spoilers in this review. Basically, I did something that I thought wasn't gonna do anything to the story, while laughing all the way, until it caught up with me a few hours of gameplay later, and almost cost me my life.
- Freaky monsters. What? Did you think I was going to elaborate? That would ruin the fun, and keep your undies dry during your first playthrough. ;)
- Very challenging. I don't care how good you think you are at video games. Chances are, when you're new, you're going to die at LEAST a few times, so don't you dare put your game on permadeath mode..
- Many a' ways to fight these monsters can be utilized by the player. From melee weapons, to throwables, to traps, and ranged weapons. The traps are diverse and can be used in ways that are dynamic enough to keep the combat or snaring and killing experience fresh.
- The game didn't [i]just[/i] have my heart pounding, my hands sweating, and my goosebumps going, but it actually had me [i]begging[/i] vocally in real life for the daylight one night when things were getting crazy. You don't see me getting that far into a game that often. That, my friends, is immersion.
- Special Abilities??? Buy and play the game and find out what I mean by that. 
- The environment has interesting locations, and as the story progresses, uh.... crazy things happen in the game. Jeez... Writing a review for this game without spoilers is very hard. Uh.. I guess I'll move on to the Notes section, then.


Notes:

- The game features art which could be considered "pixel" art, but it's so well-drawn that in any screenshot of this game, it looks like it's full-res. I think Acid Wizard should disclose this somewhere on the store page, although I'm not sure how they could advertize that. It was just a bit of a let-down when I got in-game, but I eventually got over it and even came to love the art.
- It's an Alpha right now, so if you buy it, you will not play the end of the story until the game is finished. The developers sometimes go silent for months on end, but it's not all that troubling because the last time they did this, they dropped a nuke of an update on us and it was stable and full of great content! Basically with these devs, you exercize patience, and then they rain content from the heavens in return. They are a team of two, afterall, so I can see why it can take so long. The game definitely seems like it will be finished and will not be yet another title to linger in the spinning tide pool of abandoned Early Access titles.
- Except under special circumstances, saving only takes place between days. Each day is about 15 minutes, about 10 for day, and about 5 for night (Source: http://darkwood.wikia.com/wiki/Time). Though, night may feel like an eternity because of how tense and anxious you can become based on what's happening... The distance between saves combined with how much attention you have to give this game while playing can make it the less-than-optimal option when looking to pick up a game to play for just a few minutes.


Cons: 

- Almost every update is incompatible with saves made in the game just one version ago. However, you are given the option to delete it, keep it, or, if you want to, you can follow their tutorial to roll back your version of the game and play your old saves.
- Loading times can be notably long, though not as long as before the update that served to ease this a little. A pro to this is that there is little to no loading that interferes with gameplay once you're in-game.

26421469.review:
I am terrible at playing horror games, but I still do, or try to. That being said, for a top-down game, this is one of the scariest games I've played. I would have thought the lack of first person camera seen in most modern horror games would have broken immersion, but the way darkness envelops you at night really makes this top-tier spook material. You only have the faintest hints of what's going on outside your vision at night, and the helplessness you feel when you board yourself in and barricade your position with furniture is great, albeit stressful. It's plenty spooky in the day, too.

On the side, I really like the way shadows work, and the canopies of trees add a sort of 2.5d effect. Good art.

For a giant man-child like myself, this is a great game to simulate how I would hide in a corner and weep all night.

I give this 5 frightened whiny babies, I haven't decided what the maximum is.

Un excellent jeu d'horreur.
Au début, je m'étais dit 'Oh, un jeu en 2D, ça ne va pas être très effrayant ça...'
Quelques minutes plus tard je me planquais derrière une armoire le coeur battant et en sueur tandis qu'une chose absolument cauchemardesque se baladait dans ma maison.
Ambience malsaine et terrifiante, histoire intéressante et gameplay varié sont autant d'éléments qui me forcent à recommander ce jeu. 

Parmis les défauts, on peut citer le fait que vous devrez rapidement changer de sous vêtements, et que vous allez bien rager car ce jeu ne pardonne pas (surtout si vous jouez en permadeath, petit conseil: mieux vaut porter deux petits pistolets plûtot qu'un arsenal de fusils à pompe et de fusils de chasse qui vous ne parviendrez même pas à dégainer avant de vous retrouver avec une bestiole à donner des cauchemars en train de dévorer votre corps.)

Enfin bref, sans trop m'étendre, je recommande vivement ce jeu.

25647409.review:
http://www.acidwizardstudio.com/?p=667
This game HAS NOT been given up on. People who are saying it has simply haven't even bothered to look.

This game is made by 4 people, most games of this quality and size are made by 10 to 30+ people. Have some patience.
Now. My Review.

[h1]TLDR.[/h1]
I have not had any bugs, glitches or crashes in my 8 hours of playing. For £12 or $15 I reckon I can still get ALOT more hours out of the game and it isn't finished yet. It is 100% worth your money.

[b]Pro's[/b]
[list]
[*]Terrifying Nights
[*]Combat
[*]Difficulty
[*]Scavenging
[*]Story
[/list]
[b]Con's[/b]
[list]
[*]Rage inducing (Sometimes)
[*]Hard to find certain items (Kinda good and bad)
[/list]
[h1]Full Review.[/h1]
I played this game for about 4 hours a long time ago and loved it but recently started playing it again and put 8 hours into it, in a single day. This game is a survival horror game where you scavenge resources to power your generator for the night time to survive. The game during the day is difficult, you will need to learn how enemies attack and how to dodge them whilst still being able to attack back. However during the night time, this game becomes terrifying. I have not played a game that has made night time so tense and scary since dying light. You need to board up windows, set traps and prepare yourself for any events or attackers that may want to kill you for a place to stay during the night or possibly be prepared for any paranormal encounters you may find yourself witnessing. Or the game will continue to build suspense but have nothing happen, equally terrifying.

This game isn't all just this however. It has bloody terrific writing and story, which is still being developed.

25252843.review:
Ask yourself one question before buying this game - is phenomenal atmosphere and perfectly executed theme enough to keep you going through same old Survival game tedium? 

Even without permadeath and hunger the game includes some design choices that I find rather tiresome, getting in the way of exploring this utterly dreadful, creepy universe. 
- Night sections are completely back-breaking, turning the game into Home Alone as directed by Eli Roth.
- Combat is beyond help - clunky, frustrating mess which crosses the line of "Panicky" right onto "stupid and unfair". 
- Amount of required resource gathering is pretty insane, watering down the thick horror in favour of another bog-standard survival bull. 

Full release gets my recommendation, but it is very bare recommendation - just on a brink of positivity. You can call me biased but this game still has problems - it's very design is indeed problematic thing. The theme, the world, the characters, the feeling of dread and horror - everything is here and executed with flying colors. 
Shame that gameplay frequently gets in the way, making experience tolerable only in small amounts.

24671606.review:
I am not into horror games at all. I honestly have a really hard time with them because I'm a big baby. 

But for some reason I was drawn to Darkwood. I can't explain why. 
And I'm so happy I was brave enough to start playing. (I'm just barely brave enough...)

Honestly, every time I load the game in there's a sense of dread that befalls me, because to be quite honest, the psychological toll this game takes on you is very VERY well executed. There's not much you can do to comfort yourself while playing. There's no "I'm safe" feeling. Just a building sense of unsafe. An almost Lovecraftian catch-22: "the more I know the better I can protect myself - but also the worse it is for me". That is so incredibly difficult to achieve, and this game nails it! 

Every step you take in the day time is unsafe, and every night is even worse. 

The nights... I won't go into detail... play it yourself...
The developers 100% know what they are doing when they give you the "night" mechanic, and I hope they never change it. It makes every next day more exhausting than the last. 

The sound, art, and atmosphere makes this game. Its perfect for what it wants to be. 
Gameplay is solid, difficult sometimes, but solid. I have a feeling they will make some things smoother in the future, but I'm glad I'm playing it NOW, rather than later down the line if they ever make it easier. 

This game is compelling beyond explanation. I want to stop playing (because I'm a big baby) yet I can't put it down. 
I cannot wait for this game to be released in full. The developers should know they are working on something that will become very successful!

Плюсы и минусы этой игры:
1 плюс. Составляющие звука. Он прекрасен, особенно музыка. (Наушники 5.1) 
2 плюс. Сюжет. это отдельная история в которую вы сами должны вкинуться так как она очень интересная (История конечно не 10 из 10 нет, но она очень хороша.)
3 плюс. необычные персонажи и диалоги с ними. Про всех персонажей я вам рассказать не могу так как тут присутствует сюжет. Можно взять даже торговца (я его взял так как вы его встретить уже в самом начале) торговца зовут "Wolfman" (Оборотень) в диалоге с ним, вы для него Meat (мясо) он так вас и называет. его описать довольно трудно но я попробую (Он похож на волка который живёт по человеческим обычаям, одет он в кожаную куртку с капюшоном (куртка у него довольно-таки старая в дырках от пуль и царапин "Монстров" морда у него волчья, а за спиной у него автомат Калашникова. Довольно-таки мерзкий тип не советую с ним связываться.
4. плюс. Выживание в открытом (в пределах карты) рандомно генерирующимся мире. основная задача в это игре конечно же выжить даже одна смерть может стоить всей игры. И это не шутки. Стоит погибнуть однажды и вам предстоит начать путь с самого начала. 


1 минус, Пиксельная графика (вид с верху). Может для кого то  это не будет минусом, но я не особо предпочел бы данный вид графики для этой игры.


1 замечание, это сочетание Хоррора и сюжета. Эта игра отлично подходит для любителей страшных игр с хорошим сюжетом (Таких как я ) (такие игры выходят довольно редко )
2 замечание, это поддержка только двух языков: Польского и Английского. Хоть сдесь нет и русского я довольнатоки хорошо читаю и перевожу на английском.


Итог: Я бы хотел порекомендовать эту игру для людей любящих пиксельную графику (вид с верху) с уклоном на сюжет и хоррор.

P.S. Не ожидал что игруля будет довольно-таки страшная для меня :D

24380268.review:
Early Access Review
----------------------------
This is one of the best indie games I've ever played. This is classic horror at it finest. The writing, music, atmosphere and monsters are perfectly designed. The atmosphere will keep you on edge the entire time. The only time you really get an "escape" from the atmosphere is if you're fighting a wolf outside during the day. But as soon as you kill that wolf, you immediately go back on edge. All the other combat will keep you on edge the entire time.

This game doesn't have "jumpscares" but it is seriously one of the most terrifying games I've ever played.

Then you have the Nightmare that is the nights. I don't want to spoil anything that happens, you should buy this game anyway, you can find out then.

The crafting is simple but it fits the gameplay perfectly. The scavenging day to day to get by always keeps the game fresh because you have to go out further and further each day. On top of that is the procedurally generated map which always makes things very interesting.

All of the core gameplay is there, all that's left to develop is the story (from the half we've seen, it is amazing so far).

Don't let the "Early Access" label fool you. This game is absolutely fantastic. If you like horror, this is for you, if you like survival, this is for you, if you like a game that oozes with atmosphere, this is for you. This game sets a standard for any game attempting anything similar in the future, from the writing and characters to the atmosphere, combat and scavenging. 

I would also like to mention that with all my hours on this game I haven't even seen half of everything that's in the early access version. I still have many hours of gameplay left.

This game deserves to be played. It is well worth your money.


After Release
------------------
Well the developers pulled off what very few can. On top of having the confidence to release the game on GOG, they gave a free safe torrent link to anyone who wants it.
Good on you Acid Wizard, show's off how much faith you have in your game and this community.
Thanks for being an amazing developer.
