23684825.review:
This game scares the crap out of me. I mean this in a good way, but I feel like it is too difficult to get anything done. There is a certain point where fear becomes a hindrance, and keeps you from progressing, and I'm just not sure if this game hits that balance. Of course, I'm horrible at horror games, so don't let that be the deciding factor.

All in all, it's a pretty beautiful game, and it does fear and suspense very well. The sounds in the night are not just sounds. There is actually something hunting you, and it's just found its way inside. Every night is an oxygen denied waiting game, where silence and stillness is the name of the game. You'll find yourself cursing when the character shifts on its own and you hear his coat move. If you want a true horror survival where every choice and every opened container can mean your death, or slightly delayed death, this might be the game for you. It's an unforgiving game that depends on line of sight, darkness, and horrifying sound design that will make you jittery and wishing for that white screen of daylight.  Just don't expect to be able to actually progress in the game if you're not willing to bite back your fear and dive into the horrors that dwell outside. Even a single enemy could spell your death, and there really isn't a way to be properly prepared or get the upper hand.

23626835.review:
This review is an early access one and will be subject to change as time goes by.




So, Darkwood, its somethin alright.

I've first bought this game on a lovely sale I think sometime back in 2014? Close to the release date? I'm not sure. Maybe I watched a youtuber play it and I bought it at some point. I dunno. But at any case, I've realized after all this time, I've spent about a full day total onto this very game. So, its appropriate enough for me to begin reviewing it.
(Note, this may contain spoilers so if you dont want to risk it, dont read.)


Darkwood is a top down perspective survival horror game. Though it gives limited vision, meaning you have to look all around you and be on your toes because this gives a sense of anxiousness. You dont know what might be across the field next to you, and you wont know that you're about to back into some poisonous mushrooms. This gives off an interesting feeling when you play the game, having to be purposely alert like in FNAF. The first one anyways, but I digress.

Its focus on horror is mainly on my favorite, sound. You might hear footsteps in the distance, or at night you might hear some thumping noise or shreik just outside your door or barricaded window. You'll never know and thats what I love about it. The sound mixed in with limited vision gives such a dreadful feeling that something is there and you dont know if you should look or not. [spoiler] Like at one point at night in this reviews more recent playthrough, I was minding my own business, just trying to wait the night out before I saw a light and noise just outside my house that was out of my characters vision. It was new and weird, so I went to investigate, and it was some kind of creature with red all around him, before it unfolds its arms and then releases birds/crows from under him before disappearing. This immediately got me nervous and I love that there is something that might be dangerous yet you dont know what it is. I love this fearful feeling. [/spoiler]

The combat.....its okay. Its a little finicky to handle because you have to wind up the attack all the way before swinging. And you dont get guns or things like that till mid game, but its a long way from where you would be depending if you're new to the game. I did find it annoying to having to wind up the attack all the way, making it difficult to judge when to swing. But thats just me. Maybe thats how it should be.

The story wont be spoiled here, but I can try to describe it as best I can without spoiling. To me, its incomplete. But thats because its in early access and all.

Speaking of, for an early access game, this is a long ass early access. I feel that the developers could put more time and energy into speeding the process up because this ambitious project is very, VERY ambitious. Tough to tackle too what with all that goes on in developing games. Though its none of my business, I would say that something like a kickstarter or funding program would greatly help get this game noticed more, and then get the support it needs to hurry its way out of early access. Because at this point, it might be in early access for a long long time, what with what they need to do to get all the story and game together.



All and all, this game is one of my favorite horror games to this day. Though at first I hated it because trading was such a mess, but now with all that it is now, its at least fun, while at the same time challenging. And every time the developers FINALLY update it, its always a fun update to make me come back and play some more. Even though it makes my save game invalid due to the update, causing me to restart, it still feels worth it to see all the things they add into it. I give these guys my full support because what they got here is one of the most fun, exciting, heart pounding horror games I've ever played. The dreadful feeling of hearing a monster growl or make some sort of noise quickly makes me alert and at the same time, scared. All and all, if you crave a horror game and have a lot of time to spend (Seriously, you might spend quite a bit of time into this per session) while at the same time needing a new and fresh idea for a horror game, go buy this one. There wont be any regrets.




Bonus: MAJOR SPOILS
[spoiler] By the by, that one section where I had to go into the chapel and move around a literal horde of sleeping monsters was the most terrifying and unfavorite section of a horror game I've ever played. Please make more scary things. <3 [/spoiler]

23513765.review:
Darkwood is thrilling, unsettling, and at times down-right terrifying. I never would have thought a non first-person game could be so immersive... But it is. Maybe it's the hand-crafted artwork that blends itself so seemlessly into the setting, maybe it's the writing, or the world itself: twisted and yet so familiar. Nevertheless, I find myself time and time again cowering in the corner of some walled-off room, heart pounding... "What was that?!"

Also, this early access game has been faithfully updated over and over again by the small team of developers, who are in contact with the community and, yes, definitely still working (hard) on the project. Yes, waiting between updates can be frustrating... But that's only because the game is so good! This ambitious project is one to buy, to love, and to watch unfold before our eyes, in the best spirit of Early Access.

I give it 5/5 dead chickens :-)

Those feelings of misanthropy, loneliness, depression and hopelessness, as if the whole world conspires (and in this game it is) to obliterate you; that would define this game. If you like a dark apocalyptic world, where you have survive throughout ruthless enemies while you try to unveil the mysteries of it; that will be a great game for you.

Yet, although, this game is in Alpha version, which means you'll find, as I did, some technical issues; as a weak combativeness (op enemies), crashes and bugs. It is very frustrating when you die in this game, for it demands a huge effort to be alive, day after day. But this don't spoil the potential of this game, not at all.

So, yes!, I recommend this game.

22212615.review:
Horror games of these days rely ALOT(90% of the game) in jumpscares, and jumpscares alone, but not Darkwood.
Darkwood actually keeps the challenge, atmosphere(one of the most important elements of a horror game), and story REAL, the whole game is about you getting by each terryfing night alive, using any and every means to it. And "hey", there's a lot of different paths, weapons, gedgets and ways to do it, not even mentioning the brilliant RPG/skill based system that does't give you a clearly, straightforward advantage agaisnt your foes or the fucked up world that definitely IS against you.
In the end, I tell you if you liked: Day-Z(good scaveging), Minecraft(unique generated open world), Alone in the Dark(great atmosphere) and Resident Evil(You know what you are against, but you probably will get startle as the dangers come), you definitely need to give this ALPHA(oh, well.......)  a try.
The only possible way this game can hit the a-hole, is never coming out, since it's been two years(?) and still is in it's first chapter... 
But, boy, it already is a sweet lifetime experience for horror games customers, like me :). I can definitely recommend the game as it is now, but you can probably wait for a sale discount, if you *understandably* is concerned about the "Early Access status".

21876645.review: I absolutly adore this game and its concept. I have had it since 3.1 and have been paying attention to its development ever since. The psycological horror in this game puts you on edge and many other games out there dont have that type of horror. However the ones that do, dont do it as good as Darkwood does. In the first two zones of the game (Dry Meadow, Silent Forest) you have relatively good safety during the day and are crying in a corner at night. Just be ready for the Old Woods. This area has roaming chompers even during the day. At night you will constantly question your survival and you might even become paranoid. Just make sure you dont feel like a badass when you get a gun, cause those chompers will charge you and f*ck you up even if you have a line of sight. Whenever this game is updated i get pretty excited and cant wait to see what they added. The bad side though and i hate to critizize the people who made this, but they need to spend more time on this game's development. So many people think they abandoned it and dont give it any attention because of its largely spaced out updates. I mean for christ's sake, the description of the game says it will be released in 2015 (Last Year). I really hope in the future they will put more time into the game. I know they are trying to perfect the story, but this is just unacceptable with the amount of time it has been taking. It has been in early access for 2 years. Overall, if your looking for a game that mixes constant psychological horror with a threatning task of survival, this is the game for you. Just be prepared to wait until this game is done which will most likely take another year.

A wonderfully dark and satisfying atmosphere. 
The audio in this game is one of the highlights its almost as important as your viewing distance, alerting you to the many interesting creatures, in this thriller survival game.
Run, fight, sit there and cry as night approaches. Each choice you make can be your last as you cross through the Dark Wood. 
This is a great Early Access game, plenty of content already, and a compelling story to keep you interested in what’s going on. I recommend this game to anyone who is tired of the usually games on the market and want to get a different experience while gaming.

потом вы просыпаетесь в доме, вы лутаете дом находите книгу, плиту( на котором написано, что ночью нельзя выходить лучше т.к. плита защищает своими газами  очень сильных мутантов), после того как облутали весь дом  надо уже идти в саму локацию(их пока-что 3 типа, но они большие и сами различаються по сложности и мутантами), а на следующий день перед вами когда вы просыпаетесь появляется Оборотень(есть еще много персонажей Пиотрек,Тетка с курами и т.д. по ходу игры узнаете) он вам и говорит всё что происходит в этом лесу.

[u]Атмосфера [/u] - Атмосфера этой игры  очень классная вещь разработчики игры Acid Wizard, сильно постарались они всё сделали от шелеста травы и ломания палок при ходьбе до того как в ночи кто то орёт за окном и начинает ломиться в дверь )).

[u]Коротко об Альфе версии игры [/u] - разработчики игры Acid Wizard сделали игру не в бету(хотя она очень плохожа на бету, баги почти не встречались с с самой первой версии (2-3 бага за все версии были только)), они сделали её Альфа версию, но вы не бойтесь разработчики не забросили игру хоть уже ей ~1.5 года  обновления делаются каждый месяц глобальные.

[u]Моё впечатление об игре [/u]] - я ждал её еще с Стимовского GreenLight и как я узнал когда она выходит а это было Июль 2014 я очень обрадовался, но купил её не сразу т.к. была распродажа, но через месяц я купил её  и не пожалел.

[spoiler] если что то можете посмотреть как я играю в Steam трансляции ежедневно с 8 вечера до 10 вечера. [/spoiler]
[spoiler] Если что я напишу руководство по игре Darkwood, дам русификатор и многое другое [/spoiler]
Спасибо что уделили время на прочитания моего обзора на игру :)

(Для Acid Wizard) - очень нравится игра пожалуйста сделайте для неё Steam значек и фон :)

21190951.review:
[h1] Неужели Релиз?! [/h1]

Как долго я тебя ждал... Мой сладкий кошмар...

[h1] Сюжет [/h1]

Сюжет представляет из себя поиск обрывков лора, который иногда сам приходит к тебе в частности ночью, разговоры с очень специфичными НПС которые все в свою очередь уникальны и несовсем психически здоровы. Если коротко и без спойлеров. Вам нужно выбраться из леса. Есть нелинейсность и несколько вариантов концовок. Большое количество диалогов, намеков на происходящее в мире, но чтобы все понять придется потратить очень много времени и сил.

[h1] Гемплей[/h1]

Представляет собой очень, очень сложный сурваивал-хорор с РПГ элементами где каждый прожитый день, а еще важнее ночь будет вашей маленькой победой, и чтобы дойти до конца придеться словить неплохой такой ВИН-стрик.
Есть система перков, огнестрел, ближний бой. Важно игра позволяет вам быть очень сильным и готовым практически к любой ситуации. Какой вы выбирете способ прохождения зависит только от вас. Хочешь быть выносливым стелс ниндзяй с топором в руках и инвизом? Окей на. Хочешь быть убер♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥атым стрелком бери автомат, пистолет, дробовик или винтовку. Только патронов больше набери.
В целом придеться обследовать каждый угол леса и все локации. Везде можно найти что-то полезное, главное побороть свой страх и лезть в самую темную ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, чем опаснее локация, тем полезнее в ней лут.

[h1] Атмосфера [/h1]
Это главный и лучший аспект в игре. Пробирает до жутких муражек на кончиках пальцев. Ну вот в какой еще игре ты будешь обнимать лампу держа в другой руке ножку от стула, и плакать, вслушиваясь в леденящие душу вопли прямо за твоей входной дверью. И каким бы ты небыл сильным, какой бы пушкой ты бы не был вооружен, тебе все равно БУДЕТ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥СТРАШНО! Ведь озвучка в игре просто шикарна, просто вагон и маленькая тележка, и даже спустя 100 (до релиза я играл на пиратке) часов игре находиться чем тебя удивить. Стук в дверь? Открой. Там может быть враг, подарок или приглашение на свадью... Страшно и темно. Но все реально преодолеть главное не бойся и шагни во тьму своих кошмаров, и кошмаров Темного Леса.

21087828.review:
[h1]This game is exactly what i always wanted to play. It's contain all the most important things: sound, game design, mystery story and nervous gameplay. Lots of interactive items and options. Awesome characters and creatures, nice weaponry arsenal. It's playable now, and i am glad that it's only alpha[/h1]

[h1]This game is Good[/h1]

[b]You know, i always want to have own half-ruined house in CREEPY GOD DAMNED PLACE among forest. The start place is dark and depressive as f*ck, so i didn't even expect that it's REGULAR DAY. I was running around my house trying to grab everything that i can find, when suddenly it seemed to me that environment gets darker. Then i ran to sawmill, then to my room,then i start to barricade door and near windows in panic. Generator wasn't turned ON. I sit over 10 minutes in fear, awaiting some sh*t, and i get it, as soon as i understand that i sit whole DAY here! I am goes mad when it's start to  REALLY GETTING DARK !
I won't tell you what the sh*t actually happens at night, but it's f*king creepy. Don't even know. You never know what will come to you, together with night.. Will it's just big dogs or mutants, that will crush your barricades and rip you? Okay, you always can barricade yourself pretty, and keep surviving to get serious weapons and light sources.. But what if this night you will be visited not by monsters, but something other? Something, that can go through doors, windows and lights? Listen to the silence of the night... Look through barricaded windows and fog behind them... Can you hear whispers, quiet cry of lonely woman?

But don't worry, man with wolf's head and AK47 will help you, and also, give you some bullets. For half of your poor inventory, of course.
 
Even in alpha, every night prolongs game pretty good. Hope developers will continue to make this game. There's only 1 chapter in game right now. The chapter contain 3 big locations and 2-3 additional.

[h1]Developers, please, don't throw it away! It's very important game, not only for me.[/h1]

21061865.review:
[i]Darkwood is an Early Access title, this review is subject to change. Date and Version at time of [strike]writing[/strike] editing: December 18th -- Alpha 8.1[/i]

[h1] TL;DR: One of only two Early Access games I didn't feel cheated out of my money on, and in fact highly recommend. Please fund these guys.[/h1]

Darkwood, from The Acid Wizards, is based on atmosphere and tension. Rather than resorting to jump-scares it relies on psychological horror and [b]organic[/b] scares in the sandbox. It's also a game whose mechanics are kinda hard to describe or summarize without spoiling. But I'll try:

This top-down title achieves 'scariness' partly due to great artistic style and sound design, but mechanically it's because of your line-of-sight - the way that light and your LOS interact to affect your ability to see in the dark is reminiscent of the foreboding feeling most people got from Silent Hill 2's fog.
Speaking of darkness, Night is probably the most important mechanic other than light and sight so far. At the end of each day one must survive through the night. Hide in a corner behind a wardrobe you dragged over and barely scrape by - or take the fight to those who would hunt you, and enjoy the spoils of war.
[b][Updated Note:]Changes to Nighttime have introduced an unkillable enemy that forces you to stay indoors during the dark hours. This mechanic is highly controversial among the early-access community.[/b]

Combat is rather precise and unforgiving like the Souls games or CRAWL, but in sandbox fashion can mostly be avoided by hiding well or fleeing. Different melee weapons provide different tactics: you'll likely find your favorite bashing tool and religiously stick with it. Firearms are an expensive resource, but will give those struggling with melee [b]far more[/b] than just an edge if they can source themselves some ammunition.

By day, you explore the world for crafting items and NPCs using landmarks automatically marked on your map once close enough. Some landmarks and areas have function or loot, others are solely for navigation. The shape of the world and the location of, and loot in, each setpiece changes each new game (with few exceptions). Combined with the permadeath difficulty, a very satisfying rogue-like experience is available.

When story isn't extracted in a Dark-Soulsian way (by the player inferring things from the environment), it comes from artistic cinematics, or the flavourful NPCs. While they communicate in small walls of text, they're aided by an [i]unsettlingly[/i] animated portrait. This is shared with the greater world, where some lootable bodies, hostile flooring, items needed for XP, and even some idle enemies have strange and twitchy, but creepily organic animations.
[b][Updated Note:] The Acid Wizards have doubled-down on their artstyle and worldbuilding with it. Players who find their way to Chapter 2 will be richly rewarded with some of the most fucked-up-cool-shit I've ever seen depicted in a videogame. H.R. Giger ain't got shit on these Polish fellows.[/b]

At current the game's second chapter ends rather abruptly, leaving the player to free-roam the second chapter's map, but this is somewhat made up for by the number of places one can explore, and the irregular updates that either provide a shovel of new content or reworked game mechanics, requiring players to find more efficient playstyles under new rules.

[h1] Summary: [/h1]
Darkwood might be an incomplete game with [literally:] one or two flaws, but I believe the art, atmosphere, gameplay, and effort are more than worth anyone's time. I'd put it on-par with a few of Steam's other indies like Nuclear Throne, or CRAWL, in that playing Darkwood is doing yourself a service.

20761519.review:
This game is a genuine horror which makes it stand out so much from the rest.
From the graphics to the literature and down to the very gameplay it's an extremely promising gem to look forward to.

tl;dr 
gud graphic
gud sound
gud gameplay
gud narrative
zero jumpscares
pure atmospheric horror

The graphics make the game so aesthetically beautiful no matter what environment you're in, the little animations that brings it to life contribute greatly to the immersion.
At a few points in the game there will be some narrative to describe the environment beyond the 2D top-down view and it does so in a poetic way that it doubles up with the graphics and really gives you the feeling of a realistic atmosphere.
Sounds you hear at night; the echoing of moving furniture and stomping around indoors, the distant yelping from dogs being attacked by God knows what, and the music that plays during the morning segments.
Being so afraid of what may be out there that you cower in a corner or lock yourself off in a room, tense from the idea that something might crash through the barricaded window, or push aside a wardrobe you used to block a door. Such small little tasks become the biggest deal in this game, and not in a frustrating way; for the story and world keeps you compelled to continue, waiting in anticipation for the next day so that you can get those resources you wanted or explore that location you didn't have time to explore the previous day.
Acid Wizard Studio are doing the best they can to turn this game into an ideal horror experience that any fan of it will enjoy.

20429216.review:
Il est difficile de s'exprimer sur Darkwood, tant le jeu est sombre et mystérieux. De plus, il n'est pas encore arrivé au terme de son développement.

Obscure, dérangeant, troublant, effrayant, poignant, sont autant de qualificatifs qui pourraient le désigner. Difficile aussi, car il fait partie de ces jeux, trop rares, qui ne pardonnent rien, et toute mort est définitive. Bien sûr, il existe une option permettant d'offrir une seconde chance aux plus désespérés, mais croyez-moi, vous y perdrez en expérience de jeu.
Darkwood, c'est ce piège cauchemardesque, dont vous ne saisissez pas toute l'ampleur, qui se referme insidieusement, jour après jour, sur votre personnage. Et le véritable intérêt réside dans la certitude qu'on peut mourir à tout instant. 

Vous n'aurez pas peur comme dans l'Ocean Hotel de Vampire: The Masquerade, ou le Shalebridge Cradle de Thief.
Mais, vous allez y découvrir une angoisse malsaine, oppressante, qui va réellement vous hanter, portée par une ambiance sonore exceptionnelle et particulièrement immersive.

Ce jeu est comme un fantôme sur Steam, et chaque fois que je vois son logo apparaître dans une liste, je ne peux m'empêcher de frissonner.

C'est une belle expérience vidéo-ludique, développée par les Acid Wizards, trois polonais talentueux qui ont de l'avenir devant eux. Je recommande.

Too bad really, i like the game and i think it had potential.


This game is still in early access, and imho its allready way better than many (dare i say most?) "finished", sometimes expensive survival horror games out there today.
Its also very polished, and by far the most bug free and functional pre-release game ibe seen. The only reason you know its an unfinished/early access game is because it sais so on the main menu. If they removed this legend you really wouldnt notice, as i have yet to find a serious bug or problem with the game.

It has great atmosphere, great immersion, smart & simple crafting mechanics, ZERO handholding (key for a survival game), no "objective markers", "magic GPS like" positioning on the map (you actually need to keep track of where you are or youll get lost & die!), This game actually makes you feel "uneasy" (or just plain scared if you scare easy) during the nights, when you are standing in the corner of your room, behind your barricades & traps, praying that they manage to keep the evil creatures outside.

Another thing i like is that besides being a survival game it has a story. I have not finished the game yet, but so far i like the story. 

Basically (setting the story aside) the gameplay is you need to explore the map to find resoruces (gas, wood, metal parts, building materials, etc) to secure your house for the night, and you must do this during the day, as going out at night is suicide. Then setup your defences and survive the night, the time when ghosts, monsters and evil creatures (no zombies this time THANK GOD!), will try to get inside your house and kill you.
Do you turn the generator on for some light in the night (at the expense of gas)? or do you set traps, barricades and stay perfectly still on a corner IN COMPLETE DARKNESS without making noise, hoping they wont notice you? Either way you need to remember you are not some kung-fu expert, RPG welding rambo who can kill anything, and the best way to survive is to avoid combat as much as possible, so if you want a combat game, this is NOT it. This one is about smarts, survival, planning and managing your time wisely.

I almost forgot, if you think that because this game is "top down view" youre gonna be able to exploit this to your advantage (like see whats behind you), youre in for an un-pleasant surprise. You have a vision "cone", and tough you can see the map arround you, can only see whats in front of you. Just like you would in a First person game.

If you like survival horror games, you will most likely love this one. Be warned thoug, its game is HARD. like i said there is no handholding, no "radar" or "minimap" and one wrong call might me your last.

10/10 totally recommended!

19886867.review:
Если мы скрестим геймплей Hotline Miami c cеттингом из Сталкера, изрядно приправленным долей лавкрафтианских ужасов, добавим сюда инвентарь, стамину, апгрейды и процедурный мир с сюжетными "островками", то получится... Darkwood.
 Если разработчики доведут свои задумки до конца (а пока тревожных признаков еще не замечено), то на выходе должна  получиться игра, которая способна будет спасти жанр Survival Horror. С крутым сюжетом,в меру тяжелым геймплеем и жуткой, тягучей, как застывающий битум, атмосферой. Пока же на руках у нас есть только пролог и первая глава.
 Скажу честно, игру я еще не прошел. У меня наиграно всего пять часов, и все это время я пытался накопить бабла на что-нибудь более мощное, чем доска с гвоздями, чтобы отвоевать второе убежище у дикарей с копьями. Эти гады знатно потрепали мне нервы, я никак не мог подстроиться под тайминг их атак. Разбросанные кем-то рядом капканы ситуацию не улучшали. А в первые ночи я и вовсе трясся, словно осиновый лист, прислушиваясь к шорохам и стукам снаружи забаррикадированного мной помещения. Но того, что я увидел мне хватило. Моя фантазия быстро нарисовала картину странного места, где что-то пошло [i]не так[/i]. 
 Лес разросся и мутировал. Вместе с ним мутировали и его обитатели - все по разному. Особенно это отразилось на людях, которым не повезло оказаться в лесу. Среди них и главный герой. Виной этому, предположительно, некая инфекция, упоминаемая в прологе. Но творящееся вокруг сложно объяснить просто инфекцией. Ни одна известная болезнь не способна менять живые существа настолько. И уж точно, ни одна из них не заставляет деревья разрастаться в сплошные, непроходимые стены из переплетенных стволов и корней. 
 Если короче - в лесу происходит [i]хрень[/i]. Задача главного героя - выбраться из леса. Вам в его шкуре придется отложить кирпичей, свыкнуться с происходящим вокруг и разработать план движения к цели, попутно узнавая ответы на некоторые вопросы, касаемо происходящего вокруг. Жуть будут нагонять на постоянной основе. Во первых где-то к семи часам вечера по игровому времени вам лучше быть дома. Иначе - верная смерть, в темноте, вне убежища вы гарантированно отправитесь в небытие. Во вторых дом тоже придется защищать. И не только от материальных пришельцев. Для некоторых врагов стены и баррикады преградой не являются, и вам придется придумывать иные, более активные способы борьбы с ними. В третьих в игре есть локации с неприятными сюрпризами. В четвертых в игре есть еще и сны. Во снах тоже происходит всякая хрень, и с вероятностью в 99% в конце сна вы обязательно сдохните, чтобы проснуться, свернувшись калачиком, у странной плиты у себя дома.
 Вот такая вот выходит игра. Здесь я, наверное, завершу свой поток впечатлений о ней и вынесу простой вердикт:
10\10 Играть однозначно. Но все же посоветовал бы тем, кто еще не приобрел ее, подождать релиза. Ранний доступ - штука не всегда приятная, а релиз, как мне видится, все еще не скоро.

19836292.review:
In the traditional spirit of Steam game reviews: I really wanted to like this game, and I did and still do.

Darkwood has been in early access for a long time, but it's been more than playable since it first came out. Never encountered a game breaking bug. The content updates are not weekly or even monthly, but it's already a great game, and they're mostly balancing it out. Personally, it's always been for the best.

Darkwood is a great mix between linear progression and randomization.

The devs keep changing the game mechanics here and there, but it's never a bad thing. They want to keep you on the move, while keeping you on your toes.

The atmosphere of this game is just incredible. During the day, you watch every single footstep you make. You never know when there's going to be a creep, an angry animal or just some poisonous mushrooms for you to step on. Some people don't like it, I love it... it makes you watch your every step... every step of the way.

During the night, you'll wish you scavenged enough wood to board up the windows that got destroyed the previous night, and just hope to god or whoever you believe in that it's going to end soon.

While the learning curve is not always easy, the game doesn't force you to move on to more difficult areas. You can stay in the beginning area (the Meadow) for as long as you like, and come back to it and spend some time there as much as you want. But know this, the further you progress in the game, the darker the woods are going to get...

19221270.review:
Ok, Misture a atmosfera de trevas e medo do desconhecido do Silent Hill, com a jogabilidade e um mundo (que quer te matar) de Don't Starve.
Resultado:
Um jogo de graficos simples, jogabilidade estabanada (pra piorar o seu medo de luta), uma história complexa e cheia de segredos, um mundo em estado apocalíptico, um sistema de habilidade ultilizando da flora de uma floresta sinistra com efeitos colaterais (que dificultam ainda mais a sua sobrevivencia).

Darkwood trás aos seus jogadores a realidade de quão frágil e instintiva uma pessoa fica em uma situação de extremo numa floresta macabra, tentando sobreviver dentre os turnos diários dentre pilhagem/Dia e sobrevivência/Noite, é notavel a dificuldade de luta nesse jogo trazendo ainda mais à realidade situacional de alguem tentando sobrreviver em  condições de fraqueza, multilação, e mutação (Se você quer um entreterimento de click/kill, não lhe recomendo esse jogo).

Recomendo pessoalmente este jogo a pessoas que procuram uma sobrevivência complexa ao terror da noite, e uma historia repleta de surpresas e atrativos macabros.

18880037.review:
Постраюсь кратко, т.к. читать простыни самому лень. 

Добро пожаловать в симулятор польского лесника-грибника.
Игровой процесс вкратце:
14 минут исследования карты, борьба с тенями и местными хулиганами. Потом забег обратно в нору, закалачивание дверей и окон, подливание бензина в генератор. И 5 минут ожидания утра под вопли и пляски недобитой лесной шантрапы. Затем время замирает, можно проверить капканы под окнами и поторговать с мирными гостями. И ... опять в лес...

Первое время кирпичный завод работает на ура, но после сборки первого ствола, наконец появляется гордость за профессию.

Итак, плюсы:
- атмосферность
- озвучка
- разнообразный крафт
- умеренная сложность
- сюжет
- персонажи
- игра света
- ламповость какая-то чтоли
- оригинальная прокачка персонажа отварами из грибов
- крепкие кирпичи

минусы:
очень мало времени на световой день (хорошо ещё есть утренний тайм-фриз). Из-за этого приходится постоянно контролировать время, всё на бегу, не успеваешь насладиться атмосферой как следует..

Если вас не отпугивает вид сверху и пиксельная графика, то качать. Для альфы очень здорово.

9 польских лесников из 10.

Dark memories attached to places and people, just like the real world. This game uses extremely in depth sound effects. When the lights go out in your safe house after the sun goes down you listen to the things that go bump in the night. The game forces you to rely on hearing to determine locations of enemies invading the abandoned building you use as a safe house. The forest is so thick you and your neighbors are trapped without escape. Sometimes you hear a monster in the night, sometimes you hear a npc going mad screaming into the night. This game is extremely dark and well detailed. A very worthy purchase this game will make you jump. I don't care

18427165.review:
Игру я купил чуть больше года назад, летом 2014 года.
Насколько я помню, тогда начали пачками выходить сурвайвал игры - Darkwood была одной из них, но её мало кто заметил.
Ранее, игра была успешно профинансирована на аналоге кикстартера, что пошло ей на пользу.
Итак, перечислю плюсы и минусы данной игрули.

[b]+Атмосфера.[/b]

Место действия игры - какие-то леса, пропитанные советским антуражем.
Разработчики отлично поработали над атмосферой. Лес - очень тёмное, мрачное и страшное место, полное сюрреализма.
Везде разрушенные дома, многое покрыто странными биомассами, земля уже почти поглотила гнилые, обезображенные трупы, повсюду шастают непонятные твари, ночью происходит паранормальная фигня, кто-то стучится в двери и ходит за окном, постоянно происходит какая-то непонятная херня - всё это создаёт свою уникальную атмосферу, и нагоняет жути. Пиксель-арт тут тоже на высоте.

[b]+Выживание.[/b]

Выживания, каким мы его привыкли видеть тут мало. Искать еду и воду[spoiler]в последнем обновлении убрали необходимость пить воду[/spoiler]не надо. Вместо этого нужно просто переживать ночь в убежище, какой-то газ не даёт герою умереть.
Но от этого не легче. Сначала у вас не будет ВООБЩЕ никаких средств обороны, так что приходиться судорожно бродить по округе и искать нужные ресурсы. Не успеешь - весёлая ночь гарантирована.
Кратко говоря, игровой процесс заключается в борьбе за свою жизнь. Твари так и норовят вас убить - мало того, что они вас намного сильнее, так они ещё и пытаются проникнуть к вам любым образом - сломать баррикаду или обойти капкан для них плёвое дело. И ходят они чаще всего группами, так что смерть обязательно настигнет в первые дни игры.
Игра сложная и беспощадная, это радует.

[b]+Сюжет.[/b]
Цель игры - не просто выживание. Главный герой попал в очень неприятную ситуацию, и теперь вынужден искать свой ключ, который у него отнял один из персонажей. Готова только одна глава, но разработчики уже заготовили нам колоритных персонажей, у каждого из которых есть своя история и свои квесты.
Сюжет тут не то чтобы инновационный, но очень интересный, на удивление проработанный, загадочный и интригующий. С нетерпением жду новой главы.

[b]+Рандомная генерация мира.[/b]

Мир большой, и рандомная генерация реально вносит разнообразие в игру.
Меняется не только расположение локаций, но и их структура.
Не буду особо распинаться, скажу кратко - рандомная генерация делает своё дело так, как надо.

Теперь к минусам.

[b]-Темп разработки.[/b]

Нет никаких блогов, обновления выходят не очень часто, порой кажется, что игру забросили.
Но тут разработчиков можно простить - их всего трое. Они пытались нанять больше людей, но в результате они потеряли много времени и денег, поэтому решили работать дальше втроём. Эти три человека делают реально отличную работу - каждое обновление кардинально меняло игру в лучшую сторону. К тому же, разработчики реально следят за форумом, учитывают все замечания и пожелания, отвечают почти на все вопросы. Вообще, этот минус можно смело убирать, но я всё же оставлю, так как иногда реально смущает это непонятное молчание разработчиков целыми месяцами.

[b]Чем сейчас занимаются разработчики?[/b]
Сейчас они нацелены на полировку механики игры. Эксперементируют с балансом, упрощают игру, улучшают рандомную генерацию, и всё в этом духе.Как только они и игроки будут довольны игровой механикой - начнётся работа над сюжетом, новыми главами, и т.д.
Советую обратить внимание на данный проект.

18406813.review:
Даже не знаю с чего начать...начну, наверое, с плюсов :
1) Атмосфера
Впервые я увидел эту игру в одном из видео Markiplier'а, и полюбилась она мгновенно. Темная стилистика, чем-то отдаленно напоминающая Сайлент Хилл, и выживание, наряду с наличием сюжета придают игре шарм. Сидеть в темном доме, сжимая доску с гвоздями, и слушая завывание непонятной херни за окном, а под утро разговаривать с чуваком, у которого собачья голова вместо нормальной, и Калашников за спиной - довольно необычно.  Если вы любите мрачные игры - она для вас.
2) Сложность
Купил я ее относительно давно, и наряду с  мрачным стилем и возможностью вкалывать раствор из грибов себе в вену мне запомнилась еще одна особенность - она. чертовски. трудная.
Я умирал. Я умирал очень много. В то время игра новичков не прощала. Не знаешь как скрафтить оружие? - труп. Не нашел топлива на ночь? - труп. Не забарикадировал одно окно? - пришла неведомая, заражающая все по чему ползет, херь и теперь в твоем доме живой, очень больно кусающийся пол. Дарквуд не давал расслаблятся и обьяснял только базовые вещи. После нескольких попыток, заканчивающихся смертью я все-таки сдался и забросил ее на определенное время, пока не вернулся снова...и я был приятно удивлен.
Добавили много приятных мелочей, и теперь выживать куда проще, однако трудности не исчезли. Игра не отпускает, но и не выжимает из вас все, как раньше.  Если вы хотите нестандартную выживалку - она для вас.
3) Сюжет
Да-да, сюжет. Я знаю что наличие сюжета - это не что-то инновационное, но его наличие в очередной сурвайвалке - это очень похвально, тем более что он там составляет знатную долю от всего в ней проиходящего. Мысль о том, что ты не просто так слоняешься по округе, пытаясь найти шмот получше - все-таки греет, а местные персонажи и приятные мелочи порой очень радуют.
   Наверное на этом я перестану ее хвалить, и кратко опишу минусы: 
1) Сурвайвинг
И минус и плюс одновременно, некоторыи людям не нравятся такой жанр. Из очевидных вещей можно перечислить такие как: бегай туда-сюда, лутай ящички, грейди берлогу и т.д. Слушать истории и беззаботно путешествовать конечно прекрасно, но за ресурсами ходить необходимо.
2) Трудности
Опять-таки, для кого-то это можеть быть лишь проблемой. Если вы решили играть в Дарквуд - готовьтесь к сильным тварям, частым поиском ресурсов, а так-же непредвиденным ситуациям. Тотального хардкора конечно нет, но расслабиться тоже не получится. Наслаждайся атмосферой и держи оружие наготове.
3) Это всего-лишь игра, черт побери
Люди, которые скажут: "А-а-а твою-ж за ногу, опять умер. Все, удалю её, не игра а чушь" или "Ну и что в ней такого, я ожидал большего" естественно найдутся, так что не расчитывайте от нее Слишком многого - это не игра десятилетия, но и не майнкрафт. Это интерестная, мрачная игра, и мне она понравилась.
Моя оценка - 7.1/10, Рекомендую всем, кому она приглянулась. Если вы сомневаетесь, но готовы потратиться на нее - можете смело ее брать.

18374028.review:
Mit Abstand ist Darkwood eines der gruseligsten und zugleich atemberaubendsten Spiele die ich jemals gespielt habe. 
Warum??
Lasst mich euch das Spiel erklären:
Darkwood spielt in einer apocalyptischen Welt und man selber spielt einen Überlebenden, welcher in einer Gegend lebt, inder Tags Wölfe hinter dir her sind und Nachts die bizarren Bewohner/Monster dieser Gegend. 
Man startet ohne jegliches Wissen, warum dies so ist und was mit der eigentlichen Welt passiert ist, jedoch weisen viele Aspekte darauf hin, dass es etwas mit der Unterwelt zu tun hat. Nun muss man im Tageslicht Rohstoffe und verscheidenste Dinge finden um in diesem Spiel klar zu kommen. Man muss auch Pilze sammeln, mit denen man seine Skills an einem Ofen erweitern kann. Jeder positive Skill bringt einen Nachteil mit sich. So wird das Spiel immer schön schwer gehalten und denkt jah nicht, dass es im Verlauf des Spieles einfacher wird !
Nachts gehts dann richtig ab. Man muss seit dem neusten Update nichtmehr an einem Brunnen Wasser abzapfen um die Nacht durchzustehen, man muss in sein von einem Gas gefülltem Haus untertauchen und die dunklen Kreaturen nicht reinlassen. Fenster verbarikadieren ist hier ein MUSS! Türe mit Möbeln zuschütten und den Generator anschmeißen wäre immer eine gute Idee ;) 
Hat man die Nacht nun überstanden, geht alles wieder von vorne los. Nichts besonderes, wenn man bedenkt, dass es ein Survivalgame ist.

Doch nun kommt der Knüller:
Dieses Spiel, ist mit Alien Isolation eines der intensivsten Erlebnisse in meiner Gamingzeit. Die Atmosphere passt perfekt!
Tags über streicht man über die Wiesen der Menschenlosen gegend und trifft die bizarresten, halbwegs normalen Überlebenden. Und Nachts bekommt man so eine SCH*** Angst, dass man kauernd in der Ecke hockt und darauf wartet, dass die Sonne endlich aufgeht und man weiter Schnitzeljagd spielen kann. Die Monster sind einfallsreich, das ganze Visuelle Geschehen ist perfekt und über die Soundkulisse muss ich erst gar nicht reden. 
Im Großen und Ganzen ist Darkwood das beste Psycho- HorrorGame welches ich jemals gespielt habe und empfehle die nichtmal 20 Euro jedem. 

PS: Anfangs ist das Game ein bisschen schwierig und man muss sich dran gewöhnen oft zu sterben.... :P

[h1][url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/258050][b]Survivor Squad[/b][/url] + [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/282070][b]This War of Mine[/b][/url] = [b]DARKWOOD[/b] !![/h1]


사실 이 게임은 모 BJ분이 방송하시는 것을 보고 알게되어 

[b][i]"와~ 재밌겠는데? 구입해 볼까! ..... 어라? 이미 라이브러리에 있었네!"[/i][/b]

하여 조금은 황당하게 시작한 게임이다. ( -__-; )


타이틀에 있듯 다크우드는 얼핏 서바이버 스쿼드와 흡사해 보이지만, 노골적으로 처음부터 좀비나 적들이 등장하지는 않는다. 초반엔 여기 저기 탐색하며 재료들을 모으고 거래를 하며 거처를 보수/방어하며 생존하는 느낌이 더 강하기 때문에 어떤 면에선 [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/219740][b]Don't Starve[/b][/url]의 요소도 들어있다고 볼 수 있다.

기본적인 그래픽이 훌륭한 편은 아니지만, 음향 요소가 강화되어 있어서 밤낮에 따라, 날씨환경에 따라 청각을 곤두세울 수 밖에 없도록 연출한 부분이 아주 훌륭하다.


크게 세 구역으로 나눌 수 있는 다크우드는 낮에는 그런 지역들을 탐험하며 새로운 지역을 발견하거나 재료들을 모으는 생존 성격의 게임이라면, 밤에는 그런 재료들을 통해 무기와 베이스를 강화하며 주변에 트랩을 설치함으로 정체 모를 이들의 침입으로부터 낮까지 버터야 하는 공포 게임으로 돌변한다.

때문에 긴장의 템포가 적절하게 유지되며 하루 하루 생존하는 것에 자연스럽게 몰입되는 재미가 있으며, 재료들을 통해 제작대를 업그레이드를 하며 제작할 수 있는 아이템이 늘어나면서 점점 생존이 쾌적해지고, 그를 통해 밝혀지지 않은 맵 이곳 저곳을 보다 수월하게 탐험하는 등 여러가지 재미 요소가 골고루 조화를 이루고 있다.


아직 정식으로 릴리즈하지 않은 얼리액세스 알파 버젼임에도 충분히 완성도 있게 만들어진 게임이기 때문에, 앞으로 과연 어떻게 보다 다듬어져 갈지 기대되는 게임이기도 하다.

생존 / 제작 / 공포 / 탐험 이런 복합장르적인 게임에서 볼 때 이만한 게임도 없다는 평가를 내리며 강력하게 추천을 드린다!


8/10

18167623.review:
In it's current state, I can honestly recommand this game for it's $15 price tag. But be warned, this game isn't for the faint hearted. But if you're looking for a great blend of survival and horror, this game may be what you're looking for, even in it's early alpha stage the game has quite a lot of content and replayability for you to enjoy.

The thrill of this game comes from a blend of sources, one being your own paranoid fear. The game has absolutely amazing atmosphere and uses a mixture of sounds, graphics and in-game mechanics to trigger and sustain a terrifying sense of forboding. Every day is spent preparing, preparing for the coming days, preparing for your future expeditions, preparing for the terrifying night to come and each update brings with it, it's own small sense of dread as you wonder whether or not it'll be a small fix or something that adds another horror for you to expeirence.

What little titbits of the game's universe I have expeirenced thus far have helped to produce a fractured but vivid scene of horror and mystery. Playing this game I feel compelled to save and quit, shelf it for another day due to the eerie vibe and horrors, but my curiosity gets the better of me and promotes me to push on for just one more day and since surviving each night, despite it's lack-luster tasks needed to do such a thing early on in the game, feels like an over-whelming achievement at first, it's hard to not take advantage of the day light you've just 'earned'.

I maybe over-selling this title with cheap emotive writing, but I have a love and bias for horror games with a terrifying atmosphere and this game fits in that category perfectly. Regardless, if I've interested you in any way, I strongly suggest you take a look at a more objective review of the game before deciding, as my goal with this review was to give you my emotive perspective after enjoying the title for a bit rather than my objective perspective. As always, knowledge and experience is a fear killer, so try to avoid looking at spoilers and playstyle guides until you get to experience a few days in-game by yourself first! Though if you're anything like me, the thrilling sense of forboding will always be there in some form or another.

17910748.review:
Ich weiss weder wer ich bin,noch weiß ich nicht wie ich hierher gekommen bin.
Alles was ich weiß oder glaube zu wissen ist,das es mit diesem Wald zusammen hängt. Ich glaube er lebt. 
Halten sie mich für verrückt? Glauben sie mir,dasselbe dachte ich von mir auch. Das meine Sinne mich verlassen und das ich Wahnsinnig werde.Irgendwas ist da draussen.Ich weiß nicht was es ist und ich möchte es auch nicht wissen,denn es jagt mir eine höllische Angst ein.Nur daran zu denken lässt mir einen eiskalten Schauer über den Rücken wandern. Wenn ich könnte,würde ich diese Hütte in der ich wach geworden bin, niemals verlassen. Doch der Selbsterhaltungstrieb führt mich raus, denn wenn ich hierbleibe,dann werde ich ebenfalls sterben.  Ich höre schon wieder diesen Hund in der Ferne bellen,der Wind der durch das Blattwerk braust,trägt es zu mir. Ich glaube er gehörte einem der Bewohner hier im Wald. Ich fand seine Überreste in der Ruine seines Hauses. Seine Leiche war mit den Wurzeln der Bäume überwuchert........... Oh Gott hilf mir..........Ich glaube der Wald ernährt sich von menschlichen Überresten...........
 Er war nicht der Einzige den ich tot vorfand. Überall liegen sie, verkrümmt und vertrocknet wie Mumien. Der ganze Wald riecht nach Tod. 
Irgendwas schleicht um meine Hütte. Es versucht nach drinnen zu gelangen und mich zu töten.Es kratzt an der Tür,ich kann es hören. Zum Glück fand ich gestern etwas Holz und Nägel in der näheren Umgebung, damit verbarrikadierte ich alle Fenster. Ein schwacher Trost. 
Ich muss mich beeilen, denn ich denke, das diese Barrikade nicht ewig Stand halten wird............. 
Ich muss einen Weg finden diesen verdammten Wald zu verlassen.

10 von 10 Punkten für diese wahnsinns Atmosphäre in dem Spiel. H.P. Lovecraft Fans werden sich hier Sauwohl fühlen. Die Stimmung seiner Geschichten, findet sich hier wieder.
Ich kann das Spiel nur jedem Horrorfan empfehlen.

17703035.review:
I really want to like this game, but try as I may, I just cannot.

Bought it way back in like 2015 when it was still in Alpha. Regardless of how much I try to play it, I just don't seem to like it unfortunately. "Unforgiving" is a word that's used a bit too literally in this game. It's not difficult to the point of wanting to retry things, it's difficult to the point of not wanting to attempt to play it at all (and before anyone says "git gud" — I'm a big fan of hard games, just not when they end up boring me), even on normal. The atmosphere is fantastic, but the pacing is so fucking slow that I can't play it for more than a couple minutes before I want to stop. Calling it a survival game but taking out the things that one needs to survive (food, water) and replacing them with just this system of using mushrooms that do not respawn is just an odd design choice to me, but some others may like it. It's survival in the sense of having to wait through a 10 minute night cycle by standing really close to an oven (why? I don't know.). Sure, the sound is fantastic as well, to the point where you don't dare venture outside during the night, and even moving in your own house is scary... but what does that accomplish? Night cycles don't seem to really DO anything. You hide in a corner and wait for the sun to come up, then flounce around a very "same-y" map for a while, and repeat. I don't get the fun aspect.


Regardless of how I feel about Darkwood, the developers are very open and kind to their customers, and constantly try to fix the game to please their fanbase, even when it meant putting in way more work than they were anticipating. I applaud that attitude and work ethic, and so I'll simply chock this game up to "not my style." I may not like it personally, but AcidWizard is a shining example of how a dev team SHOULD handle EA, the likes of which I've only seen by Hinterland behind The Long Dark.

17618835.review:
[h1]어두운 숲이 들려주는 극한의 청각적 공포. Darkwood[/h1]

다크우드, 2D 탑뷰형식 로그라이크 호러 게임이며 아직 알파단계인지라 약간의 버그와 미완성으로 보이는 면이 여럿 있지만, 완성도는 비교적 좋은 편이다. 방사능으로 피폭된 어두운 숲에서 물건을 모으고 집을 개조하여 살아남아야 하는 게임인 다크우드는, 기본적으로 매우 하드코어하다. 플레이어에게 처음으로 주어지는 건 하나도 없으며, 인벤토리, 맵, 아이템... 어떤 면에서든 자비없음이 무엇인지를 보여준다. 인벤토리는 그리 크지 않아서 필요한 아이템들을 모두 주워가기에는 부족하고 불편하게 느껴진다. 맵은 대략적으로만 표기될 뿐, 나머지는 플레이어의 기억력과 방향감각에 의존해야하며, 필요한 아이템은 정말 한두가지가 아닌데, 기본적인 무기조차도 구하기 쉽지 않고, 다른 NPC와의 교환 가격도 꽤나 비싸 아이템을 구하는데에 있어서도 꽤나 애로사항이 많다. 이렇듯, 다크우드는 정말 플레이어에게 일말의 배려라는 게 없는 게임이다. 이 하드코어한 게임의 구성은 플레이어간의 취향을 강하게 타고, 호불호가 갈리기 쉬운 편이므로 구매 직전에 플레이 영상을 조금 보도록 하는 걸 추천한다.

게임 자체는 수집, 생존에 주 목적을 두고 있으며, 이런 소재를 가진 게임이나, 어두운 면이 강하게 부각되어 있는 게임을 좋아하는 플레이어들 에게도 추천할 만 하다. 어떤 사람이 이 게임을 구입하고, 플레이하게 될지는 모르지만, 이 게임에는 정말 한 가지 만큼은 장담할 수 있는 컨텐츠가 있다.

2D 게임임에도 불구하고, 이 게임은 정말 입체적이고 강렬한 사운드와 게임 컨셉에 잘 부합하는 분위기로 플레이어들을 압박한다. 모든 사운드가 정말 실제소리에 가까운 수준의 퀄리티를 자랑하며 이 게임의 60~70 퍼센트는 사운드가 잡고 있다고 해도 과언이 아닐 정도다. 직접 헤드셋을 쓰고, 게임 소리를 올리고, 방의 불을 끈 뒤 플레이 해보면 확실히 체감할 수 있으며, 미세한 소리 하나하나에 놀라고, 공포를 느끼며 모든 신경을 곤두세운 상태로 어두운 숲을 탐험하는 자신을 보게될 것이다.

17414791.review:
Darkwood goes off a very lesser followed road for a horror game.
Instead of your average jump scares and cheap sound effects, the game will take it to a whole new level of what truly can be lurking in the dark.

Personally a few things I very much like about the game so far has been the Sound. Sound is practically everything in a game besides the basic functionalities, in Darkwood, if you hear that twig snap, that means either you, or something else has just walked over it. You hear that thing that went bump in the night? Odds are it's something that very much would like to see you deceased. This was a trait that keeps me on edge when playing and definitely caught my attention during my time playing it.

The overall Graphics is simplistic in design, yet complex and very well thought-out. Instead of making the game a simple First-Person or even a normal third-person game. The Acid Wizards took it up a notch by using a top-down view of your character. Trees are very detailed in perspective and as you hover your mouse over them, they will disappear as your character gains vision to that specific area, leaving other areas not in your field of view cone covered by a dense brush of trees and other foliage, this makes the game very unique as it can leave you unaware of what might be hiding underneath that treeline you have come across and very may well be your final mistake.

Keeping an eye on this game as since the initial 1.0 Alpha version it has come a very long way from then and the developers have introduced many more features to it, let alone improving overall performance and enjoyability. However it should be noted heavily that as the game states, it is very unforgiving and one wrong move can easily spell your doom.

17278679.review:
Let's just get one thing straight.
Darkwood is a brutal game. A REALLY brutal game.
If you love challanges, this game is definitely for you.

If you're into zombie/scavanger type survival games this is definitely a must have then.

Let's start off with with this game is

Darkwood is a horror game that only goes well if you plan ahead of time. 

After the prologue tutorial, you play as a man with very little amounts of resources to start off with. You run around in the day time looking for wood, nails, just about anything you can fit into your invetory screen as almost all of it is important. Eventually, you'll notice that you have to go back to your hide out before night fall to drink from a well and hole up in your home. This is where it get's really interesting, and where most of your strategic planning comes into play. 

During the night, you'll be forced to drink from a well just outside your house, which enables you to live through the night. If you don't drink from the well in-time though, you'll start losing health untill you do. So don't travel to far out without a watch (Which you must find, or buy. You don't start off with one), or a decent sense of how long it takes to reach night time. After you drink from the well, you're most likely going to run back into your home. You can close the doors, block the hole up in your house with your furniture, and barricade the doors and windows with either panks of wood, or just more furniture. Next, you can lay traps that you may have found on your journey, arm yourself with any weapons you have crafted or found, and after alllll of that, you're going to sit, and wait for morning. And wait... and wait... oh god what are those foot steps I'm hearing? What is that growling sound? Jeezes what's with all the crows? Oh shit something is inside the house

With that being said, the game has a stealth mechanic to it. Monsters have to know where you are in order to attack you. Sure they spawn outside the house at night, but they don't know your exact location yet. First off, monsters listen for your foot steps. Step to close to one that's just on the other side of the wall, and he's going to know where you are.    break into your house, and start looking for you. You can hide behind furniture, or lock yourself in another room though, maybe set up a trap at the door way. 

Oh, I forgot to mention, during the night, assuming you've already found out how mushrooms and leveling up work, you're going to occasionally be attacked by shadows. It won't happen every night, just every now and then. Every hide out has a generator that produces electricity for your lamps. You need gasoline (fuel) to make it work though, so don't forget to turn those things on before you go into hiding. Any source of will keep the shadows from hurting you during the night, be it flares, flashlight (Though that requires some aiming) or just lighting a fire with some gasoline.

After every night, during the morning of the next day, you're going to be visited by "The three." These guys are going to end up being your main source of resources later on down the road.  And time for the game will freeze for the morning, meaning you have time to replace those busted barricades, and rearange your furniture for the next night.

Now you can travel outside during the night. In which case you'll find more mushrooms growing about then usual (These also grow in your house) , as well as a plethora of deadly enemies. (This is not recommended at all. At any point in the game. Seriously, don't leave your hide out.)

Your day time scavenging is done once again, maybe you finished a quest line, and now you're prepared to wait out the next night... Oh joy, the fog is here and the shadows are approaching! ... wait, where are the shadows? And why is the house making all kinds of shaking noises? Why is all the furniture moving?! I need those!! HOLY SH-

This game will scare you, endlessly. It will kill you, repeatedly untill you figure out how to really survive. You will be paranoid about every place you go and every night you have to live through.

Oh, did I mention this game features a perma death mode? If you thought this game was scarey before, try playing it without dieing once. That makes it more heart pounding then ever, as one mistake could be your last, and you'll lose every bit of progress you had made. You don't have to play perma-death, you can leave it off. When you die, you'll be able to loot your corpse, and just continue on with the days. This isn't always helpful though, if you die far off from your hide out around a heavily guarded area, you're going to have a really hard time getting your stuff back and might just have to go on without it for a while.

This game is one of the most interesting survival horror games out there, and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good scare and action/creepy/strategically decided adventure.

I can tell all of the 'thumbs down' votes I get are fanboys who have buyers remorse but don't want to admit it, and want to think they've purchased a good game. Sorry kids, but you didn't. Everything in this review is completely accurate, so your downvotes just show your immaturity.

A game with great art style, but tarnished by the lack of thought put behind it. Everything in this game aesthetically is amazing.

However I will not recommend this game, for it is far too unfinished and completely unthoughtful with the design choice.

-The UI is just bad. Get rid of it.
-The game is far too unforgiving, and you have to complete extremely tedious tasks to survive. Oh, by the way, when nightfall hits, you must have drank from a certain well prior to nightfall, and be inside. Before nightfall.
-Days only last about 5 or so minutes, so good luck getting anything done within that amount of time.
-The story is completely scattered and difficult to follow. Most of the time it just doesn't make sense.

I had high hopes when I bought the game. It looked great in the trailer, but I'll tell you, this game is nothing like what the trailer shows. I think that's where they pull people in. I understand you would want your game to be challenging, but there's honestly just fake difficulty put into the game. When I say that, I mean the monsters are just straight up overpowered. They're faster than you, they're stronger, and they don't give up. If you don't have a chance, there's a major error in your game. Almost all of the locations in the game are copy/pasted, which makes for an extremely difficult time navigating where you have, and haven't been. The map is.. atrocious, to say the least, and completely inaccurate as to the locations of certain places. Pro tip: Don't listen to where the characters in game tell you to go to find a certain location, they literally have no idea where the place they told you to go is. I've been told that some person I was supposed to meet is East. I head East as far as the map would let me. Nothing there. Okay, I'll just back track a bit and try to broaden my sweep. Still nothing. After giving up I start to wander. I found the place all the way southwest on the map. I'm not kidding. There's so much more crap to this but I don't really feel like typing about it anymore, even giving it this much of a review is giving it too much credit. 

Bottom line: The game is crap, design is crap, very cool art style, devs are crap (Meaning they almost never update the game, and when they do, they are miniscule updates that almost always wipe your progress even when they say it won't).

Don't buy this game. It's nowhere near worth what they're asking for. I've seen tighter free-to-play games than this.

16986206.review:
The only way that this game can be described is impressive to the largest degree.  This is hands down the most crafted, perfected, and enjoyable early access experience that has been released in the history of steam's early access system.  I have dumped around 17 hours into the game, and I would check in and play a little after every update to see the changes that have been made.  Amazingly, the devs have kept up incredibly well with updates, and in the many months that I have owned this title, it has become a very different game, and all for the better.  The atmosphere is incredible and haunting right down to the core.  This is aided by the fact that your character has a limited cone of view.  How so, you might ask?  Though you can see things like trees and large rocks outside of the cone, you cannot see things like items, characters, or enemies, meaning that one of the many creative and challenging enemies in the game can still sneak up and attack you if you are careless.  The way this is implemented is masterful to say the least.

The game demands that you be conservative with your resources, often making you choose between upgrading your weapon, upgrading your workbench to allow you to create more weapons and items, or fortifying your base to keep the mutated nightmares at bay once the sun goes down.  And the night time changes everything in the game.  Whereas in the day you can travel in relative safety and strategically kill or avoid most enemies that you come accross, the night turns you into the prey of the creatures that lurk through the forest.  Not only will monsters invade your home and attack you at night, but depending on whether or not you have any fuel in your generator, dark shadows will close in on you and kill you, and are a threat that can only be fought off with a light source.  While the early game will find you cowering in your home praying for morning light, you will later gather the resources and the courage to venture from your home at night, during which special and unique items and resources may be collected.

Lastly, the sound design: HOLY HELL, the sound design in this game is PERFECT.  From the hair raising squeal that grounded objects such as stools and wardrobes make when dragging them accross the floor to the haunting moans and screaches of the night, this game will keep you scared and on your toes, especially at night.  Take it from me, when you are cowering in your room with the door baricaded with the wardrobe while not straying more than two feet from your light source, and then you hear the slow creaking of the other doors of your home opening at the will of murderous, rabid invaders, you will feel a fear for your life the likes of which very few games can produce.

If I were to summarize this game in one statement, I would say that this is the most fun I've had from a horror game since Dead Space.  At $15, this game is currently an absolute steal, and even more so when the final version is released.  If you want a horror experience that is original, extremely well produced, and scary as all hell, do yourself a favor and PICK THIS GAME UP.

16442256.review:
Every morning three tree beards show up with a sack full of garbage to collect my recycling.

A survival horror game with strong atmosphere and a solid mystery.  Allies, enemies or neutral NPC's are all richly crafted with impressive art styles.  Even the clues you find around the world are often unnerving.  It's in Early Access with only one chapter available but the game offers hours of intrigue and 'side quests' to complete each with their own rewards and/or consequences.  Each one feels like a new faustian deal.

All enemies are potentially lethal but with the right knowledge and preparation they can be ended just as fast as they can end you.  But one mistake can cost you dearly.  Surviving the nights and managing your resources carefully in a hostile environment adds to the tension of your imprisonment with these monsters.

The game also offers a double edged perks and flaws system.  The more you dose yourself up with the mutagenic flora the more potent perks you gain access to but with those perks come equally debilitating flaws.  The choice of how deep you wish jump into this doomed progression is completely up to you.

As a long term fan and writer of supernatural thrillers and atmospheric stories I recommend this game to those also interested in such.  Despite its simple appearance and modest development team it follows through.

15970609.review:
This is [b]Alpha[/b], so by no means should any of this be [i]entirely[/i] accurate after the release.

With that said, I've never been more impressed with so little time spent in a game. I have over 120 games, console games, BIG gamer in general. My favorite genre is rogue-like, survival, and strategy, so low and behold this would be of interest to me.

I know what survival games entail. Luck and balls. Walk out, get the stuff, get back before dark. Not much to it, but it's still entertaining. The one thing games like that, in general, lack is reality. Darkwood takes things some much further and differently.

Darkwood is the freeroam, pain-stakingly hard game I've searched for for a long time. They play on fears, and best of all, make things very new and real. Everything is made to scare you. Your map is realistic, where you don't have your exact locations, but you navigate via landmark. Combat is difficult, fair, aggrivating, and rewarding. Permadeath features (the rogue-like special) keeps things fresh and more valuable. Resources are far and few between, making things even more difficult.


Everything plays off each other. Everything will come for you. Everything about this game is worth it.

15783600.review:
So, I invested 31 days (in game time) to one world, thinking I could go through it and get some of the many endings this game provides. 

On the 30th day I go into a hellish pigshed and find a monstrosity that no words can describe, the only way of ending said creature (besides being insane and fighting it directly) was to electricute it.

In order to do this I needed a particular cable that was sold by a good buddy of mine called Piotrek, whom I had just given all the items to for the rocket he was building.

At the time he was really excited about this and told me that by tomorrow he was going to fly to the moon or something of that sort.

What was unknown to him was that I had allowed the Wolfman to see one of the components to his rocket (I had no clue that this would cause the ship to explode, sadly.) So the very next day I walk to  Piotrek's house only to see him dead on the ground, skewered by the many pieces of shrapnel that came out of the exploding pile of junk.

In a flood of sadness and fury, I head over back to the wolf camp and began talking to my partner in crime, whom was sh*tting himself in laughter after seeing the explosion.

Once I realized that I wasn't able to finish off the monstrosity, I stride behind the Wolfman, brought out my pistol and put a bullet into the back of his head.

I then promptly loot the dead man's body and walk out into the middle of the meadow as I waited for the time to tick away.

As the sun set I felt my body begin to corrode away until my heart stopped, and I fell to the ground dead.

I'm sorry, Piotrek.

15467242.review:
****Early Access****
[h1]  Introduction            [/h1]
	Darkwood is an atmospheric and insanely hard survival game. It is in Early Access and this means many of the features are missing, but the developers have said they will be adding plenty of more features in upcoming updates. Putting the fact that the game is not finished aside, I really can find much wrong with Darkwood. One of the main things is that I would like to see controller support. I like playing top-down games with a controller, but this doesn’t mean the keyboard controls are bad. (They are rather good) The Developers answer the question [i] “Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access? [/i] with this [i] “About a year (counting from July 2014), although that depends on a lot of things which will become clear during Early Access.” [/i]. With this info in mind, they have a long way to go in a short amount of time.

 [h1] Pros              [/h1]      
[list]      
    [*]Procedurally generated maps
    [*]Crafting
    [*]Combat feels impactful and smooth
    [*]Leveling system 
    [*]Decent amount of graphics options 
    [*]The main concept of Darkwood is very promising 
    [*]Amazing atmosphere
   
 [/list]      
      
[h1] Cons             [/h1]      
[list]       
    [*]No controller support 
    [*]Feature are limited in this stage of development (Will be fixed in the future)
    [*]No tutorial (Devs say this will be added soon)
    [*]May be too HARD


 [/list]      
    
[h1]  Conclusion                [/h1]    
	 Darkwood is a very promising, atmospheric and insanely hard survival game. If you are into the super hard/rouge-like games, Darkwood is definitely for you. Before you buy this game, just keep in mind that it is in early access and it is missing a large amount of content at the time of writing this review. If you are okay with waiting for the rest of the content, you should get Darkwood. It is a very promising Early Access game.

WHAT
this is a surreal psychological horror game where you survive the wierd world that is darkwood

STORY
the story is interesting and and quite dark ,but is just the first chapter

COMBAT
the combat is tricky at first you aren't supposed to run in and buttonmash that will get you killed faster than you can say "f*ck off!!!!!". It is ment to be strategic and slow paced you attack when you have the opportunity: get one hit in, gtfo and wait for another chance

DAY/NIGHT
now the biggest thing about this game that makes it interesting is the day/night cycle. In the day you scavange for supplies and fuel to keep your hideout in shape and your generator running so you can progress to the next area and hideout. At night however it varies from nothing happening at all to your furniture flying all over the place to savages breaking down your baracedes
 
DIFFICULTY
at first it has a steep learning curve and i would suggest watching a lets play if you are held back by this, however if you are awesome you will just learn it through either trial and error or the wiki page in another tab while you are playing

DEVS
constent updates keeps the game alive with gameplay changes bugfixes and overhauls the dev team has done a great job with keeping it fresh and i can't wait to see the full version

THIS GAME IS AWESOME BUY IT NOW!!!!

So, for the record i havent finished this game yet. It may just be me but they probably need to put up a disclamer at the begining of the game to say that its hard coz jebus is this game hard. from that taste of story i have gotten so far, the plot itself seems very vague but focused at the same time, it would be great to see another game from Acid Wizard set in the same universe as Darkwood. 

my few itches that havent been scratched yet are the map mechanics, if there was a way to get your exact position on the map to show up that would totally open up the game, being in an area with no aparent landmarks with the sun going down and the "locals" crawling out of their hidey holes is both terrifing and frustrating. also, (quick note) the whole drinking from the well at the begining of the night is anoying. the threat of being hunted my monsters and the like is hard enough, and having that extra pressure of drinking from the well push's me as the player, closer to the keyboard smashing phase of frustration. It replaces the fear of the monsters with the fear of the insta-death-dehydration. if there was a drink bottle that you could use once a night, allowing you to hold up in other buildings overnight would make the whole "lost and trapped in the scary woods" more punctual.

This game deservse more attention, being able to scare players from a 'topdown' perspective is a hard thing to do and Acid Wizard has done this well. However although there isnt much ingame punishment for dying, you should be afraid of it, due to it making the game loose pace and in some cases, die alltogether.

Overall, the creepy and interesting plot, and clever rpg-survival mechanics have kept me returning to this gem, every once in a while.

15109950.review:
Eight months after my initial purchase and after 48 hours of total playtime, I've finally decided to write a review. This is also my first review for any game, which should give a hint right off the bat of how strongly I feel.

The most common complaint I've seen is that Darkwood is too hard. And this game is, in fact, HARD.

HARD.

HARD.

Got it? Good. I'm not joking! Unless you play stuff like Dark Souls (a direct inspiration for this game), then this will likely be the toughest game you'll ever play. Period. It will also likely be the scariest. Playing on perma death only, it took me 40 hours just to beat the game. And I've yet to turn over every rock, discover every secret.

But I don't think that it's fair to give the game a negative review because it's too difficult. If Darkwood was any easier it wouldn't be Darkwood. It would be Flaccidwood, and it would be boring and not very scary.

If you play the prologue, you will not be in the Dark (pun intended) when you first awake in your little hut. Granted, you will need to move quickly, explore locations as you find them, and avoid anything with teeth, BUT you will be able to do so with a grasp of basic mechanics and controls. Just make sure to return to your hovel before nightfall. Believe me, I've played games with far less introduction and instruction.

Now that that's out of the way, it's time to talk about the game, the real meat-and-potatoes. The concept is simple -- escape a little slice of densely-forrested rural Poland. Standing in your way are packs of roving mutations, insane NPC's, and a whole lotta beartraps.

There's a lot of ways to die. Mauled by ravenous dogs, mauled by *bigger* ravenous dogs, beaten to death by naked dudes with sticks, pelted with rocks, torn in half by creepy-crawlers with a whole bunch of teeth,, poisoned by shrooms, stepping on beartraps, and, if you're like me, you'll probably end up setting yourself on fire a few times.

But it's not all bad news. You can cook the indigenous mushrooms growing around the forest and shoot them up to improve your skills and such. Well, I mean, you'll suffer from terrible drug-induced nightmares in the process, but now you can put more stuff in your hotbar! Hooray!

Oh, and did I mention the Banshee? Yeah, wait till she pays you a visit. It took her about 35 hours to find me, but when she did, I didn't sleep for a few days afterwards.

Anyway, Darkwood is really, REALLY scary and unique. So pick it up. And say hi on the forums :). The devs are very active there and are always looking for suggestions.

-- UPDATE #1 --

Wow, it's been a while. I knew I would have to update the review as development progressed, but I decided to wait until a huge update before adding on. Well, this is the time!

Darkwood is now in Alpha 7.0 -- 3 versions past the build this review was written for.

The changes are simply too numerous for me to point out in this review. So, I will instead try to give you, the potential buyer, an idea of the sheer scope of this game's continuing evolution:

-- Entirely redone and rebalanced crafting that now revolves around your workbench
-- Complete overhaul of the (previously unstable) weapon balance
-- Complete revamp and expansion of NPC dialogue and the story
-- New minor locations
-- A new village area with a ton of NPC's and background story
-- New nighttime events

Smart money is betting that Chapter 1 is nearly finished, and thus Chapter 2 could be coming shortly. Better yet, with all of the groundwork and mechanics finished, work on the following chapter(s) should progress quickly.

Darkwood is a prime example of how EA should be done -- a dedicated dev team taking the community's feedback and continuously using it to build the game up. I look forward to what the future of Darkwood holds!

15100901.review:
The game went into early access in July 2014. I can't say I know what it was like back then but from what I've seen as of patch 3.1-4.0 I was very impressed!

For a top down game it is very atmospheric and scary. Gameplay consists of searching for resources during the day and defending your hideout at night. If you somehow manage to find the time then also progressing the plot.

Resources don't respawn and you need them to survive the nights so you will inevitably be forced to advance deeper into the forest to a new hideout and continously search for a way to escape the forest before you are overwhelmed or run out of resources.

In patch 3.1 it was easy to survive by pulling a wardrobe into a corner with you boxed in to be safe. However as of patch 4.1 poltergeists throw around the furniture if you do this and the noise attracts more monsters. Players can survive by barricading windows and doors, setting traps, lighting the house with a gas generator, igniting enemies with strategically placed gasoline and a lit match, and fighting with a variety of melee weapons and if you are lucky maybe a gun

The game has optional permadeath and the enemies are extremely dangerous. You never feels safe and every day feels like a mad rush for resources. However for me this was a negative as the constant day to day rushing made me feel like I don't have time to soak the atmosphere or proceed with caution. Days are slightly longer in 4.1 however... I would like to see a system where time passes as the player advances from one location to another and once the player reaches a location like, say, the burned houses then time becomes normal until the player leaves, giving the player time to explore carefully

It is in mid alpha right now, and I feel they should have progressed to beta by now but not that it is way too slow either. The devs are very communicative and take criticism into account very well. They tend to reply to post in most topics and never get mad even at people who are trolling

I'd say this is one of the games worth paying to get at early access, but I don't want to encourage early access so for those who like games like dark souls, survival games and roguelikes definetly get it when it is released :D
